story_txt:
Short Summary
The Startup Leap gives you the roadmap for your successful startup while training you to avoid potholes. This book shares everything that you need to know before you take the startup leap, by giving you insights and learnings from unique real-founder experiences, teaching you how to find structure in the chaotic initial phases, and ensuring that you avoid common mistakes that first-time founders make.My name is Uttara and I am the author of The Startup Leap. I wrote this book because I wanted to create a framework for the startup building process. No two startups are ever built the same way, but most of them go through similar journeys. I wanted to pen down these journeys in phases to give you an insight into what makes a company successful in each phase. I wrote this book as a short, go-to guide for myself to pick up when I build my own tech startup. If you find yourself in the shoes of an aspiring startup founder, you can use this book as your shortcut to success too! In this book, you'll hear stories such as...

The story of Aditya Sharma, who co-founded a wildly successful online merchandising store in India called The Souled Store.
The story of Victoria Livschitz, who used her innovative, technical mind to build and grow Grid Dynamics, an IT services company, which eventually lead to an IPO.
The story of Joon Beh, whose startup product, Hallo, was simply a function of a personal problem that he could closely relate to and wanted to solve.  

The Startup Leap is a nonfiction book that speaks to aspiring startup founders. My aim for this book is simple - To bring great value to my readers by being crisp and to the point in every chapter, while accessorizing liberally with real-world anecdotes of the failures and successes experienced by real founders from various backgrounds/industries to make the book engaging. This short ~150-page book is all you need to get started, so get your hands on it already!

 
The Book - The Startup Leap
The book is written in 4 parts.Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters on what you, as an aspiring founder, need to know about before you even get started on your startup journey. Think of this phase as getting into the nitty-gritty before you get your hands dirty. In this phase, you will learn how to come up with the perfect startup idea, get into the right mindset to set yourself up for success, create a flawless business plan, and find a strong partnership with co-founders.Part 2 contains the chapters that guide you on how to begin setting up your startup to be able to find Product-Market Fit. You will learn how to go lean on your proof of concept, how to engage with potential customers, which metrics to track for traction, and how to find the right set of advisors as you gradually build iterative versions of your product.Part 3 will teach you how to keep your startup afloat once you find some traction. You will learn about the various ways to delight your customers with your product, learn how to market your product, build a motivated and driven team, and find and follow the patterns that work for you, which will eventually lead you to Product-Market Fit.And finally, Part 4 is a bonus! In this part, I’ve broken the pattern to give you some of the most insightful learnings from the failures that founders I interviewed experienced during their startup journeys, straight from the horses’ mouths! This part is short but as valuable to learn as the others.
 
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling before publication.
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in winter 2021.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Uttara is a Software Engineer who has worked at Amazon for 7+ years, where she has built multiple services to help millions of Amazon customers live better lives. She loves software design, and the engineer in her likes to break complex things down into simple, easily understandable pieces. Uttara is writing this book as a way for herself to understand the simple building blocks that go into building a successful startup. story:
Hello everyone, my name is Stephen Howard, and I am the author of The City of Snow & Stars. It has now been seven months since the book debuted, book two is in the works, as is the audiobook. Now, after speaking with New Degree Press (my publisher) they are helping me create a special 1yr Anniversary Edition of the book that will have illustrations.

I'm beyond excited! 

Tackling issues of abuse, human trafficking, and the question "Why does God let bad things happen?" has raised some eyebrows, but the response from readers is beyond encouraging:

 

  • "Heartfelt and action-packed, The City of Snow & Stars weaves a moving tale of holding onto hope through the darkest of times. If you want a book with a superb story that will leave you breathless, look no further." - Angela R. Watts, bestselling author of Golgotha
  • "It is so real, so ugly, so honest, so human, and so gorgeous. It is so broken and that's how the light gets in.." - M.L. Little, author of the Seventh Realm trilogy
  • "This definitely has a Lord of the Rings feel to it.." - Babbling Books Blog
  • "The City of Snow & Stars is an enthralling story that will leave you wanting the second book in your hands as soon as humanely possible."  - Ellie Marshall, Amazon Review


Each of these has a special place in my heart, and more and more are coming in. It made every moment of writing this book worth it ❤

We're now embarking on the next amazing step of the journey by doing what few indie authors get to do with a book: getting it illustrated.
 

If you have not had the chance to read the book yet, check this out:

 

Summary

A gritty YA Christian Fantasy tackling difficult topics surrounding abuse, human trafficking, and the question "Why does God let bad things happen?"

Trinia’s Gift is the ability to duplicate herself perfectly in mind and body yet, every time she uses it, she feels like she loses another piece of her soul. Her abusive and power-hungry father, Caderyn, wishes to exploit her gift to create an army that obeys his command and rebuild the Airgíd Empire that fell a thousand years before.

Going on the run, Trinia seeks out the aid of the kingdoms that destroyed her people. When things don’t go as planned, she’s forced into trusting a failed mage, a man of legend with a vendetta, and a talking wolf to help her reach her goal by making a promise she isn’t sure she can keep.

As she wrestles with the ghosts of her past trauma and new ones that keep piling up, Trinia begins to wonder where the justice is in it all, and whether she has what it takes to stop her father and save her people.

-II-

Filled with sweeping landscapes, horrifying creatures, and rich history, this first book in the Cities of Wintenaeth trilogy takes you on the journey of a lifetime.

If you love books by Ted Dekker, Bryan Davis, or Stephen R. Lawhead, you'll enjoy The City of Snow & Stars.

Grab your copy and join the growing community of readers!

Ebook or Paperback

 

Concept art from chapter 1

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $3k and the book gets published (this is the minimum needed)

Tier 2: Hit $4k and we get a special edition map for the inside of the book (example below)

Tier 3: Hit $5k and we get 5 additional illustrations added to the book

Tier 4: Hit $6k and everyone gets digital character art of their favorite character.

Tier 5: Hit $7k and it helps me run a marketing campaign for the book

Tier 6: Hit 9k and I turn my "Getting Your Story Started Worksheets" into a workbook that everyone would get.

 

I will publish this book with New Degree Press, and I've set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Illustrator I will work with to come up with the illustrations for inside the book.
  • The NEW Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (making sure the pictures look right).
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts (including shipping) for my book when I ultimately publish this December 2021.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the concept art and cover design.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Stephen Howard is an Author, Developmental Editor, and Author Coach running his own business, The Editing Bard. As passionate as he is about writing his book, Stephen started his business with the goal of helping others achieve their publishing dreams and put their best books forward.

In 2016, Stephen had a number of suppressed trauma memories resurface, which led him to ask God why He’d let it all happen. Over the years, and with a lot of therapy, God finally gave him a personalized answer that helped not only heal from the abuses, but showed how He was using it to bring healing to others.

He lives in Eastern Oregon with his family, loves Lord of the Rings, and has way too many books (although he would argue that's not possible).

For more information, you can connect with Stephen here.

story:
Summary

    My name is Michael Chidester. I started HEMA in 2001, and for the past ten years, I've been leading a project called Wiktenauer. Wiktenauer grew out of a desire to set the text of our fencing manuals free from the page and put it into the hands of fencers. What I'd like to do with this project is slightly different: put the page, and the whole book, into your hands as well. We're going to produce a full facsimile of one of the most important 15th century fencing treatises, the copy of Fior di Battaglia held by the J. Paul Getty Museum in sunny Malibu, California (ms. Ludwig XV 13).

    Facsimile is a word that's thrown around a lot, and means different things to different people. What I mean when I use it is a careful reproduction of the entire physical book in detail. Such facsimiles are often produced of famous manuscripts and early printed books for collectors, and they are also exhibited by museums and libraries in cases where the original can't or shouldn't be displayed.

    In other words, it's a book you can pick up and touch without endangering something priceless, but which will at least half-convince you that you're holding the original.

    At various times, I have had the privilege of handling several 15th and 16th century fencing manuscripts, as well as copies of most of the printed fencing manuals published before 1600, and I wish everyone in HEMA could have that same chance. It's a way of connecting to history that's hard to describe. A good facsimile can capture at least a small piece of that magic, and give you a sense of what the origin of our fencing reconstruction really is.


    Comparing the New Haven Gladiatoria manuscript (top) to the Orbis Pictus facsimile of the Kraków Gladiatoria (bottom).

    There are many treatises worthy of this sort of project, but in the past only two have received it: the Gladiatoria manuscript held by the Biblioteka Jagiellońska in Kraków, Poland, and Walpurgis Fechtbuch, held by the Royal Armouries in Leeds, UK. Last fall, we set about producing a third one:  Hans Talhoffer's manuscript Thott 290 2º, held by Det Kongelige Bibliotek in København, Denmark.


    The 2020 Talhoffer facsimile.

    This effort succeeded beautifully, and reviews of the Talhoffer facsimile have been glowing. (You can read some of them below.) I said at the time that if it succeeded, it would be the first of many. The second of many, then, will be Fiore.

    Fior di Battaglia is a beautiful illuminated manuscript created in Venice or Padua in the first decade of the 15th century. It is written on vellum in a Friulian dialect of Italian, using a humanistic hand. Its position as the oldest surviving Italian fencing treatise (or a copy thereof), as well as the oldest illustrated treatise covering each of its weapons, makes it one of the most important historical fencing manuals in existence.

    It is particularly prized by students of its author, Fiore dei Liberi, because by many metrics it is the most comprehensive copy of his teachings, containing the most text if not the most illustrations. (I personally prefer the Morgan Library and Museum's copy, but at less than half the length of the Getty's, and lacking several weapons, it wouldn't make a very impressive facsimile.)
     

    What We Need & What You Get

    Facsimiles like this are usually quite expensive. For example, the Orbis Pictus Gladiatoria cost about $900, while the Extraordinary Editions I.33 was released in two different editions, costing around $1,000 and $2,000. Facsimiles for more famous or lavish manuscripts can run into the five figure range.

    One of my objectives in the Talhoffer project was to see how inexpensively such a book can be produced. I selected Grimm Book Bindery in Madison, Wisconsin, to do the printing and binding, and spent quite a bit of time discussing the project with them and ironing out every detail to be as precise as possible.


    The cover of the Talhoffer facsimile, including the original blind-tooled design and the title applied by a later owner.

    This time around, we've worked out the basic process, so I'm going to try for even more minute accuracy:

    • The book will be approximately the same size as the original (to within about a centimeter).
    • Most of the Getty's scans are offered for free online with an open license, but I've also purchased and licensed scans of the two text-only pages and thirteen blank pages (which aren't online), so we can get an accurate look at the manuscript from cover to cover.
    • We can't use real vellum, and even if we could, the skin's pattern would clash with the pattern that's already on the Getty scans. So instead, I bought a sheet of goatskin parchment and sent it to the binder so they could figure out a paper that matches the weight and feel of it as closely as possible.
    • We're going to replicate the actual quire structure of the manuscript, so all the pages will be center-sewn and bound in the exact same way as the original, tipped-in pages and all.
    • We'll be using the same 7-8 mm boards as in the Talhoffer facsimile (which are about 3 times thicker than today's book covers).
    • The covers will be made of goatskin leather, with the blind-tooling (imprinted design) on the current cover replicated, as before.


    I haven't decided on what the cover will look like, but I have two candidates. One is the actual current cover, which only dates back to the 18th or 19th century (possibly ordered by Thomas Phillips). The other is a typical Biblioteca Estense binding, such as the manuscript might have been given if/when it entered Niccolo d'Este's library in the first place; this one's problematic because nearly all of these bindings date to the 18th century, and I haven't been able to determine whether this style is based on an older design that might have been around in the 15th.

     


    The brown cover is what the manuscript currently has, whereas the red cover is what it might have had in the 1400s (but I can't be sure).

    To create this book, we need a minimum of 100 orders, so I have set the funding goal accordingly. The Talhoffer facsimile was sold for $150, and with unexpected costs and overruns (and a few unplanned last-minute improvements) it very nearly ended up in the red.     The cost of these books depends on volume, so it will be a one-and-done print run, and people who don't order now will not have a chance again (unless we can scrape together another 100 orders). Another major lockdown in the autumn is still a possibility in these uncertain times, and in that case, we'll be lucky to have the books by spring.

    If you can't contribute to this project, please spread the word anyway. I have no doubt that there are 100 people who would love to own this book, but I may not be able to find them all myself. We got 300 orders for the Talhoffer facsimile, so let's see if there are at least that many Fiorists out there!

    Please share this campaign with your clubs, with your friends, and on social media!

Its quality is quite high and exactly what you would expect for the price, and the experience of paging through a manuscript is invaluable for researchers of fight books. I plan to purchase each edition as they come out, even if the book is outside my typical study, and recommend you do the same."

    ~ Jess Finley, author of Medieval Wrestling

Summary
My name is Michael Chidester. I started HEMA in 2001, and for the past ten years, I've been leading a project called Wiktenauer. Wiktenauer grew out of a desire to set the text of our fencing manuals free from the page and put it into the hands of fencers. What I'd like to do with this project is slightly different: put the page, and the whole book, into your hands as well. We're going to produce a full facsimile of one of the most important 15th century fencing treatises, the copy of Fior di Battaglia held by the J. Paul Getty Museum in sunny Malibu, California (ms. Ludwig XV 13).
Facsimile is a word that's thrown around a lot, and means different things to different people. What I mean when I use it is a careful reproduction of the entire physical book in detail. Such facsimiles are often produced of famous manuscripts and early printed books for collectors, and they are also exhibited by museums and libraries in cases where the original can't or shouldn't be displayed.
In other words, it's a book you can pick up and touch without endangering something priceless, but which will at least half-convince you that you're holding the original.
At various times, I have had the privilege of handling several 15th and 16th century fencing manuscripts, as well as copies of most of the printed fencing manuals published before 1600, and I wish everyone in HEMA could have that same chance. It's a way of connecting to history that's hard to describe. A good facsimile can capture at least a small piece of that magic, and give you a sense of what the origin of our fencing reconstruction really is.
Comparing the New Haven Gladiatoria manuscript (top) to the Orbis Pictus facsimile of the Kraków Gladiatoria (bottom).
There are many treatises worthy of this sort of project, but in the past only two have received it: the Gladiatoria manuscript held by the Biblioteka Jagiellońska in Kraków, Poland, and Walpurgis Fechtbuch, held by the Royal Armouries in Leeds, UK. Last fall, we set about producing a third one:  Hans Talhoffer's manuscript Thott 290 2º, held by Det Kongelige Bibliotek in København, Denmark.
The 2020 Talhoffer facsimile.
This effort succeeded beautifully, and reviews of the Talhoffer facsimile have been glowing. (You can read some of them below.) I said at the time that if it succeeded, it would be the first of many. The second of many, then, will be Fiore.
Fior di Battaglia is a beautiful illuminated manuscript created in Venice or Padua in the first decade of the 15th century. It is written on vellum in a Friulian dialect of Italian, using a humanistic hand. Its position as the oldest surviving Italian fencing treatise (or a copy thereof), as well as the oldest illustrated treatise covering each of its weapons, makes it one of the most important historical fencing manuals in existence.

It is particularly prized by students of its author, Fiore dei Liberi, because by many metrics it is the most comprehensive copy of his teachings, containing the most text if not the most illustrations. (I personally prefer the Morgan Library and Museum's copy, but at less than half the length of the Getty's, and lacking several weapons, it wouldn't make a very impressive facsimile.) 

What We Need & What You Get
Facsimiles like this are usually quite expensive. For example, the Orbis Pictus Gladiatoria cost about $900, while the Extraordinary Editions I.33 was released in two different editions, costing around $1,000 and $2,000. Facsimiles for more famous or lavish manuscripts can run into the five figure range.
One of my objectives in the Talhoffer project was to see how inexpensively such a book can be produced. I selected Grimm Book Bindery in Madison, Wisconsin, to do the printing and binding, and spent quite a bit of time discussing the project with them and ironing out every detail to be as precise as possible.
The cover of the Talhoffer facsimile, including the original blind-tooled design and the title applied by a later owner.
This time around, we've worked out the basic process, so I'm going to try for even more minute accuracy:

The book will be approximately the same size as the original (to within about a centimeter).
Most of the Getty's scans are offered for free online with an open license, but I've also purchased and licensed scans of the two text-only pages and thirteen blank pages (which aren't online), so we can get an accurate look at the manuscript from cover to cover.
We can't use real vellum, and even if we could, the skin's pattern would clash with the pattern that's already on the Getty scans. So instead, I bought a sheet of goatskin parchment and sent it to the binder so they could figure out a paper that matches the weight and feel of it as closely as possible.
We're going to replicate the actual quire structure of the manuscript, so all the pages will be center-sewn and bound in the exact same way as the original, tipped-in pages and all.
We'll be using the same 7-8 mm boards as in the Talhoffer facsimile (which are about 3 times thicker than today's book covers).
The covers will be made of goatskin leather, with the blind-tooling (imprinted design) on the current cover replicated, as before.

I haven't decided on what the cover will look like, but I have two candidates. One is the actual current cover, which only dates back to the 18th or 19th century (possibly ordered by Thomas Phillips). The other is a typical Biblioteca Estense binding, such as the manuscript might have been given if/when it entered Niccolo d'Este's library in the first place; this one's problematic because nearly all of these bindings date to the 18th century, and I haven't been able to determine whether this style is based on an older design that might have been around in the 15th. The brown cover is what the manuscript currently has, whereas the red cover is what it might have had in the 1400s (but I can't be sure).
To create this book, we need a minimum of 100 orders, so I have set the funding goal accordingly. The Talhoffer facsimile was sold for $150, and with unexpected costs and overruns (and a few unplanned last-minute improvements) it very nearly ended up in the red. This time, I've regrettably raised the price a bit to ensure that this won't happen again. I hope this remains affordable at $175.
The cost of these books depends on volume, so it will be a one-and-done print run, and people who don't order now will not have a chance again (unless we can scrape together another 100 orders). If we can get up to 250 orders, then some additional enhancements might become feasible (more on that as we go).
The five masters of fighting with the dagger.
I hope this book will be heirloom quality, but also durable enough to actually study out of. I would love to hear of someone actually teaching out of it in class.
Unlike the Talhoffer, there will be no companion volume this time. (Though I will be publishing on the Morgan in the next few months.) If you want a companion to this facsimile, I recommend both of the following:


Flowers of Battle Volume 1: Historical Overview and the Getty Manuscript, by Tom Leoni and Greg Mele.
From Medieval Manuscript to Modern Practice, by Dr. Guy Windsor.

You can also buy my prior work on Fiore, The Flower of Battle of Master Fiore de'i Liberi, Volume 1 and Volume 2. 

Risks & Challenges
Now that I have one of these projects under my belt, most of the unknowns have been sorted out and accounted for. A lot of the learning curve will transfer over directly to this new project. If all goes as planned, we will have these books produced and shipped by Christmas. The whole reason I am launching it this week rather than a month from now is because of the bindery's production schedule and availability.
However, the first project was delayed six months due to CoViD-19, which both forced the bindery to close for a few months and also disrupted their supply lines in ways that they're still trying to recover from. Another major lockdown in the autumn is still a possibility in these uncertain times, and in that case, we'll be lucky to have the books by spring.

We got 300 orders for the Talhoffer facsimile, so let's see if there are at least that many Fiorists out there!

story:
Story of My Book

Where Will We Go? is a self-discovery story about a woman’s journey after a devastating divorce. She struggles with self-doubt, heartache, and nightmares that ultimately make her stronger through her road to pure happiness.

My name is Emily Craig, and I am the author of Where Will We Go? I wrote this book because I wanted to continue my writing journey with a sequel to my debut book, Will You Love Me Again?. I have loved writing since I was 10, and now I am on the steps of publishing my second book. Writing has been my escape from the world for over 15 years, and in recent months, I don’t know what I would have done without it.

In reading this book, my hope is that you discover that happiness comes from within yourself. No one else can create your happiness but you, and no one else can destroy it but you. I want this book to be a vessel of hope for you just like it has been for me. Lucy Berry is my saving grace, I hope she can be yours, as well.
 

In this New Adult Fiction, Lucy Berry is coming off a nasty divorce from her high school sweetheart. For the last ten years, all she’s known is him, and that he was her true love. But when he betrays their marriage and her by drinking and sleeping with another woman, she makes the toughest decision ever. With the support of her best friends, Jenny, Michael, and Aaron, she divorces her cheater of a husband, David, and starts her journey to self-discovery and happiness. In the blink of an eye, David’s mistress is sporting an engagement ring all over Facebook. Feeling unworthy of happiness isn’t going to cut it anymore, she deserves to be happy too. She finally lands her first writer position with Getaway Travel Magazine, and a week following her ex-husband’s engagement announcement, she jets off to Paris, France with Jenny and Michael to explore and write about four of the top France attractions.

You will love this book if you love self-discovery stories that make you root for the character’s success, exploring a new country, and investing in deep friendships and new experiences.

Where Will We Go? speaks to young and old adults everywhere who want to experience hope and light in the very early stages of a 20-something finding herself. 20-somethings are constantly finding who they are, but are they doing it in Paris? You’ll love this book if you crave adventure, foreign countries, and famous France places.

Ultimately, I hope that Where Will We Go? inspires reflection on how everyone handles heartbreak and that we start to see that heartbreak can be our beginning rather than our final chapter.

I look forward to having open conversations about heartbreak, self-discovery, and happiness with my readers!
 

About the Author 

Emily Craig is a full-time Estimator and Social Media Coordinator working for a family-run company, but her loves lie in her part-time position as a Fiction Author. With a bachelor’s degree in English focusing in Professional Writing, she always knew writing was her future and the only thing she dove headfirst into time and time again. Six pieces of works under her belt (five poetry collections and her debut novel), she is ready to share another book with the world.

Writing has always been her top passion; for as long as she can remember, she preferred writing over reading any day. Her passion for learning from others didn’t come until her parents recommended she read books in her genre: Young Adult and New Adult Fiction Works, while she was in college. Since then, Emily has strived to make more time to boost and support creators similar and different from herself.

Emily enjoys reading books that make her happy while also supporting her author friends or books outside her genre. You can find her cuddled up on the sofa with her boyfriend, pup, and any kind of movie or book.

For more information, you can connect with Emily Craig at emilycraig.writer96@gmail.com and the following social media platforms.

Instagram: @emnicolecraig_author (https://www.instagram.com/emnicolecraig_author/)

Twitter: @emilycraig44 (https://twitter.com/emilycraig44)

Facebook: Emily Craig, Author (https://www.facebook.com/emilycraig1996)

LinkedIn: Emily Craig (https://www.linkedin.com/in/emily-craig-aa8981148/)
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2022.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a personal thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my final cover.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #wherewillwego and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (#newdegreepress), so we can help amplify your efforts!

Instagram - @emnicolecraig_author  @newdegreepress
Facebook - @emilycraig1996  @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @emilycraig44  @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

With Love,
Em

story:
Money Boss Mom is a book about getting the right systems in place to help young parents gain control of their financial lives.

My name is Jamie Bosse, and I am the author of Money Boss Mom, Helping Young Parents Be the “Boss” of Their Financial Future. I was inspired to write this book because parenthood is no joke. It takes adulting to a whole other level. As a parent, there are so many new things to worry about, and financial stressors are always a part of that equation. I want young parents to be set up for a bright future, and to be prepared for emergencies and potential risks that may come their way so that they can stop worrying and start enjoying life now.

My hope is that this book educates and empowers readers so that they can have the peace of mind that their financial lives are on track. When you are experiencing issues with cash flow, debt, or any other financial insecurity, that is all you can think about. It will consume you. You are in fight or flight mode and can’t focus on the things and people you love most. You can’t really enjoy life if you’re just trying to make things work until the next paycheck.

What You'll Learn
In this book, you'll learn ways to manage cash flow so that you actually spend less time budgeting each month and learn what you really need to know about confusing topics like life insurance and estate planning. You'll hear stories such as:

  • How our childhood memories shape how we think of money as adults and influence our behavior without us even knowing it.
  • Cautionary tales using fictional characters like Zack Morris, Kelly Kapowski, Romeo and Juliet to shed light on boring (but important) risk management topics.
  • How to balance the competing priorities of managing your career and saving for long term goals like retirement and college funding while managing the expenses of today.

You will love this book if you are:
  • A new parent or soon-to-be parent that wants some help navigating this exciting, special, and terrifying stage of life.
  • Parents in your 20’s, 30’s, or 40’s who want to be proactive, not reactive with your money and your time.
  • Wanting to organize your financial life and break out of the paycheck to paycheck lifestyle.


Money Boss Mom is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents in Gen X, Y, and Z who want to look at their money habits, behaviors and cash flow in a new way.

The Book - Money Boss Mom, Helping Young Parents Be the “Boss” of Their Financial Future
The book is written in 3 parts.
Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. Identifying your “money script” and the unconscious bias that influences how you spend, save, and manage your money. How to build a strong foundation (net worth), manage cash flow, insuring your biggest asset - YOURSELF, and what every parent needs to know about estate planning.

Part 2 contains chapters 6-8. Here we talk about the retirement “pogo stick” and a beginner’s guide to investing. We also talk about ways to plan for education funding for your children.

Part 3 contains chapters 9-11. Money and relationships - how to make it work. The financial impact of maternity leave and returning to work after baby. Teaching kids financial lessons and values.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


There are some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Jamie Bosse is a Financial Planner at Aspyre Wealth Partners in Manhattan, Kansas. She helps her clients maneuver through life’s transitions and overcome and anticipate any potential roadblocks along the way. She was recognized by Investment News Magazine in their “40 Under 40” award in 2020. Jamie has written a children’s book, Milton the Money Savvy Pup, Brings Home the Bacon featuring their family pet as the star.

Being a working mother of 4, Jamie knows how difficult it can be to balance the competing priorities of living well today but also planning for the future. She is passionate about educating and empowering others and improving their lives.

I was inspired to write this book because parenthood is no joke. It takes adulting to a whole other level. As a parent, there are so many new things to worry about, and financial stressors are always a part of that equation. I want young parents to be set up for a bright future, and to be prepared for emergencies and potential risks that may come their way so that they can stop worrying and start enjoying life now.My hope is that this book educates and empowers readers so that they can have the peace of mind that their financial lives are on track. When you are experiencing issues with cash flow, debt, or any other financial insecurity, that is all you can think about. It will consume you. You are in fight or flight mode and can’t focus on the things and people you love most. You can’t really enjoy life if you’re just trying to make things work until the next paycheck.

How our childhood memories shape how we think of money as adults and influence our behavior without us even knowing it.
Cautionary tales using fictional characters like Zack Morris, Kelly Kapowski, Romeo and Juliet to shed light on boring (but important) risk management topics.
How to balance the competing priorities of managing your career and saving for long term goals like retirement and college funding while managing the expenses of today.

Wanting to organize your financial life and break out of the paycheck to paycheck lifestyle.

story:
Story of My Book 

Transforming Trauma: How You Can Turn Your Pain Into Power is about my personal journey. It will include stories from everyday people that are relatable to the world that we live in today. My prayer is that you are able to see that there is HOPE after a traumatic experience. Readers will appreciate learning from another person’s perspective to start changing the things on the inside to get the desired results on the outside.

Do you think it’s possible to get unstuck after going through traumatic events? In this book, I will give candid details about my experience with trauma and also share stories of other individuals and how they were able to move forward in life. The stories of April, Kim, Zoia, and Rosie will prove that you can move from stuck to unstuck and achieve your purpose in life by changing your perspective. At the end of the day, we are responsible for our own happiness.

My name is Melissa Carr and I am the author of Transforming Trauma: How You Can Turn Your Pain Into Power. I wrote this book because my own healing journey was nothing short of a miracle and God told me to share it with men and women because I wasn’t the only one that could benefit from this journey. I thought about what the entire world was going through in 2020 and thought this was a perfect time to be obedient and share.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that challenges are meant to strengthen you. It is ok to be vulnerable so that other humans can see what’s really going on inside of you as an individual. Your actions could potentially resonate with them in an effort to help them identify their strengths and move beyond what happened to them. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for mindfulness and thought leadership. It is important for your overall well-being to recover from trauma. You can start by taking mental health breaks from the traumatic situation. In my book, I will share techniques by demonstrating a unplug, recharge and reset process. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you move forward from hardship with a refreshed mindset.

In this book, you'll learn about positive outcomes that can come out of tragedies like job loss, health battles, and the deaths of loved ones

Today, Kim is a very successful business woman. Kim will share the horror of losing two of very dear family members one year apart, both unexpectedly. As you can imagine, this rocked her world; however, Kim managed to move forward after the trauma.

Zoia grew up battling child hood trauma, she will share that she wasn’t happy with what she went through as a child and would never want anyone else to experience the trauma. However, she acknowledges that she is great for the way it set her up in life to be able to conquer anything that comes her way. As a result, Zoia created a non-profit organization, titled “Kozakov Foundation” in honor of her late father.

April a breast cancer survivor, had to deal with depression due to her Breast Cancer diagnosis and all of the traumatic life changes that came with it. One day April realized that she was going to fight back so she organized a successful event through the Breast Cancer Foundation titled “Rock Your Hat & Scarf”.

You will love this book if you’re looking to read stories about real people with real stories and resources to help you move beyond challenging times.

Transforming Trauma: How You Can Turn Your Pain Into Power is a nonfiction book that speaks to men and women who want to look at challenges and self-help in a new way.
 

About The Book 

The book is written in two parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapter 1- 4. My reader will learn that in life we all will experience trauma at some point whether it be job loss, health issues, divorce, or death and while we never get over the experience, we can learn how to move forward.

Part 2 contains chapters 5-12. This book includes stories from various individuals that have gone through traumatic experiences. From a Breast Cancer Survivor to a successful business owner, my hope is that my readers will see themselves in these stories and know that they can overcome trauma.

There are people in the world just like you and I that go through traumatic experiences and they’ve learned how to deal with them and move forward leading successful lives. Due to their resilience and determination to succeed in life, these individuals created campaigns to support others that were going through health issues and even created nonprofit organization to push through the adversity.

Although I know that everything isn’t one-size-fits-all; my hope is that the reader will utilize the tools from my toolkit. My strategy in writing this book was to identify real people that experienced an array of trauma that would resonate with my readers. After reading through the successful stories in the previous chapters, my hope is that you’ll be able to apply the techniques, but you they will require you to trust the process.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this December 2021.
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author 

Melissa Carr is an author, coach, mentor, leader, inspirer, and unwavering optimist. She believes the quickest way to change the world is to start by transforming your mindset.

Melissa wrote this book in hopes to inspire others by demonstrating what worked in her toolkit. Melissa has been able to move beyond the traumatic events that occurred in her life and ready to share with the world that there is life beyond trauma. It is up to you to create your happiness.

Melissa Carr is human of which is part of why it’s important to share this story. Melissa has a bubbly personality and love to inspire everyone around her. Prior to her healing, the people in her life would see a confident exterior, not realizing what was happening on the interior. Trauma is forever etched in her memory; however, she uses that energy to push through the adversity to help others overcome their traumatic experiences through self-help and self-care.

For more information, you can connect with Melissa Carr at: beyondinspiration409@gmail.com.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks.
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page).
  • Use this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfvFSx... to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

 

Please use #transformingtrauma and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Melissa L. Carr

story:
The Story of The Lost Winds

Amaryllis “Amy” Sinclair has just one goal in life, and that’s to get out of high school ASAP...At least until her older sister mysteriously vanishes on the last day of school.

Sixteen-year-old Amaryllis “Amy” Sinclair is used to existing on the fringes of any given room, accustomed to hiding in the crevices where she cannot be seen. When her older sister is suddenly kidnapped by a coven of witches (yes, you read that right), Amy must break out of her shell in order to find her. Teaming up with her math-loving best friend and an unexpected classmate, Amy embarks on a bewitching journey and uncovers buried truths that threaten to permanently shift her world as she knows it. Who has been lost, and who will be found?

My name is Maya Simon and I am the author of The Lost Winds. I wrote this book because I have always reveled in the magic of creativity, in its ability to plant a seed of joy in an increasingly changing world. As a proud bookworm and certified binge-reader, it is an absolute dream come true to be able to publish a book of my own.

It is my hope that, in reading this book, you will embark on an adventure unlike any you have ever been on before. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with themes of mental health, family, and friendship, escape from the boredom of a year spent in quarantine, and learn alongside Amaryllis about the importance of letting the people you love into your orbit.

You will love this book if you love young adult fiction; coming of age stories that bring light to the importance of mental health awareness; want to come along on a riveting journey to Gloucester, Salem, and more; or want to discover relatable characters struggling with many of the same challenges we all face every day (just with a witchy twist).

The Lost Winds speaks to younger and older readers alike who want to embark on the exhilarating, nostalgia-tinged travels of teenagers living in a COVID-free world during one unforgettable summer.

Ultimately, I hope that The Lost Winds inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Why is bravery held separate from vulnerability?
  • How prevalent is groupthink in today’s society? Are the startling patterns of human behavior unveiled in the Salem Witch Trials just as relevant today as they were centuries ago?
  • Do the rigid conventions of society hold unique individuals captive from the moment they are born?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

In this campaign, I am hoping to hit $6,000 in order to get the ebook and softcover editions of my book published. 

About the Author

Maya Simon is a student presently studying Art History and Creative Writing at Georgetown University.

In writing The Lost Winds, Maya wanted to write a story that could provide a sense of comfort to readers during a difficult time in our lives. Young Adult (YA) fiction has been her safe space since adolescence, a genre filled with characters and stories that she could root for, relate to, and use as a roadmap to navigate her own teenage years. It is her hope that readers will see a part of themselves reflected in the characters of The Lost Winds, a part that helps them put together the mysterious puzzle that is figuring ourselves out.

Outside of working on her book, Maya enjoys bingeing Netflix series (she is currently catching up on Atypical as we write), spending far too much time browsing TikTok, taking long walks in nature after the aforementioned browsing of TikTok, and spending time with her cat named Luna.

For more information, you can connect with Maya at mes429@georgetown.edu and LinkedIn, Instagram, Goodreads, and TikTok.

story_txt:
The Story of The Lost Winds
Amaryllis “Amy” Sinclair has just one goal in life, and that’s to get out of high school ASAP...At least until her older sister mysteriously vanishes on the last day of school.
Sixteen-year-old Amaryllis “Amy” Sinclair is used to existing on the fringes of any given room, accustomed to hiding in the crevices where she cannot be seen. When her older sister is suddenly kidnapped by a coven of witches (yes, you read that right), Amy must break out of her shell in order to find her. Teaming up with her math-loving best friend and an unexpected classmate, Amy embarks on a bewitching journey and uncovers buried truths that threaten to permanently shift her world as she knows it. Who has been lost, and who will be found?My name is Maya Simon and I am the author of The Lost Winds. I wrote this book because I have always reveled in the magic of creativity, in its ability to plant a seed of joy in an increasingly changing world. As a proud bookworm and certified binge-reader, it is an absolute dream come true to be able to publish a book of my own.
It is my hope that, in reading this book, you will embark on an adventure unlike any you have ever been on before. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with themes of mental health, family, and friendship, escape from the boredom of a year spent in quarantine, and learn alongside Amaryllis about the importance of letting the people you love into your orbit.
You will love this book if you love young adult fiction; coming of age stories that bring light to the importance of mental health awareness; want to come along on a riveting journey to Gloucester, Salem, and more; or want to discover relatable characters struggling with many of the same challenges we all face every day (just with a witchy twist).The Lost Winds speaks to younger and older readers alike who want to embark on the exhilarating, nostalgia-tinged travels of teenagers living in a COVID-free world during one unforgettable summer.
Ultimately, I hope that The Lost Winds inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Why is bravery held separate from vulnerability?
How prevalent is groupthink in today’s society? Are the startling patterns of human behavior unveiled in the Salem Witch Trials just as relevant today as they were centuries ago?
Do the rigid conventions of society hold unique individuals captive from the moment they are born?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

story:
Story of My Book

A Case of Culture is a nonfiction book about the unspoken challenges and hesitancies faced by immigrant patients in seeking healthcare. In the book, I advocate for the need for cultural brokership to address and alleviate these cultural challenges in the healthcare setting.

My name is Snigdha Nandipati and I am the author of A Case of Culture. As someone whose family stocked kitchen herbs in our medicine cabinet and hated going to the doctor’s, I wanted to bring to light the cultural reasons behind these fears and hesitancies towards seeking medical treatment. Though this hesitancy towards Western medicine is one that widely exists, the reasons behind it are hardly talked about. So, I wrote this book in order to explore these reasons and to share the stories of cultural brokers that work to ease these hesitancies.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how a cultural broker works to enhance the patient-doctor relationship across cultural differences. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the role of culture, language, and spirituality in healing and medicine. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand how culture plays a role in the medical care that is provided, and how cultural brokers work to fill the culture gap in healthcare.

In this book, you'll learn how cultural brokers advocate for their patients and build cultural humility in the healthcare setting. You'll hear stories such as...

  • the Hindu doctor who chanted an Islamic Kalima prayer for her dying Muslim patient
  • the son who encouraged his Italian father to open up to his doctor about his medication noncompliance
  • the hospitalist who called her elderly Indian patient “Aunty” to help her feel more at home in this strange environment and new country
  • the Latino Evangelical priest who used his sermon to encourage worshippers to get vaccinated against COVID-19

 

You will love this book if you have ever helped your family members navigate the challenges of Western medicine, if you find yourself straddling two or more cultures on a daily basis, or if you are interested in topics of culture and anthropology as applied to healthcare.

A Case of Culture is a nonfiction book that speaks to healthcare providers and immigrant families who want to look at culture and healthcare in a new way.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish as well as a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Snigdha Nandipati is a patient advocate and writer with a B.S. in Neuroscience from Yale University. Her work is focused on fostering relationships across different disciplines, cultures, and belief systems to create impactful change. Snigdha’s professional experiences as a scientific researcher and medical assistant, coupled with her personal values as a Telugu- and Hindu-American, have encouraged her to explore these intersections of medicine, culture, language, and spirituality.

Snigdha decided to write this book with the hopes of better understanding the struggles that immigrant patients face in seeking healthcare and finding a solution to break down these barriers. The solution she’s found? Cultural brokership.

Outside of her writing & healthcare endeavors, Snigdha loves making music, trying new vegetarian recipes, watching Telugu movies with her family, and reading spoilers on Wikipedia.

For more information, you can connect with Snigdha at snigdha.nandipati@gmail.com or on Instagram @snigdhanandi_author.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:
  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

  • Facebook - @snigdhanandipati / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

story:
Story of My Book

Reel Leadership helps leaders understand the power of film in communicating leadership ideas and lessons. Reel Leadership dives into this idea through interviewing various leaders and movie industry personas.

My name is Joseph Lalonde and I am the author of Reel Leadership. I wrote this book because I saw the need to help leaders find a way to enjoy entertainment without feeling guilty.

When I began my own personal development journey, I discovered how leadership gurus try to dissuade people from enjoying regular forms of entertainment because they see it as a waste of time. I fell in line with believing this lie; that entertainment, especially movies, held no real value. Over time, I began to realize the power movies actually have to communicate messages and change lives. It was then that I began my Reel Leadership journey and now I want to share that journey with you.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you discover movies are powerful tools in communicating leadership principles. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for leadership and movies! Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a resource that will help you see movies not as a mindless form of entertainment but as a tool to discover new ways of thinking about leadership.

In this book, you'll learn about the ways you can find leadership lessons in movies. You'll hear stories from:

  • David Hayter (the writer of X-Men 1 and 2) and how he dealt with a demanding director on set.
  • Daniel Knudsen and how every great movie should have a moral premise.
  • Marty Himmel and how he overcame fear because of the movies he watched.

You will enjoy this book if you love movies, want to become a better leader, and struggle to find balance between the two.

Reel Leadership is a nonfiction book that speaks to leaders and movie lovers who want to look at leadership and personal development in a new way.

The Book - Reel Leadership

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and information about the history of film and leadership. You will discover what the early days of movies looked like. You may be surprised to see some of the innovations that have been developed. You will also read about the history of leadership from Biblical times to current day. It’s a wild ride!

Part 2 contains the meat of the book. These chapters detail the stories of leaders such as John Ramstead (a former Top Gun pilot), David Kahn (a leader and lover of comic books), and Brent Baum (a movie producer who searched Mount Arafat for Noah’s Ark). These stories, along with others, help us see the power of movies in communicating leadership principles.

Part 3 contains ideas about the Reel Leadership framework. In these closing chapters, you will see the steps you can take to view film in a new way. You will begin to understand how to look at a movie, see the scenes that have played out, and learn how to pull leadership lessons from the movie.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

About the Author

Joseph Lalonde is an award-winning leadership blogger. He has been recognized as a top-50 expert in the leadership blogging world. Now, he’s bringing his insights on leadership into the book world.

Joseph is writing Reel Leadership to help you understand the connection between movies and leadership. He wants to help you enjoy your entertainment a little more while coming away from it a better leader. He believes you, too, can become a reel leader.

In his spare time, Joseph enjoys running along the shores of Lake Michigan with his Vizsla, Lok. He also enjoys spending time with his wife, Pamela. In the winter, Joseph climbs frozen waterfalls in the frozen tundra of the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.

For more information, you can connect with Joseph Lalonde at joe@jmlalonde.com, on his blog, and on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.

For international preorders, please do the following:

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Want Free Copies Of Reel Leadership?

I am running a referral program where you can earn extra copies of the book to keep for yourself, pass out to friends, and use at book club.

How can you earn free copies of the book? For every 5 people you refer using your unique referral link (At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you), you will get one additional copy of the paperback version of the book.

This is a great way to get copies into the hands of family or friends who may not be able to afford the book or just to surprise your team members with.

These chapters detail the stories of leaders such as John Ramstead (a former Top Gun pilot), David Kahn (a leader and lover of comic books), and Brent Baum (a movie producer who searched Mount Arafat for Noah’s Ark). These stories, along with others, help us see the power of movies in communicating leadership principles.Part 3 contains ideas about the Reel Leadership framework. In these closing chapters, you will see the steps you can take to view film in a new way. You will begin to understand how to look at a movie, see the scenes that have played out, and learn how to pull leadership lessons from the movie.What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

He wants to help you enjoy your entertainment a little more while coming away from it a better leader.
