story:
The Story of my Book

The Four Swords: A Parable of Leadership, Video Games, and Dead Dragons is a unique leadership book.  It is written as a “leadership fable” in the style of classic management books such as The Five Dysfunctions of a Team: A Leadership Fable and The Phoenix Project (A Novel About IT, DevOps, and Helping Your Business Win). It illustrates valuable lessons and perspectives on leadership, management, culture, values, and team-building through an entertaining fictional narrative.

My name is Paul Tozour and I am the author of The Four Swords. I wrote this book because I’m passionate about improving the state of leadership in the game industry, and about the intersection of game industry culture and modern management science.

My hope is that this book will introduce readers to many key concepts in management science that the game industry often misses, in addition to offering a unique and entertaining in-the-trenches perspective on game development culture. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside the four protagonists about the critical role of values, the realities of modern game development and game studio culture, and the way values and culture impact project outcomes.

Update (July 18): An early draft of the manuscript for The Four Swords won the July 2021 Firebird Book Awards in three categories: Leadership, Business / General, and Cross-Genre!

          

 

 

The Narrative

The Four Swords tells the story of Jake, Leo, Tim, and Allison, four passionate, dedicated game developers working hard to make their respective game projects successful.

 

                               

Jake and Leo work on Project Thundercloud 2 at the fictional game studio Scrub-Liminal Studios in downtown Austin, where Jake leads the programming team and Leo works as a Senior Designer.  Although the sequel to a successful and innovative game, the sequel is facing an increasing number of challenges.

 

                               

Meanwhile, Tim and Allison work at the fictional game studio Green Gryphon Games on the outskirts of Austin, which is building a highly anticipated sci-fi space exploration sandbox game called Norman’s Ark.  Tim works as a Senior Producer, and Allison is in charge of PR and marketing.

 

                               

The four game developers regularly assemble inside a fictional massively-multiplayer game Dream of Dragons, where they work together to slay dragons that guard four magical swords (shown in the cover illustration).

 

Along the way, they team up with a wise helper who guides them to define their values and helps them organize their thoughts as they struggle with difficult decisions around technology, game design, creative direction, team dynamics, risk management, project planning, production, prioritization, negotiation, customer communication, and the tricky art of “managing up.”

 

You will love this book:

  • If you enjoy learning about leadership, values, culture, and team-building.
  • If you’re looking for a highly entertaining story that illustrates all of these.
  • If you have an interest in the video game industry, video game development culture, and the unique challenges that developers in the industry face, or want to deepen your understanding of team dynamics in software development in general.

 

Ultimately, I hope that The Four Swords inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue about how we can improve the quality of leadership, management, and production in the game industry; how we can better align teams toward a common goal; how we can better select, promote, prepare, and train game industry leaders; and how we can improve efficiency without burning out the talent and driving so many developers out of the industry.

 

Early Praise

Early beta readers of the book have said:

 

Great job bringing it all together in the end ... It has been my pleasure reading your book. Thank you for giving me this opportunity.

I look forward to seeing it published.

-Eric B, agile & leadership consultant

 

Remember episode 5 of Mythic Quest? This book is like that, only for all disciplines. Frankly, this would make a far better show than Mythic Quest does, at least for developers.

-Jake S, veteran game developer

 

Congratulations on making something I didn’t think was possible. I’ll be recommending this to lots of people. 

-John H, veteran game developer

 

I think you’ve created a great ‘mirror’ for studios and individuals to hold up to themselves. I see people reading it, or being asked to read it, and simply reflecting on themselves, their team, their company and how that impacts what happens in their workplace.

The afterword is super helpful, and I love that it is so personal. It demonstrates your values and critically the behaviours that underpin a strong culture (a great starting point for a studio).

Awesome job Paul, I really enjoyed it.

-Chris J, leadership consultant

 

Genuinely enjoying the tone and pacing of your novel … I think it's going to sell really well.  You always, always, end your chapters perfectly.

-Jared R, book editor

 

"Crunch! Fingerpointing! Bugs! (The technical sort.) Tozour's parable of game development dissects the industry with candor and wit."

-Michel S, creative writing MFA student and former game tester

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with Gatekeeper Press in late 2021 (no later than December). I plan to release the audiobook, paperback, and e-book versions simultaneously. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy and ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The audio editing for the audiobook version, as well as the cost of renting the recording studio (I plan to do the narration for the book myself).
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Paul Tozour is the owner and General Manager of Mothership Entertainment, creators of Aven Colony for PC, Xbox One, and PlayStation 4 (published by Team17). He has worked in a wide range of design, production, programming, and technical design roles across the industry since 1994, including Retro Studios / Nintendo, where he worked on two of the games in the Metroid Prime series, as well as Microsoft, Intel, Gas Powered Games, Intelligence Engine Design Systems, and Brøderbund Software.

Paul holds a Master’s of Science in Engineering from the Executive Master’s in Technology Management (EMTM) program at the University of Pennsylvania, a degree program co-sponsored by the Wharton School of Business.

Paul is passionate about applying modern management science to video game development culture, and upgrading the state of the art in game industry leadership.

Paul also initiated and led the Game Outcomes Project study in 2014-15, a highly-acclaimed industry / academic partnership that evaluated the link between game development studio culture and project outcomes. The results were published on Gamasutra, and you can also follow the Game Outcomes Project on Twitter.

For more information, you can connect with Paul via email or LinkedIn and follow the book on Twitter and sign up for our newsletter to be informed about key announcements.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with Gatekeeper Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FourSwordsBook and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

 

Paul Tozour

story:
a new Dragon Precinct story and a new tale of Cassie Zukav, weirdness magnet

In 2004, I launched the world of Flingaria and the stories of the Cliff's End Castle Guard with the novel Dragon Precinct, as well as a short story in the anthology Murder by Magic. In the 15 years since then, I've written five novels and more than a dozen works of short fiction in that universe, most of which chronicle the adventures of Lieutenants Danthres Tresyllione and Torin ban Wyvald of the Cliff's End Castle Guard. These meldings of high fantasy and police procedural have Danthres and Torin solving crimes in the bustling city-state of Cliff's End, navigating not just the criminal element, but also the politics of the demesne and the interference of the Brotherhood of Wizards.

Several of the dozen-plus works of short fiction in that universe have been released via the crowdfunding route, including some untold stories like Danthres & Torin's first and second cases together.

In Mermaid Precinct, I jumped the timeline ahead a year and made reference to some incidents that took place in that year, including the Gorvangin Rampages. For my next story in the world, I thought it would be fun to tell that tale.

But wait, there's more!

In 2011, I had a story in Tales from the House Band that starred Cassie Zukav, a young woman in Key West who discovers that she's a Norse fate goddess, and has to stop Ragnarok, the end of all that is from Norse myth. Since then, Cassie has appeared in more than a dozen stories of her own set in Key West, featuring scuba diving, Norse mythology, folklore, rock and roll music, and beer drinking, not necessarily in that order, with a supporting cast that includes several gods, an immortal barfly, the ghost of a wrecker captain, the house band at an Old Town bar, and a federal agent. Cassie has encountered nixies, ghosts, possessed dolls, water fae, mermaids, and more.

Cassie's tales have appeared in a ton of places, including the second Tales from the House Band anthology, as well as the anthos Bad-Ass Faeries: It's Elemental, A Baker's Dozen of Magic, Out of Tune, TV Gods: Summer Programming, and Unearthed, the collections Ragnarok and Roll: Tales of Cassie Zukav, Weirdness Magnet and Without a License: The Fantastic Worlds of Keith R.A. DeCandido, and the online zines Story of the Month Club and Buzzy Mag. 

And so for this crowdfund, I don't want to just give you an untold tale from the Dragon Precinct universe, but also tell a Cassie story that I've been dying to tell. In the three-part "Cayo Hueso" story (which appeared in Ragnarok and Roll), Odin died; in "Fish Out of Water" (in Out of Tune), Loki died. It was always my intention to bring them back in a story called "Ragnarok and a Hard Place," and I'm adding that Cassie story to the rewards.

Plus there will be some nifty extras for folks who donate more, including free copies of my other short fiction, audio recordings of me reading the stories, tote bags and hand-made stuffies with the Dragon Precinct badge (seen above), and more!

Or, if you just want the stories, you can do that, too.....

STRETCH GOALS!

Since we've made our goal, now we're looking at stretch goals!

If we reach $2000, then anyone who donates $15 or more will also get an eBook copy of my Super City Police Department novel The Case of the Claw.

If we reach $2250, then all those who donate will receive a thank-you note e-mailed to you (those whose perks include a physical reward mailed to them will get a physical thank-you note included in the package).

If we reach $2500, then anyone who donates $15 or more will get, not just The Case of the Claw, but the story bundle will include three additional stories.

If we reach $2750, then anyone who donates $15 or more will also get, in addition to the above, an eBook copy of my Scattered Earth novel Guilt in Innocence.

 

If we reach $3000, I will fall over in shock. And I will come up with a stretch goal for that, too......

story:
The Story of My Book

Make Book Club Lit Again is your guide to making book club better: four great book recommendations along with original recipes inspired by the books. Because when we eat with people and discuss ideas with them, we are also building networks and solidifying relationships.

My name is Colleen Connolly-Ahern and I am the author of Make Book Club Lit Again. This is a book I looked for myself. I thought, surely there’s a book club guide that suggests some great books, looks at the food history of the cultures they take place in and provides menus and other suggestions that would make the reader feel like they were eating along with the characters. But it wasn’t there. I love history, I love travel, I love books, and I love food. I started my career as an advertising copywriter, so I decided to write it myself.

This book is me — your nerdy friend who loves food, always has a book recommendation, and is raring to organize the next party. I’ve traveled a lot, and I love to share the foods I’ve eaten abroad by cooking them for friends at home. I want the reader to feel as excited as I am about reading a good book, cooking a new recipe, and then sharing the experience with good friends.

In Make Book Club Lit Again I’ve given you four very different book recommendations from different times and cultures. They’re accompanied by four international menus and other recommendations that will help bring the culture of the characters to life for your book club:

  • A Korean menu to accompany The Tale of Chun Hyang, a traditional pansori.
  • A Medieval feast from France to go along with the Arturian romance Erec and Enide.
  • Iberian recipes to accompany the epistolary novel, Pepita Jimenez.
  • An English country menu for a Pride and Prejudice book club reread.

You will love this book if you are a member of a book club hoping to turn meetings into events everyone looks forward to. It’s also a perfect framework for starting a new book club.

Make Book Club Lit Again is a nonfiction book that speaks to literature lovers and book nerds everywhere who want to look at their favorite characters and their book club in a new way.

What We Need & What You Get

  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

Campaign Goals

  • Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
  • Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition

Colleen Connolly-Ahern is an associate professor of communications at Penn State University, where she teaches advertising and researches issues of social justice in international strategic communications. Her work has taken her to more than 40 countries, and introduced her to a wide range of characters and cuisines, many of whose stories she shares in her book. Make Book Club Lit Again brings together all the things she loves best: good books, great food, social history, and connecting with wonderful people. A self-proclaimed “cookbook junkie,” when she’s not grading papers you can usually find Colleen in the kitchen of her lovingly restored mid-mod ranch, whipping up new recipes and generally making a mess for her long-suffering husband (a.k.a. Lee “The Sous Chef” Ahern) to tidy up.

For more information, you can connect with Colleen Connolly-Ahern at colreads@gmail.com, on Instagram @colreads and on Twitter @Col_Reads.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #makebookclublitagain and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

I thought, surely there’s a book club guide that suggests some great books, looks at the food history of the cultures they take place in and provides menus and other suggestions that would make the reader feel like they were eating along with the characters. But it wasn’t there. I love history, I love travel, I love books, and I love food. I started my career as an advertising copywriter, so I decided to write it myself.This book is me — your nerdy friend who loves food, always has a book recommendation, and is raring to organize the next party. I’ve traveled a lot, and I love to share the foods I’ve eaten abroad by cooking them for friends at home. I want the reader to feel as excited as I am about reading a good book, cooking a new recipe, and then sharing the experience with good friends.In Make Book Club Lit Again I’ve given you four very different book recommendations from different times and cultures. A Korean menu to accompany The Tale of Chun Hyang, a traditional pansori.
A Medieval feast from France to go along with the Arturian romance Erec and Enide.
Iberian recipes to accompany the epistolary novel, Pepita Jimenez.
An English country menu for a Pride and Prejudice book club reread.

story:
New: If I meet my funding goal by noon on July 4, I will give $1,000 to Child's Play.

Have you ever really wanted to do something, but every time you tried you just couldn't get going on it? Me too! I don't know about you, but with me it was writing. I've always had tons of story ideas, but for some reason, whenever I sat down to write one of them I got distracted by other things.

A few months ago I decided it was time to really take the proverbial bull by the horns (because doing it to a real bull would not have helped my case at all, and would also probably have hurt quite a bit), and I made a public commitment to write a horror novel.

"How public," I hear you ask? First of all, you shouldn't interrupt people. Seriously. But to answer your question, I announced on a popular website that I would write a few pages of the story every day, and then post what I'd written. And if I missed a day, I'd post twice the following day to make up for it. 89 days and 77,000 words later, I had a finished horror novel sitting in front of me.

Enough backstory, what's the novel about?

Some people in an office building experience a power outage as power in the city goes down. As the building's generator and emergency lights kick in, people start exploding from the inside, for no apparent reason. It doesn't take long for our band of heroes, who begin the story spread out all over the building, to realize that the key to staying alive is to stay out of the lights. If there is light on them, they're going to die. And the sun comes up in five hours.

Oh, and did I mention that you can read the first draft in its entirety right here?

Cool. Now what?

So now I have this massive first draft document, a complete horror novel. What am I supposed to do with it? Well, the next step is to edit it, and try to get it published. That's where you come in.

You see, editing a book like this takes time, and the way I've written it, I need to be able to focus all my energy on it or else it's going to take forever. Then I need to try to find an agent, which costs money, or self-publish, which also costs money. All pledges from this campaign will go towards covering my cost of living while I edit, printing out numerous copies of the manuscript in various forms, building a proper website for the book, and the publication process.

And the best part for you is that you don't even have to do anything on faith; you can literally read the entire first draft from that link I posted earlier, and then decide based on what you read whether you want to help bring this dream to life.

Awesome. Then what?

Yeah, what comes after this? Well, the next horror novel I want to write has to do with someone who gradually loses his grip on reality, until he literally replaces it with his own terrible version of it. I started writing this one a couple years ago, but got sidetracked (callback to the first paragraph FTW!), and now I want to get back to it. But I can't start working on a new novel until this one's all done with. Which means you aren't just funding one book by pledging to this campaign; you're funding two. That's double the value right there!

I want to make writing fiction my career. Getting this novel published is the first step towards making that happen. I can't wait to see what comes next.

story:
STORY OF MY BOOK

Well Made Decisions is about building successful companies and careers with the decisions you make.  Moving faster, with more confidence and better results!

My name is Jennifer Davis.  I wrote this book because I realized that over my years as a c-suite executive, a contributor to Forbes, and as a voracious reader, I have been both a student and practitioner of decision making.  It's easy to see the impact that decisions have on leaders and the companies they build.  There is so much pressure to be right!

However, decisions, like inventions, are 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration. And most of that sweat-inducing work happens after the decision is made as implementation begins, communications occur, and teams work together to solve problems.  In other words, any single decision matters less than you think, but how you approach decision making and implementation - reflected in culture, decision making approaches, and communication - matters the most!

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some insights into making and implementing decisions well.  Leaders at every level will find it useful, but especially those who lead teams or cross-functional projects.  Learn how leaders can make high-velocity decisions with confidence and see thought through to results. 

This book is an opportunity for me to give back to organizations that helped shape me as a leader, so proceeds beyond what is required for publishing will be used to set up a new scholarship program.

 

ABOUT THE BOOK

The goal of this book is to build better leaders with a tool set and approach that achieves great customer outcomes and facilitates teamwork.  This book is a reflection of my experience as a leader and in the c-suite, seasoned by extensive research into organizational decisions.  While some decisions make or break businesses and careers, most will benefit from a low-stakes, high-velocity approach detailed in the book.  It is packed with stories from Amazon, Netflix, Honeywell, Planar, Leyard, Ann Sacks, Estee Lauder, GE, GM, Neehah Paper, startups, large enterprises, and those undergoing transformation.  I will bring you examples of successful leaders at all levels and teams across multiple industries ranging from consumer products to healthcare, from manufacturing to technology.

 

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU'LL GET

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to off-set the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

  • The cover design of my book. (The mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder!)

  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

  • The launch of a college scholarship program which will grant its first awards in the fall of 2021.  See additional detail at www.wellmadedecisions.com/scholarship.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition later in the year. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will add an audiobook in 2022.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who support my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover design.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!  See all the available perks for details.

 

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR TEAMS

For those who lead teams or groups, I have put together a few perks that can be used for professional development.  These include sets of books for your team (all signed, of course), an exclusive discussion guide, invitations to a webinar on the topics from the book, and an optional book author talk, where I can join you 1:1 or in a larger session (virtually via video conference) to answer questions and help you apply the learnings of the book to your team.  Pick what is right for your team, book club, or community group and we can schedule the fall roll-out.  Let's enjoy this thought-provoking journey together and help your team make high-velocity decisions implemented well! 

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

I am the chief marketing and communications officer at Learfield IMG College, a leader in intercollegiate media, licensing, data, and technology. I have spent my career in leadership roles in technology businesses including Amazon Web Services, Honeywell, Intel, Planar, Leyard, and software startups.  I have trained thousands on topics of high-velocity decision making at Amazon and have written about leadership and innovation for years.

I earned an MBA from Pepperdine University and a bachelor’s degree in business and history from Warner Pacific University, where I was recognized as a distinguished alumni. I completed executive education through Harvard Business School, Wharton Online, and Gallup. I proudly serve on the peer review board for Pepperdine’s Graziadio Business Journal and wrote for Forbes. I am a mentor with Pathbuilders and Built by Girls.

I also shamelessly dog-ear books to highlight insights.  I hope that my readers similarly destroy my book finding it useful in their own careers and businesses.

For more information, you can connect with me on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/jenniferbdavis, Twitter @jenniferdavis, and on the book blog at www.wellmadedecisions.com.

 

INTERNATIONAL PREORDERS

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into the pricing here.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

OTHERS WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I understand that not everyone can contribute and there are other ways you can help.

Most people hear about books from their friends or colleagues and I would love for you to tell yours!

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #wellmade and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts. 

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

If you can think of 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy the book send them a text, tag them in a social post, send them an email, or give them a call.  I've created a Give One, Get One package where they can repay you for your recommendation and get a personal note of thanks for me!  I look forward to inviting you both into the Author Community. 

Your support is so appreciated. I couldn’t do this without you!

Thanks again,

Jennifer

story:
The Story of Black, Mixed With 

At 27, I found myself gripped in adversity and down a slippery slope not only to statistically predicted poverty and socio-economics, but swirling in a lack of confidence and self esteem; contorting myself to align with culturally defined perspectives around race, culture, language and gender expectations. Often depressed and ashamed of the challenges that I had experienced, trying to make ends meet, I coined myself the “Black, Single, Broke Mom.” I examined the adversity I faced, embraced the lessons it taught me and recommitted myself to not just beating the odds, but transcending statistics. A bit of an alchemy, if you will, I found the power in authenticity and the value this brings as a catalyst to change.

Black, Mixed With is a creative memoir about finding authenticity through adversity. Adversity for me, strikes in being multiracial and presenting as Black in a racially charged America. This, along side confronting racism not only in society but in my family, facing poverty and raising a child in a single-parent household and ultimately pursuing a higher education and navigating Corporate America. 

My experience is a convergence of diversity markers where the blows of racism, colorism, and classism are replaced with self-acceptance and a full display of unique qualities and characteristics that are not only powerful and beautiful elements of my being but an example that all people who are faced with challenges of authentic identity can relate to, regardless of circumstance. 

Black, Mixed With is the story of a young woman who ultimately confronts the aspects of her life that have caused her shame, isolation and embarrassment and uses the lessons of adversity to transcend into living authentically and harnessing that power to connect, inspire and elevate others.

My name is Erica Kidder and I am the author of Black, Mixed With. I wrote this book because I want Black and Brown women to be empowered in who and all that we are. I want to share stories to inspire people to overcome challenges that hold them back and to accept that of which makes them uniquely them. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that adversity is not shameful; accepting and embracing unique challenges, regardless of what they are cultivated our unique perspective which is our diversity and our best competitive advantage, regardless of the arena in which you play. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to connect with your own experience and bring your authentic self to the table. 

You will love this book if you’re interested in stories and experiences of diverse cultures, challenges in authenticity for multiracial individuals or empathize with the challenges experienced by Black and Brown Americans living in a racially charged America. 

Black, Mixed With speaks to a multiracial audience, those interested in personal and professional development in leadership development and individuals grappling with identity acceptance in a world where you feel like you don’t always belong.  

Ultimately, I hope that Black, Mixed With inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Why does our culture create predetermined stereotype “identity boxes” and how can we learn to embrace our uniqueness and express ourselves freely without feeling the need to “check the box”? 

Connectedness to others is the pillar to success, but why are we so scared to share our authenticity with others to build genuine, solid relationships? 

How can we remove the shame of challenging experiences and adversity and replace it with the courage to live truthfully and use it to build a bridge of empathy with others? 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!
 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

Standard Tiers:
Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
 

About the Author

Erica Kidder is a Senior Project Manager working in the Insurance industry. For over a decade, Erica has transformed countless project teams to high performing, innovative entities through a positive and authentic leadership style. 

Erica’s passion is to inspire Black and Brown women to break free from conventional thoughts and perspectives, ultimately embracing themselves and the beautiful versions that make up each unique individual in a world where race and adversity has a long standing stigma of shame. She is passionate not only about the empowerment of Black and Brown women but about sharing their stories of resiliency, courage and fearlessness. Erica fundamentally believes that the vulnerable sharing of these stories with the world is at the crux of connectedness and empowerment of others to embrace their own adversity and find their authenticity: Accept it, embrace it and accentuate the superpowers that comprise each unique individual. 

You were not born to blend in, you were born to stand out. 

For more information, you can connect with Erica Kidder at Ericakidder18@gmail.com. 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/erica.wilbon.5
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/erica-kidder-pmp-cs...
Instagram: @ericarenee1212  

 

Risks and Challenges 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

story:
Campaign Update

I am humbled and awed by the tremendous support for my book. We exceeded the $9,000 target  for publishing in all formats--paperback, hardback, e-book, and audiobook--during the first week of the campaign!

Because my goal is to raise awareness about unfairness in the criminal justice system and the campaign has received such overwhelming early support, I'm planning to donate the net proceeds from  the last 20 days of the campaign (in other words, from August 3 forward) to The Innocence Project and Gideon's Promise. (The Innocence Project works to exonerate the wrongfully convicted through DNA testing; Gideon's Promise works to help train public defenders who can help provide equal justice for marginalized communities.)

The Story of Presumed Guilty

Presumed Guilty tells the story of Emma Simpson, a New York hedge fund manager. Federal prosecutors are investigating the fund for insider trading. When they can’t make that case, they prosecute Emma for obstruction of justice based on an email she sent during the investigation. A woman who is successful in a challenging career while raising two children and has done nothing but send an email is now on trial for a federal crime and could go to prison.

My name is Alexandra Shapiro and I am the author of Presumed Guilty. I wrote this book to raise awareness about the fact that innocent people can be and sometimes are prosecuted for federal crimes. 

As a criminal defense lawyer, I've handled a number of cases in which something unfair or wrong happened to a client accused of a crime. Often, justice ultimately prevails, but only after years of uncertainty. If you’re very lucky, you might be acquitted after a trial, or you might win an appeal if you were wrongfully convicted. Even in these scenarios, the harm to the person’s life is incalculable and irreparable. Worse yet, sometimes the system can fail regardless of whether you have ample resources and good lawyers, and you can go to prison. It can happen to anyone.

In sum, while our justice system is one of the best in the world, the scales are weighted toward the prosecution, and there are injustices. I wanted to tell that story from the perspective of a defendant to whom readers could relate—someone who might remind them of themselves, or a friend, family member, or neighbor. I also wanted to use a fictional story to make the ideas more accessible and to avoid the technical complexities of some of the real cases that helped inspire the book. 

My hope is that the book will engage readers and provide an entertaining and suspenseful story, but also educate people about the realities of the criminal justice system. If more people understand the system, they’ll be more skeptical of how they view evidence if they are called upon to serve as jurors, and perhaps that will help produce more fair trials. In addition, I hope the book will inspire my readers to work towards criminal justice reform, in whatever small ways they can. And perhaps it will also help people understand that sometimes the solution to a problem isn’t to imprison people. 

I'm planning to donate 25% of all contributions above the $9,000 audio book goal to two non-profit organizations, The Innocence Project, which works to exonerate the wrongfully convicted through DNA testing and to reform the criminal justice system, and Gideon's Promise, a public defender organization whose mission is to help train public defenders who can help provide equal justice for marginalized communities.

The book is set in New York City and Red Hook, a town in upstate New York in the Hudson Valley. The main character is Emma Simpson. She’s 45 years old, and she seems to have it all. She’s risen to the top of a male-dominated profession—she’s a successful portfolio manager who runs the New York office of a big-time hedge fund. She lives on a farm in Red Hook and commutes to the City so that her husband Pierre can run a local winery, and their children can grow up in a more livable rural environment. They have a big house and lots of land. 

Everything seems to be going swimmingly, until March 14, 2012, when a seemingly typical day at the office sets off a chain of events that turns our heroine’s idyllic life into a nightmare. Unbeknownst to Emma, two ambitious federal prosecutors in Manhattan—Ted Hardin and Annie Waters—are hoping to make a big case against Emma’s fund, which they believe is involved in insider trading. When they can’t make that case because the evidence isn’t there, Hardin and Waters seize on an email Emma sent on her way home that fateful day. They decide to make “a federal case” out of an email Emma sent to her colleagues reminding them to follow a company policy about discarding unnecessary documents. 

The book takes readers through Emma’s journey as the target of a federal white-collar prosecution: first, “lawyering up” and hiring a big-time former federal defender; then, navigating the investigation; and finally, a trial for obstruction of justice in the Southern District of New York. Readers will get a glimpse of how the federal criminal justice system works from the inside perspectives of multiple players—the prosecutors, the person facing prosecution, her defense lawyer, and even the jury.

Will Emma get convicted at the end of the trial? Or will she go home to her family? And even if she is acquitted, will that really be the end of her nightmare?

You will love this book if you enjoy crime books and legal thrillers, or if you are a lawyer who enjoys fiction, or if you interested in how the federal criminal justice system really works. 

Ultimately, I hope that Presumed Guilty inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can we make the criminal justice system fairer? 

What reforms can help ensure that prosecutors investigate with an open mind and don’t rush to judgment?

What can we do to make sure that judges and jurors take the presumption of innocence more seriously?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this December 2021

When I raise $6,000, I will publish. When I raise $7,000, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I raise $9,000, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Alexandra Shapiro is a partner and co-founder of Shapiro Arato Bach LLP, a law firm in Manhattan. She is criminal defense lawyer and one of the leading appellate lawyers in the United States. She was one of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's first clerks on the Supreme Court, and served as a federal prosecutor in Manhattan in the late 1990s. 

For a long time, Alexandra wanted to write a book based on her own experiences as a lawyer that would call attention to the fact that innocent people can be and are prosecuted in the United States. And during decades of professional work focused on a different type of writing (crafting legal briefs), she also always secretly fantasized about writing fiction. During the pandemic, Alexandra decided to finally take the plunge and write her first book, a novel that she hopes will raise awareness about problems in our criminal justice system.

Alexandra is a native New Yorker. She has three children and lives in Manhattan with her husband, who is also a criminal defense lawyer, their youngest child, and Jorge, their standard poodle. When Alexandra isn’t writing, practicing law, or spending time with family and friends, she likes to travel and engage in outdoor activities like hiking, running, bicycling, and skiing. She’s also an avid photographer and news junkie.

For more information, you can check out Alexandra’s new website and connect with her on Instagram and Twitter.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #PRESUMEDGUILTY and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Twitter -@Alex_S_author / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Alexandra Shapiro

story:
Story of My Book

The Thriver's Guide to Medical School is a collection of personal stories, with supporting stories from experts worldwide, on the importance of grit, resilience, an optimistic mindset and an unmessable-with attitude. Olivia shares how to bounce back from any failure, setback, heartbreak or challenge and transform them into impactful and dynamic comebacks.

My name is Dr. Olivia Richman, and I am the author of The Thriver's Guide to Medical School. I wrote this book after I was dismissed from medical school and was told to find another career. I felt alone and depleted but knew I had to act if I wanted to bounce back, and that's exactly what I did! I wrote this book so that other people wouldn't feel alone in their struggles, hardships or failures. When they are ready to make a comeback, I provide personal stories and supplemental tools, research and thought-patterns that will change one's perspective to promote a thriving mindset instead of one conditioned to just survive. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover comfort in knowing that failing is normal (even encouraged!). Everyone is dealing with a struggle and it's always possible to bounce back. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for failure because I know that after any failure, can come a wild success. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool for turning fear into power, failure into growth, heartache into vulnerability, and anxiety into savagery.

In this book, you'll learn about courage (speaking up in the face of fear) and that positive thinking is really, really effective. You'll hear stories such as...

- The one where Dr. J, a prestigious plastic surgeon whose toxic and cruel attitude preceded him, began the surgery by screaming at me and ended it by adding me to his favorites list.

- The one where my mentor and dear friend died suddenly and how our group of peers dealt with his death.

- The one where I broke up with my medical school boyfriend, dated half the men - and some women - in NYC, only to find out that I was the one who needed to grow.


You will love this book if you love heroic underdog stories that highlight the importance of having a fearless attitude and unwavering willpower in life.


The Thriver's Guide to Medical School is a nonfiction book that speaks to anyone who is a pre-med, medical student or resident. It is also for anyone who is currently dealing with a failure, loss, setback or challenge in life, and who is willing to learn how to overcome it and grow through it.


The Book - The Thriver's Guide to Medical School


The book is written with 3 parts to each chapter.

Section 1 of each chapter is My Personal Story of a challenge or difficulty I faced and how I worked through it. It also could be a realization I came to and how I got there. You’ll learn about the life of a medical student, challenges any person may face, and insights on how someone can overcame these challenges.

Section 2 of each chapter is the Excerpt from the Expert where I share the opinion from an expert on the topic, whether it be a psychologist, researcher, or neuroscientist, this section contains their POV.

Section 3 of each chapter is the Overcomer’s Story, a story from an ordinary person who has overcome similar circumstances and how they did it. These include stories from TEDx speakers, Michelle Obama, and even my ex-boyfriend!

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
- The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
- The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
- The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
- The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
- The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer, 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
- You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
- Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
- You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
- You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
- You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.


And much more!

 

About the Author

Olivia Richman is a recent medical school graduate, soon-to-be resident physician come July. She is also a YouTuber, podcaster, and TEDx speaker!


Olivia decided to write this book after failing a practice exam for over a year and ultimately being dismissed from medical school. She felt alone and depleted during this time but resiliently bounced back with gust and vehemence. She hopes that with this book, no other medical student - or person - has to feel alone in their struggles and knows that it is possible to make a comeback with the support of herself and other experts

Olivia enjoys force-cuddling her cat, talking at slightly above average volumes and going salsa dancing with her cousins when not in quarantine.

For more information, you can connect with Olivia Richman at orichman1@gmail.com and @GlamourPussMD on social.

International PreSale Orders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ThriversGuide and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Olivia Richman, MD

story:
Many of us live our lives full of exhaustion, fear, confusion, sadness, anxiety, agitation, and numbness due to the side effects of our trauma. This isn’t how it should be nor does it have to be.

My name is Dr. Fanike and I am the author of What the F%$k is Your Problem?!: Becoming an Active Worker in Healing Your Trauma. I wrote this book because I found myself as an adult feeling resentment, anger, and sadness from my own childhood traumas and then a series of traumas as an adult. I became a licensed trauma therapist to use my life experiences of trauma and healing to help others along their healing journeys.

This book explores the intersections between multiple themes, embracing the side effects of one’s trauma as an individualized journey that can be used to empower others to heal, the power of women and the importance of making the decision to heal, and how learning what it means to be an active worker along the healing journey can empower you and lead to owing your journey.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will see this book as an opportunity to decide to take the steps to heal yourself and help others to heal and learn alongside the women I have interviewed throughout this book on the importance of healing. The journey of healing can be scary and difficult but the emotional and mental freedom is worth it all in the end.

You will love this book if you are a woman that is trying to heal from trauma, a woman that wants to help other women heal from trauma, or a woman that is deciding if she wants to take the journey to heal from her trauma.

What the F%$k is Your Problem?!: Becoming an Active Worker in Healing Your Trauma speaks to women everywhere that are tired of the side effects of their trauma, want to improve their lives, and are ready to do the work to begin their healing journey.

Ultimately, I hope that What the F%$k is Your Problem?! inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How do I begin to heal myself and take steps on my healing journey?
  • What is the impact of trauma on women and their lives long term?
  • Why is that many women are angry and have difficulty in relationships?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

This book will be published with New Degree Press. This campaign functions as a pre-order, enabling my book to be published while giving supporters first access to the book and the option for additional perks. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in January 2022.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You will be invited to my launch party in January 2022 so I can show my appreciation.
  • And much more!

Standard Tiers:

  • Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
  • Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
  • Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

Community Tiers:

  • Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the book gets published (this is the minimum needed)
  • Tier 2: Hit $8,500 and the book gets paperback, hardcover and audiobook editions
  • Tier 3: Hit $10,000 and everyone gets What the F%$k is Your Problem?! clothing merchandise
  • Tier 4: Hit $12,000 and everyone gets invited to a 4-hour group session focused on identifying and healing trauma

Dr. Fanike-Kiara Olugbala Young is a Doctor of Behavioral Health, Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Master Reiki Practitioner, author, healer, consultant, coach, wife, mother, sister, and friend that strives to make a positive impact on the lives of others. She specializes in healing trauma by focusing on mind, body, and spiritual healing.

Dr. Fanike has a passion for healing adolescent and adult females wholistically while providing others with real-life coping tools that can be used to help heal themselves. Dr. Fanike wrote this book after embarking on her own healing journey and discovered what tools were effective for her along the journey. Her goal is to help heal as many people around the world as she can.

For more information, you can connect with Dr. Fanike at fanike@drfanike.com and on Instagram and Facebook.

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal.

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (32 days).

Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #WhattheFKbook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Facebook - @drfanike / @NewDegreePress 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Dr. Fanike

story:
Story of My Book

Welp: Climate Change & Arctic Identities is a travel memoir about navigating social life in Tromsø, Norway (Romssa, Sápmi) as a Black, mixed-race girl from Alaska. Through vivid depictions of reindeer herding, intimate reflections, and fun stories about making community abroad, you’ll learn that climate change is inherently a cultural problem embedded in our relationship to the environment.

My name is Michaela Stith and I am the author of Welp. I wrote this book because the Arctic is warming at twice the rate of the global average, but most people don’t understand what those drastic changes mean for people who live in the north. While living in the Lower 48, I learned that many people think of the Arctic as an icy wasteland. I read many travel memoirs in preparation for my year and half in Norway, but even those books that acknowledged people didn’t warn about the racism I would encounter there.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover truths about the Arctic as it really is. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to enjoy a beautiful, real narrative about the north that fully considers racism, climate change, and other systemic problems northerners experience.

In this book, you'll explore the intersections of race and identity, environment, and the lessons I've learned through international travel. There are stories about:

  • Living with Norwegian housemates and slowly building community.
  • Fishing, hiking and spending time outdoors in Alaska with my family.
  • Visiting reindeer herders in Sápmi and learning about the Indigenous knowledge that guides their livelihood.
  • Being a 5’2“-tall security guard at a Norwegian festival (take a guess how that worked out...)

 

You will love this book if you are a traveler, care about the environment, or want to learn more about the Arctic. You need this book if you think climate change is a problem, but one that only privileged people have time for. Welp speaks to northerners and southerners who want to grapple with social change and climate change in a new way — from a vulnerable and personal, deeply collaborative perspective.

Ultimately, I hope that Welp inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, engaging questions like:

  • How do climate change and land use change affect Arctic communities?
  • Is Norway the liberal utopia imagined in America? (Short answer: no.)
  • What can Americans learn from the lifeways of people in Alaska, Norway and the broader Arctic?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing Arctic climate change and identities will change us all for the better.

 

The Book

The book is written in five parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note through chapter 3. Upon arrival in Norway in July 2018, I strived to make friends and build community. You’ll be introduced to my housemates and new bestevenn (best friend), read about Norwegian foods like brunost, and explore the international Indigenous music festival, Riddu Riđđu.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6, where you’ll read about childhood memories and my family’s history in Alaska. The landscape in Norway causes me to reflect on the effects of climate change on the environment I remember growing up in. Through research and story-telling, I illustrate how national and global trends of anti-blackness manifest in the 49th state.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. Throughout autumn my friendship deepens with bestevenn. Before joining the Wilson Center she lived and worked in Tromsø, Norway as a Hart Leadership Fellow and, later, as an Associate at the Arctic Council Indigenous Peoples’ Secretariat. Story of My Book
Welp: Climate Change & Arctic Identities is a travel memoir about navigating social life in Tromsø, Norway (Romssa, Sápmi) as a Black, mixed-race girl from Alaska. Through vivid depictions of reindeer herding, intimate reflections, and fun stories about making community abroad, you’ll learn that climate change is inherently a cultural problem embedded in our relationship to the environment.My name is Michaela Stith and I am the author of Welp. I wrote this book because the Arctic is warming at twice the rate of the global average, but most people don’t understand what those drastic changes mean for people who live in the north. While living in the Lower 48, I learned that many people think of the Arctic as an icy wasteland. I read many travel memoirs in preparation for my year and half in Norway, but even those books that acknowledged people didn’t warn about the racism I would encounter there.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover truths about the Arctic as it really is. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to enjoy a beautiful, real narrative about the north that fully considers racism, climate change, and other systemic problems northerners experience.In this book, you'll explore the intersections of race and identity, environment, and the lessons I've learned through international travel. There are stories about:

Living with Norwegian housemates and slowly building community.
Fishing, hiking and spending time outdoors in Alaska with my family.
Visiting reindeer herders in Sápmi and learning about the Indigenous knowledge that guides their livelihood.
Being a 5’2“-tall security guard at a Norwegian festival (take a guess how that worked out...)

 
You will love this book if you are a traveler, care about the environment, or want to learn more about the Arctic. How do climate change and land use change affect Arctic communities?
Is Norway the liberal utopia imagined in America? (Short answer: no.)
What can Americans learn from the lifeways of people in Alaska, Norway and the broader Arctic?
