story:
Machine See, Machine Do is a book about the history of prejudice in the U.S. criminal justice system and how artificial intelligence and automation cause that history to repeat itself. This book provides a new perspective on the problem of algorithmic bias that focuses on history and policy decisions.

My name is Patrick K. Lin and I am the author of Machine See, Machine Do. I wrote this book because AI and other high-tech tools are often depicted as miracles that can fix the world's problems. However, they can also embed and reinforce bias and exclusion—even when they are used with the best intentions. Nowhere is this more problematic than in the criminal justice system.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how pervasive and troubling this technology can be as well as how history informs the way this technology is being used today. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for algorithmic bias and the criminal justice system. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as an approachable guide to help you have a more nuanced understanding of how technology affects poor people and people of color, and what solutions exist to make our technology, as well as the way we use that technology, safer and more ethical.

In this book, you'll learn about how bias impacts both the design of technology as well as the use of technology. You'll read stories about:

  • how algorithms and high-tech tools are used in policing, surveillance, forensics, sentencing, and parole;
  • how technology is used in unexpected ways, such as suggesting which neighborhoods to police, predicting whether someone is more or less likely to commit a crime, or determining how long someone's sentence should be;
  • how different lawyers, professors, technologists, AI ethicists, and activists have thought about and studied AI and its impact on our civil liberties.

 

You will love this book if you are someone who cares deeply about criminal justice reform and the role of technology in our day-to-day lives. If you are someone who enjoys learning about how history shapes the present and how past decisions and policies still have lingering effects on today's communities, you will also get a lot out of this book. 

Machine See, Machine Do is a nonfiction book that speaks to young people in law, policy, and technology spaces and those who are interested in developing safer, fairer, and more ethical technology. After all, our technology can only be as good as we are.

This book is written in five parts.

Part 1: Ghost in the Machine contains chapters 1 and 2. Prediction works like a mirror. If predictive algorithms rely on historical data, what kinds of predictions will it make? This part introduces you to the problem of algorithmic bias as well as the different ways history influences the design and use of technology. This part explains how algorithms can embody and perpetuate prejudices that already exist. You will also read about the first documented instance of algorithmic bias, which involved a computer program used to screen student applications for admission to a London medical school.

Part 2: Automating the Watchers contains chapters 3 to 6. This part explores the ways algorithms and automation encode racist police practices, such as broken windows policing, the war on crime, and stop-and-frisk tactics. As police departments across the United States adopt predictive policing algorithms, surveillance cameras, drones, and facial recognition, we need to investigate how these invasive and unregulated tools impact our civil liberties. I am excited to share what I've learned from conversations I had with AI criminologist and data activist Renée Cummings; Albert Fox Cahn, founder and executive director of the Surveillance Technology Oversight Project (S.T.O.P.); and privacy expert Clare Garvie from the Center on Privacy & Technology at Georgetown Law.

Part 3: False Positive contains chapters 7 and 8. Forensic evidence has frequently been presented as an infallible and foolproof crime-solving tool. However, forensic science as a discipline has never been subjected to any rigorous scientific review. Worse yet, the algorithms designed to analyze DNA evidence are protected by trade secret laws, which prevent the accused from challenging the very results that determine their guilt or innocence. The truth is judges and juries have sometimes sent people to jail based on junk science. In this part, you will read about Clinton Hughes, a forensic DNA attorney at the Brooklyn Defender Services; Richard Torres, a criminal defense attorney and former DNA Unit attorney at the Legal Aid Society; and Jerome Greco, a public defender in the Digital Forensics Unit of the Legal Aid Society.

Part 4: May it Please the Algorithm contains chapters 9 to 11. Algorithms are playing a larger role in how our justice system punishes people. Judges across the country rely on algorithms to predict someone's likelihood of committing a crime, using this information when making sentencing decisions. Today, algorithms are also used to tracking someone's every move while they are on probation, turning what some believe to be an alternative to incarceration into just another form of incarceration. In this part, you will read about Rebecca Wexler, a UC Berkeley law professor who has researched, written, and spoken extensively about trade secrets, technology, and criminal justice. You will also read about Aaron Horowitz, a computer scientist and chief data scientist at the ACLU.

Part 5: Patching the Problem contains chapters 12 to 15. No matter how much our technology improves, if we do not also improve, bias will continue to live on in our systems and institutions. In this part, I propose three avenues that can be taken to begin to solve bias in our technology and criminal justice system. First, laws must be introduced to set standards and rein in this unregulated technology. Second, as algorithms affect the public's safety and liberty, we need to start thinking about tech companies and software developers as policymakers. Finally, we need to rethink humanity's relationship with technology. This may be a technology problem, but it is a problem created by humans, perpetuated by humans, and impacting humans. How do we even begin to fix the biased data and technology used in our criminal justice system if we don’t also think about how people treat other people? In this part, you will read insights from Frank Pasquale, a law professor at Brooklyn Law School and an expert on the law of AI, algorithms, and machine learning; Brandon del Pozo, a postdoctoral researcher at Brown University who served 19 years in the NYPD and four as the chief of police in Burlington, Vermont; Esha Bhandari, the deputy director of the ACLU's Speech, Privacy, and Technology Project, where she focuses on the impact of big data and AI on civil liberties; and Liz O'Sullivan, the CEO of a new algorithmic fairness company called Parity.

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, eBook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this December 2021.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

This pre-order campaign will cover the production costs for the following editions:

Patrick K. Lin is a tech enthusiast, researcher, and data activist interested in AI, algorithmic bias, surveillance, and data privacy. Currently, he serves as the Executive Notes Editor of the Brooklyn Law Review. He is also currently serving as the Vice Curator of the Global Shapers Hub in Queens, New York, a World Economic Forum initiative. Patrick has worked for a variety of legal services organizations, including the DNA Unit at the Legal Aid Society, NYLAG's Special Litigation Unit, and the ACLU's Speech, Privacy, and Technology Project. In law school, he also interned for Eisenberg & Baum LLP's Artificial Intelligence Fairness & Data Privacy practice. Previously, he interned for federal judges in the E.D.N.Y. and S.D.N.Y. Prior to law school, he was a technology consultant in Ernst & Young's Data & Analytics department. 

Patrick wrote this book because he believes that despite the many ways technology makes our lives better, technology is also being used in cruel, invasive, and unexpected ways. He finds that AI and automation are often talked about as innovative new technologies that are constantly getting smarter. However, what is often overlooked is the human element: humans design technology; humans use technology; and, most importantly, humans choose how technology is used on other humans. Worse yet, when today's technology relies on yesterday's data, it will simply mirror our past mistakes and biases. Patrick wrote this book to be an approachable introduction and guide so that people can get as riled up about this problem as he is. 

Patrick was born in Ontario, Canada, grew up in New Jersey, and has been living in New York City for several years. Outside of writing this book, Patrick enjoys oil painting, going to art exhibits, playing video games, watching movies, and spending time and cooking with his partner. 

Please feel free to connect with him at patrick.kyle.lin@gmail.com as well as Instagram and LinkedIn.

For international pre-orders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you.
  • Select the pink "Back It" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount. This choice bypasses the shipping address page.
  • Use this form to share your mailing address so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal or Venmo. 

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-order backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here's how:

  • Please share my Pre-Order Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #MachineSeeMachineDo and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can share my Pre-Order Campaign by clicking on the "Share" buttons at the top of this page.
  • Please share this book with any friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. This book is written to be very approachable, so anyone who is just curious or wants to learn more can get a lot out of it!

 

Thank you so much for all of your support and words of encouragement!

 

Thanks again,
Patrick K. Lin

story:
Thank you for making this campaign a success! Pre-orders will now be available at iquitbook.com

 

*Update Dec 18: We have now raised $728 for Her Justice!

 

The Story of My Book

I Quit! The Life-Affirming Joy of Giving Up is a collection of stories of real people and how they summoned the courage to quit things in their lives.

My name is Coonoor Behal and I am the author of I Quit! The Life-Affirming Joy of Giving Up. I wrote this book because I’ve always loved quitting stories. I think learning the WHYs behind someone quitting something gets to the heart of who that person is and what their values are. I’ve also experienced quitting as a very positive experience in my own life - it’s always represented progress toward what I want in life. I knew I couldn’t be the only one out there who had a different view on quitting. Turns out I was right!

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that quitting doesn’t deserve the stigma or shame society gives it...and that “quitters” are often to be celebrated for their courage, strength, and self-knowledge.

In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for rethinking quitting.

Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you re-examine the things you quit - and don’t quit - in your life. Quitting is a choice...but so is not quitting.

In this book, you'll hear stories such as...

  • I quit my mom
  • I quit heroin
  • I quit the American Dream
  • I quit the circus
  • I quit drinking soda
  • I quit evangelical Christianity
  • I quit being a doctor
  • I quit Washington, DC
  • And many more intriguing stories of the jobs, people, places, aspirations, habits, and identities people decided to leave behind.

 

You'll also read memoir-ish snippets from my own life sprinkled throughout the book.

You will love this book if you...

  • Are indecisive about making big life choices and need some inspiration and motivation
  • Have experienced your own quitting stories and want to learn from others on how they reframed quitting for themselves
  • Enjoy deep peeks in to the lives of others and what makes them tick

 

I Quit! The Life-Affirming Joy of Giving Up will help you entirely rethink quitting and quitters -- and will probably encourage you to re-examine how you make choices in your own life.

 

The Book

I Quit! The Life-Affirming Joy of Giving Up is divided into eight sections:

1. Introduction/Author's Note by me, where I tell the origin story of my own interest in quitting and share some of my good - and bad - quits.

2. Stories about quitting habits

3. Stories about quitting jobs and careers

4. Stories about quitting places

5. Stories about quitting identities

6. Stories about quitting aspirations

7. Stories about quitting people and relationships

8. Conclusion by me

 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process and my book tour and speaking engagements (which have already begun!)
  • And much more!

 

***It's important to note that, without this pre-sale campaign's success, there will be no book to publish come April

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #IQuitBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts. I am @mindhatchllc on Twitter, @mindhatch_llc on IG, and you can find me on Facebook and LinkedIn using my full name.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.


Thanks again for your support and generosity, no matter what form it takes!
Coonoor

 

About the Author

Coonoor Behal is the Founder & CEO of Mindhatch, a consultancy specializing in getting companies and organizations better results with creativity through: Design Thinking, Organizational Improv™, Innovation Facilitation, and Diversity & Inclusion. Coonoor serves on the board of the Tombolo Institute of Bellevue College's Design Thinking Program and is on the board of the nonprofit Street Entrepreneurs. She is also a staff writer for the satirical news site, The Cherry Swamp. In her spare time, she is a huge fan of professional tennis, performing improv comedy, and her Bernese Mountain Dog named Nikka.

Goal update #2:

With a few days left in the campaign, I am able to extend my goal to $8000, which will give me option to publish an audiobook.  That will also let me donate $1,000 to covid efforts in India.

Goal update:

Thank you to all that supported my campaign so far.  I am close (~10 books) from my goal of $6000, which will allow me to publish a hardcover.

I set a stretch goal of $7000, which will allow me to donate to Covid efforts in India.  Help me get there, and help India get through this tragic crisis.

Story of my Book

Next Gen Customer Success is about re imagining customer success, and providing a guide to the c-suite on how to build a customer-centric company. In my experience, it is easy to say ‘customer success is a core value or company-wide mindset’ but it is much harder to put that into action. Without clarity around the ‘what’ and ‘how’ of bringing this mindset to life, we default to building better silos, losing sight of the promise of success of our customers.

My name is Sasi Yajamanyam and I am the author of Next Gen Customer Success. In this book, I present a model that brings together different functions like Sales, Marketing, Product, and Customer Success (CS) to achieve the outcome of customer success. I also offer specific guidance to leaders of these customer-facing functions on how to work across silos.

My hope for this book is to change the conversation of customer success as not just a function but as the promise we make to customers. Concepts from this book will help leaders from different functions like Sales, Marketing, Product, and CS take specific actions to achieve customer-centric growth. If you believe everyone has a role in customer success, but not sure how to make that happen, you’ll find this book helpful. Ultimately, I want this book to help you deliver on the promise of success for your customers.

In this book, you'll learn about a new model for customer success, one that starts with a common understanding of customers and the changes that the department leaders should implement. Some key insights you will learn include:

  • How to build a common understanding of customers, and what success means to them
  • How transforming employee experience is at the center of delivering exceptional customer experience
  • Changes needed to implement the new model across processes, incentives, skills, and systems

You will love this book if you believe customers are the growth engine for your company, want to bring customer-centric mindset to life, and if you are looking for a framework to bridge the organizational silos.

Next Gen Customer Success is a nonfiction book that speaks to leaders of customer-facing functions from Sales and Marketing to Product and Customer Success who want to look at customer success in a new way.

The Book - Next Gen Customer Success

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters [1-3]. In these chapters, I look at the history of Customer Success, how we got to where we are today, the challenges of current state, and the need for a new model.

Part 2 contains chapters [4-11]. In this part, I spend a chapter each on the 8 elements of the new model. The 8 elements are: Define Customer, Define Success, Establish Common Language, Define Portfolio of Services, Deliver Best Fit Service, Unified Customer Data, and Digital Engagement Platforms. Each chapter includes stories and insights to help you apply these concepts to your organization.

Part 3 contains chapters [12-15]. This new model requires that leaders of different functions make people, process, and technology changes in their organizations. In this part, I devote a chapter for each leader, going into the details of changes these leaders should make - Chief Customer Officer, Chief Sales Officer, Chief Marketing Officer, and Chief Product Officer.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • Signed copy of the book.
  • Participate in my author’s journey - select the cover and title, provide feedback on early drafts of Introduction and chapters
  • Personal coaching sessions or Team presentations on my book
  • Access to additional tools and templates to implement the new model
  • Recognition in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • Invitation to my book’s launch party (hopefully, in-person if we can do so safely)

About the Author

Sasi Yajamanyam is building next generation of customer success programs at ServiceNow. Specifically, he is creating scalable ways to arm front-line customer success professionals with the knowledge, tools, and resources they need to be the best-in-class advisors. He enjoys creating programs and building teams from ground up, and has done so for the better part of 10 years in the customer success and consulting arena.

Sasi’s interest in Customer Success is rooted in his deep passion for helping customers adopt new products, realize value from technology, and ultimately be better at their jobs. His experience in building cross-functional programs, and belief that we can deliver customer success only through a cross-functional approach drove him to write this book.

Sasi’s spends most of his free time on his kids’ activities including coaching sports he’s never played. But that was before the pandemic upended all of our schedules, and lives. He decided to use the abundance of free time to scratch the ‘writing itch’ (hence the book!), and explore new hiking paths in northern VA. Sasi is looking forward to balancing new found habits of hiking and walking (his boys’ think “it’s so booorrring”) with kids’ sports this Spring.

For more information, you can connect with Sasi Yajamanyam at syajamanyam@gmail.com and on LinkedIn.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NextGenCustomerSuccess and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!


Sasi Yajamanyam

story:
Story of My Book

Take Charge of Your Life: Rewire Your Brain for Confidence, Focus, and Taking Action is about how high-achieving women have overcome self-doubt, perfectionism, and negative self-talk, and have gone on to create successful lives and careers that fulfill them, and how you can too.

My name is Rachell Kitchen and I am the author of Take charge of Your Life: Rewire Your Brain for Confidence, Focus, and Taking Action. I wrote this book because there was a point in my life where the critical voice in my head, which I call a gremlin, was raging and running amok. Instead of proactively creating my life, my life was creating me. My gremlin’s annoying voice was on loud and repeat; it had me compromising my life and kept me playing small. As I coached other women, I noticed that I wasn’t the only one with a gremlin. There are lots of women who were like me. Who felt overwhelmed, stuck, and not in control of their lives. And like me, their gremlin impacted everything they were experiencing, including their relationships, physical health, and ability to reach their personal and professional goals.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how this hidden, unexpected thing may be slowing you down or stopping you from creating the life you want and deserve. Ultimately, I want you to see this piece as a guide, helping you realize through the women’s stories told in the book where your gremlin messages are hiding and how you can benefit from doubting your doubts so you can level up in every area of your life.

In this book, you’ll hear raw, honest, and empowering stories from real women who have rumbled with the menace in their minds and won. Through these women’s experiences, you’ll discover how childhood adversity, societal and cultural expectations, and the opinions of others shape self-belief, inner expectations and create self-sabotaging and self-limiting behaviors that diminish your personal power. This book includes excerpts from successful female entrepreneurs, high-level professionals, heart-centered coaches, writers, and up-and-coming millennials who have learned the benefit of doubting their doubts and, as a result, have transformed their mental narratives to take their power back from their gremlins.

You’ll love this book if you appreciate personal once-in-a-lifetime moments of revelation and epiphanies, and you enjoy learning through this lens. And as a result, you have your own personal aha’s.

Take Charge of Your Life: Rewire Your Brain for Confidence, Focus, and Taking Action is a nonfiction book that will speak to high-achieving women who are looking to get unstuck in their lives. It will also resonate with those looking to increase their self-belief and boost their confidence.
 

 

Take Charge of Your Life: Rewire Your Brain for Confidence Focus and Taking Action

The book is a compilation of personal narratives written in 3 parts to help increase your awareness of your gremlin messages so that you can break free from self-doubt.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1 - 4. In this section, you will hear from women about their childhood experiences, the effect of perfectionism, learn about cognitive distortions, and ANTs (automatic negative thoughts) and how these elements chip away at your confidence. This section also includes research and my analysis of how getting outside our comfort zone impacts our thoughts.

Part 2 contains chapters 5 - 8. In this section, women will share their stories of how cultural expectations, family beliefs, life traumas, and other outside influences affect their self-belief. This section also includes my personal gremlin story of connecting the dots from my own life experiences to my negative self-talk triggers.

Rachell Kitchen, CEO of Level Up For Life Coach, LLC is a certified Life and Transition coach, speaker, and international bestselling author. She is a co-author of Woman Thriving Fearless in Business, a contributor in # Sisterhood Connection A Year of Empowerment, and a featured expert on fast-tracking your goals using vision boards in the international bestseller, The One Thing Every Mom Needs to Know. She holds an Associate Certified Coach credential from the International Coach Federation (ICF), the recognized governing body of coaching worldwide, and has 500+ hours of coaching experience. In addition, she received her training from the Institute for Professional Excellence in Coaching (iPEC). Before coaching, Rachell earned a B.S. in Industry & Technology from Northern Illinois University. She went on to have a successful career as an Industrial Engineer and entrepreneur in the Engineering field.

Rachell helps women entrepreneurs and professionals who are balancing a lot of plates in the air and are struggling with worry and overwhelm because they are dealing with what she calls a gremlin, which is blocking them from achieving success in either their personal or professional life.

Now she speaks, gives interviews, and has unique transformative programs to help women get clarity on what their gremlin is and how to control it, so it no longer controls them, their career or business, or their life!

Rachell wrote this book to help high-achieving women take their power back from their gremlins. She’s an avid believer in the power of self and how it can be harnessed to propel individuals beyond where they thought they might be able to go. I wrote this book because there was a point in my life where the critical voice in my head, which I call a gremlin, was raging and running amok. Instead of proactively creating my life, my life was creating me. My gremlin’s annoying voice was on loud and repeat; it had me compromising my life and kept me playing small. As I coached other women, I noticed that I wasn’t the only one with a gremlin. There are lots of women who were like me. Who felt overwhelmed, stuck, and not in control of their lives. story:
The Story of Embodied: An Urban Yoga Monk’s Memoir + Manifesto for Modern Living

Enter into the wild wisdom-experience of a modern urban yogi who used her life as fuel for radical personal transformation - for both herself and her students. Honing the ancient tools of yoga’s philosophy in entirely modern ways, this book is part memoir, part thought leadership, part toolkit for modern living. Accessible, deep, darkly humorous and inspiring.

My name is Swami Jaya Devi and I am the author of Embodied: An Urban Yoga Monk’s Memoir + Manifesto for Modern Living. I wrote this book because people need accessible, effective tools for thriving in today’s upside-down world. I share a modern take on yoga’s ancient teachings along with relevant stories of how they healed my life. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired, intrigued and empowered.

You will love this book if you are a spiritual seeker, a yogi or meditator, or someone dealing with everyday burnout looking for ways to fill your cup. Deep yoga philosophy is about becoming less fragmented and more you, which is the union, the wholeness, that yoga promises. These tools and teachings are potent and thought-provoking. They ignite a longing we all experience: to be understood, seen, valued, and loved from the outside in, but even more importantly, from the inside out.

Ultimately, I hope Embodied will give you tools to live a deeper, more fulfilling life. To access your innate wellbeing and live with an open heart. To love when it’s hard and when it’s easy, but to choose love and integrity over and over again, loving anyway. I hope my book will help you realize that love is always a choice (maybe the most powerful one we make) until it becomes a way of being and living in the world.

What We Need + What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this December, 2021.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

  • Tier 1: Hit $6,000 and the ebook/softcover editions get published
  • Tier 2: Hit $7,000 and the book will get a hardcover edition
  • Tier 3: Hit $9,000 and we’ll get an audiobook edition
  • Tier 4: Hit $14,000 and we’ll support marketing for the book AND create a BIPOC Scholarship Fund for aspiring yogis
 

About the Author

Swami Jaya Devi is a mindfulness teacher and urban yoga monk who has dedicated her life to living and embodying these teachings. Her passion for sharing them is palpable through her raw vulnerability, her live-it-to-learn-it insight, and her ability to keep loving anyway, no matter how wild the world gets. She has inspired thousands of others to do the same. Swami once asked, “What would the world be like if all of us trusted and shared the light of our inner hearts in each situation - full throttle, no holding back?”

With her Goldendoodle pup, Sukha, snug by her side, Swami is a joyful, down-to-earth catalyst for personal growth, determined that we can heal the world - for all of us - one heart at a time.

For more information, you can connect with Swami Jaya Devi
via email at swamijayadevi@kashiatlanta.org
on IG @swamijayadevi
on FaceBook @swamijayadevi
on LinkedIn @swamijayadevi

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

story:
Redefining Motivation: Finding Success through Meaningful Connections unveils a new framework in which to view motivation, inspiration, and pursuing all of your passions. This book will show you that it is possible to do multiple things at once, and in fact, it’s actually better if you do that.

When I was younger, it was so hard for me to answer the question: “what do you want to be when you grow up?” It wasn’t that I didn’t have hobbies and interests; the problem was that I had too many to choose from. Now, even though I’m a full time educator, I still make it a priority to pursue all of my passions at the same time. I’ve found that, in doing so, I am able to see connections between them that weren’t obvious before.

My hope is that, in reading Redefining Motivation, you will learn to leverage the connections between your own interests. In this book, I hope to instill in you the belief that motivation and success are both subjective. There is no such thing as an unmotivated person; anyone is able to become motivated on their own terms.

Ultimately, I want you to use this as a tool to help you pursue every passion without being overwhelmed.

In this book, you'll learn about how people's unique interests connect in unexpected ways. You'll hear stories such as...

  • How my love of poetry shifted into a passion for photography, and how being a photographer has influenced my work as a teacher

  • How Taylor Evans, a PhD student, scientist, and fashion blogger, combines her interests in science + style to build an audience
  • How Franca Muller Paz, a Baltimore City educator, musician, and organizer balances her many responsibilities with genuine self care

You will love this book if you have always found yourself torn between multiple hobbies, unsure how to do them all, or if you feel overwhelmed in your current job, unable to find time to reflect, relax, and reset.

The book is written in four parts:

  • Part 1 contains a comprehensive overview of the state of the world today, basic theories of motivation, and what generally motivates people. It ends with my own personal story regarding motivation and inspiration.
  • Part 2 introduces case studies that highlight why people think they can only do one thing, and why that perspective is wrong.
  • Part 3 expands on how it’s possible to do more than one thing, and details what aspects of society make it difficult.
  • Part 4 ends with a discussion on particular challenges that make “success” difficult to achieve for some people, and key actionable steps to pursuing one’s passions. A conclusion chapter wraps everything up, reiterating how to view motivation and success differently.

Redefining Motivation: Finding Success through Meaningful Connections speaks to people with multiple interests and people who want to look at the topics of motivation, inspiration, and success in a new light.

 

Leonor M Willis is an educator, photographer, and now, first-time author. She graduated from Georgetown University with a degree in Culture and Politics, and is about to graduate from Johns Hopkins University with her Masters in Education. She is currently wrapping up her second year as an Urban Teachers fellow, and working as a high school English and Special Education teacher with Baltimore City Public Schools.

She wrote this book because she wants to share her perspective with the world: it is possible to pursue all of one’s passions at once, and to do them well.

When not teaching, Leonor enjoys creating, especially by capturing photographs. In particular, she has taken a particular liking to 35 mm film and vintage Polaroids. She also loves spending time with her two cats, Charlemagne and Napoleon, and her puppy Maurice.

For more information, you can connect with Leonor through her website leonormwillis.com, or on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook.

story_txt:
Redefining Motivation: Finding Success through Meaningful Connections unveils a new framework in which to view motivation, inspiration, and pursuing all of your passions. This book will show you that it is possible to do multiple things at once, and in fact, it’s actually better if you do that.When I was younger, it was so hard for me to answer the question: “what do you want to be when you grow up?” It wasn’t that I didn’t have hobbies and interests; the problem was that I had too many to choose from. Now, even though I’m a full time educator, I still make it a priority to pursue all of my passions at the same time. I’ve found that, in doing so, I am able to see connections between them that weren’t obvious before.My hope is that, in reading Redefining Motivation, you will learn to leverage the connections between your own interests. In this book, I hope to instill in you the belief that motivation and success are both subjective. There is no such thing as an unmotivated person; anyone is able to become motivated on their own terms.Ultimately, I want you to use this as a tool to help you pursue every passion without being overwhelmed.

In this book, you'll learn about how people's unique interests connect in unexpected ways. You'll hear stories such as...

How my love of poetry shifted into a passion for photography, and how being a photographer has influenced my work as a teacher
How Taylor Evans, a PhD student, scientist, and fashion blogger, combines her interests in science + style to build an audience
How Franca Muller Paz, a Baltimore City educator, musician, and organizer balances her many responsibilities with genuine self care

You will love this book if you have always found yourself torn between multiple hobbies, unsure how to do them all, or if you feel overwhelmed in your current job, unable to find time to reflect, relax, and reset.
The book is written in four parts:

Part 1 contains a comprehensive overview of the state of the world today, basic theories of motivation, and what generally motivates people. It ends with my own personal story regarding motivation and inspiration.
Part 2 introduces case studies that highlight why people think they can only do one thing, and why that perspective is wrong.
Part 3 expands on how it’s possible to do more than one thing, and details what aspects of society make it difficult.
Part 4 ends with a discussion on particular challenges that make “success” difficult to achieve for some people, and key actionable steps to pursuing one’s passions. A conclusion chapter wraps everything up, reiterating how to view motivation and success differently.

Redefining Motivation: Finding Success through Meaningful Connections speaks to people with multiple interests and people who want to look at the topics of motivation, inspiration, and success in a new light.
 

Leonor M Willis is an educator, photographer, and now, first-time author. She graduated from Georgetown University with a degree in Culture and Politics, and is about to graduate from Johns Hopkins University with her Masters in Education. She is currently wrapping up her second year as an Urban Teachers fellow, and working as a high school English and Special Education teacher with Baltimore City Public Schools.She wrote this book because she wants to share her perspective with the world: it is possible to pursue all of one’s passions at once, and to do them well.When not teaching, Leonor enjoys creating, especially by capturing photographs. In particular, she has taken a particular liking to 35 mm film and vintage Polaroids. She also loves spending time with her two cats, Charlemagne and Napoleon, and her puppy Maurice.For more information, you can connect with Leonor through her website leonormwillis.com, or on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook.

story:
Campaign Update - New Hardcover Funding Goal of $6500

With the $5,500 goal surpassed, the paperback and e-book are officially a GO! Thank you to everyone that has joined my Author Community by preordering Redefining Success. The outreach and support for my book has been truly humbling.  

Given the immense levels of support, my publisher (New Degree Press) sees an opportunity to push for the hardcover goal! Candidly, this is also something that I feel would be insanely cool. Don't hardcover books just feel good in your hands? With this in mind, the new stretch funding goal is $6500.

Story of My Book

Redefining Success is all about achieving greater happiness, fulfillment, and alignment in life around the things that matter to you! The book is the combination of a plethora of amazing interviews, extensive scientific research, and my personal experience. My work has shown that we each need to define what "success" means for ourselves because if we don’t live aligned with our own definition of success, happiness and fulfillment will remain elusive no matter how much we accomplish in life.

My name is Michael Biarnes and I am the author of Redefining Success. I wrote this book because I personally went through what I affectionately call an “Oh Sh*t Moment”, which made me completely rethink what I was doing with my life. Despite having what society would deem as “success” (wife, house, friends, professional accomplishments, etc.) I found myself struggling to balance everything in life, unhappy, and asking myself “Is this it?” After speaking with peers, mentors, and friends, I realized that I was not alone in this struggle. Through endless conversations, research, and lessons, the seeds for this book were planted.

I’m no guru (far from it!) but by sharing the stories of extraordinary individuals, some fascinating research, and my own personal journey, my hope is to give you a “cheat code” to redefine success for yourself so that you can achieve greater happiness and fulfillment in your own life. Ultimately, it will be your own answers and actions that will enable you to attain true success for yourself!

In this book, you'll learn about the science of happiness and how others have redefined success for themselves. You'll hear stories such as...

  • As an eight time Olympic medal winner, Apolo Ohno needed to completely pivot in his life at the young age of 28 to find his new true-north in life as he was forced into retirement from speed skating. Despite spending his entire life to that point eating, breathing, and thinking about speed skating, he needed to redefine success to find happiness and fulfillment again.
  • After a near death experience, Arianna Huffington needed to realign her lifestyle to literally save her life. The decision to prioritize her own wellbeing led to the founding of her new company Thrive Global, which is committed to ending workplace burnout and fostering wellbeing in the work place.
  • Despite living the lavish lifestyle of a Hollywood writer/producer, Matthew Berry decided to quit everything and “chase happiness” to pursue his passion blogging about fantasy football. This decision to work basically for free, eventually led to an Emmy award, a role in Avenger’s: Endgame, and becoming the face of the entire fantasy football industry for ESPN.
  • After coining the term “FOMO,” or “Fear of Missing Out,” Patrick McGinnis was living the high-life as an investment banker. That is, of course, until the financial crisis of 2008 saw him lose nearly everything. This wake up call forced him to reflect and reprioritize his life around the things that truly mattered to him leading to him becoming a modern day Renaissance Man.
You will love this book if you find yourself:
  • Grappling with how to balance all of your priorities in life.
  • Feeling unhappy or unfilled despite achieving what society deems to be success.
  • Asking “is this really what I want in life?”
  • Wanting to learn and grow as an individual in your quest for personal development.
  • Craving a fun new book that will provide a few laughs, interesting stories, and useful lessons along the way.

 

The Book - Redefining Success

The book is written in 2 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-6. I’ll introduce you to a number of wonderful and inspiring individuals who regardless of wealth, title, or career trajectory found themselves in dire need of change. Some had to experience something similar to what I went through, an “Oh Sh*t Moment,” in which a sudden external event made them seriously question what the hell they were doing with their lives. Others had a more gradual realization that something was off and that change was needed, culminating with a brave decision to confront their own internal fears to make a necessary pivot. I’ll sprinkle some of my research throughout, but Part 1 is largely story time!

Part 2 contains chapters 7-11 and the conclusion. I’ll synthesize and share the science of happiness, crucial mentalities, and tangible tactics that I uncovered throughout my own personal quest and conversations with the individuals in Part 1. Chapter 11 also includes a framework so that you can ultimately define success for yourself! In the conclusion, I’ll culminate with a deep dive into my own personal story and how I have implemented the learnings from this journey into my own life.
 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to my book launch party!
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Michael Biarnes has dedicated his career to improving patient outcomes in the healthcare sector having worked in oncology, diagnostics, neuroscience, and cardiovascular disease. Along the way, he discovered his passion for mentorship and coaching, striving to help individuals define success for themselves and take tangible steps towards achieving a happier, more balanced, and fulfilling life.

In his free time, he loves spending time with his wife, Steph, and spoiling the crap out of his dog Zimmie! He also enjoys trying different types of coffee, food, beer, and whiskey (hello, Hemingway!) and cheering on his beloved Philadelphia sports teams while they mostly lose.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form (LINK) to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each preorder tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit!)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #RedefiningSuccess and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag - #RedefiningSuccess
LinkedIn - @michaelbiarnes/@newdegreepress
Instagram - @michael_biarnes_author/@NewDegreePress
Facebook - @michaelbiarnes / @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @michaelbiarnes / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mike

story:
Story of My Book


Power of Inaction is for those that want a result, an outcome. Which is pretty much all of us. Platitudes such as ‘Money/success isn’t everything’ aside, we are always working toward an outcome: a job, a life partner, children, a startup exit, a non-profit launch, cure for cancer, 3x revenue in 3 years... The more ambitious and goal oriented we are, the more we start chasing action in order to chase results and outcomes

The book investigates the downside of action bias which makes us chase action and explores the power of inaction as a choice to getting remarkable results. While chasing action can very well lead to results, it also leads to fatigue, burnout and mistakes. On the other hand mastering action helps us achieve remarkable results faster, without the cost of ‘doing’. And the fastest way to mastering action is by leveraging the power of strategic inaction

In the pages of this book, we will study what strategic inaction looks like in the real world, through extensive research and interviews with over 30 successful CEOs, investors, pro athletes, business leaders, officers in the armed forces across the globe. We will look to neuroscience and research to learn about the interesting role ‘inactivity’ plays in driving creative thinking and progress

Contrary to the usual action-packed formulaic advice such as ‘Ten things you need to do to fill-in-your-goal’, this book explores choosing not defaulting to action. What if we didn’t do what the experts and wisdom of the masses ask us to do? What if we, like the CEO of a major global medical imaging firm who was informed of the death of a child caused by a machine made by his company, went for a 2-hour walk instead of calling an emergency staff meeting and lawyering up? What if we, like General Kutuzov of Russia, when faced with an oncoming assault from Napoleon’s Grand Army, choose to retreat instead of fighting even when everyone around us; our lieutenants, the public, even the Bossman Czar, expects us to?

Spoiler alert: they both get remarkable and unexpected positive results

You will love this book if you are ambitious and driven, whether you are in your 20s or 50s, whether what you want is a job, to build your business, or raise funds for your cause. You will love this book if you want results and are willing to find a more efficient way to getting there
 

The Book - POWER OF INACTION


The book is written in 4 parts

In Part 1, we will start with an Introduction that captures the intent and promise of the book. We will then explore why and how we got here. We will explore how ambition, aspiration and even self awareness create progress, as well as the tendency of chasing action

Part 2 is all about the major obstacles to mastering action, our tendency to default to a playbook, create narrow and rigid goals and to create cause and effect where none exists

Part 3 explores habits we can develop to counter our action bias. We will discover how day dreaming, mind wandering, laziness and procrastination, usually scorned behaviors, can actually provide access to mastery of action. We will learn about the power of silence and how it can be leveraged to getting remarkable results in meetings, negotiations and other aspects of life

While action and inaction may seem like black and white choices, Part 4 will show that the mastery of action requires rising above this apparent dichotomy. Part 4 will also have a summary takeaway of the lessons learned throughout the book
 

Where the Funds Go & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. Funds raised will go toward the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript by December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!).
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order now:
  • You will receive a personally signed paperback copy of my book when I publish.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other chapters from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover design.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process (guess how many editors this book has? how many rounds of revisions will it go through?)
  • You will receive invitations to Author Book Talks, Workshops and Launch Parties (there will be many parties, online and offline across the US and perhaps even abroad!)
  • And more!

While the physical book will be shipped after book is published, workshops and Book Talks will start before, so you don't have to wait!

About the Author

Jinny Uppal is a technology and business strategist with a 20+ year career growing and transforming businesses across telecom, ecommerce and retail, and working at Fortune 500 businesses. In her most recent role, she was Vice President of Strategy at a large North American Retailer

She is currently an author, speaker, business consultant, investor and Board member. Her long time twitter bio reads “Never be done: just keep learning.’” Apart from her professional interests, she likes signing up for projects that she’s never done before, but she will figure it out “as I go along”. This is what she did when she quit her job and went to Morocco to help artisans grow their business. 

Jinny hates downtimes when there isn’t enough structured and meaningful work to do. And yet, she noticed that after every downtime in her life she made a major move or pivoted in her life and/or career. This book idea was born out of a curiosity on what really drives progress. Is it the things we tangibly do and see evidence of or something else? What she found has changed the way she sees action, results and the relationship between the two; this book is a result of her inquiry

Jinny grew up in Mumbai and moved to the United States for a Masters in Computer Science at Florida International University. She completed the Harvard Business School Program for Leadership Development in 2010. She is a 13-year follower of Vedic and Buddhist meditation and breathwork practices. Her other interests include hiking, horseback riding and chilling out 'doing' nothing

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1, 2, 5 paperbacks etc.

Then, use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo. Wait till you hear back from me

story_txt:
Story of My Book
Power of Inaction is for those that want a result, an outcome. Which is pretty much all of us. Platitudes such as ‘Money/success isn’t everything’ aside, we are always working toward an outcome: a job, a life partner, children, a startup exit, a non-profit launch, cure for cancer, 3x revenue in 3 years... The more ambitious and goal oriented we are, the more we start chasing action in order to chase results and outcomesThe book investigates the downside of action bias which makes us chase action and explores the power of inaction as a choice to getting remarkable results. While chasing action can very well lead to results, it also leads to fatigue, burnout and mistakes. On the other hand mastering action helps us achieve remarkable results faster, without the cost of ‘doing’. And the fastest way to mastering action is by leveraging the power of strategic inactionIn the pages of this book, we will study what strategic inaction looks like in the real world, through extensive research and interviews with over 30 successful CEOs, investors, pro athletes, business leaders, officers in the armed forces across the globe. We will look to neuroscience and research to learn about the interesting role ‘inactivity’ plays in driving creative thinking and progressContrary to the usual action-packed formulaic advice such as ‘Ten things you need to do to fill-in-your-goal’, this book explores choosing not defaulting to action. What if we didn’t do what the experts and wisdom of the masses ask us to do? What if we, like the CEO of a major global medical imaging firm who was informed of the death of a child caused by a machine made by his company, went for a 2-hour walk instead of calling an emergency staff meeting and lawyering up? What if we, like General Kutuzov of Russia, when faced with an oncoming assault from Napoleon’s Grand Army, choose to retreat instead of fighting even when everyone around us; our lieutenants, the public, even the Bossman Czar, expects us to?Spoiler alert: they both get remarkable and unexpected positive resultsYou will love this book if you are ambitious and driven, whether you are in your 20s or 50s, whether what you want is a job, to build your business, or raise funds for your cause. You will love this book if you want results and are willing to find a more efficient way to getting there 
The Book - POWER OF INACTION

The book is written in 4 partsIn Part 1, we will start with an Introduction that captures the intent and promise of the book. We will then explore why and how we got here. We will explore how ambition, aspiration and even self awareness create progress, as well as the tendency of chasing actionPart 2 is all about the major obstacles to mastering action, our tendency to default to a playbook, create narrow and rigid goals and to create cause and effect where none existsPart 3 explores habits we can develop to counter our action bias. We will discover how day dreaming, mind wandering, laziness and procrastination, usually scorned behaviors, can actually provide access to mastery of action. We will learn about the power of silence and how it can be leveraged to getting remarkable results in meetings, negotiations and other aspects of lifeWhile action and inaction may seem like black and white choices, Part 4 will show that the mastery of action requires rising above this apparent dichotomy. Part 4 will also have a summary takeaway of the lessons learned throughout the book Where the Funds Go & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. Funds raised will go toward the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript by December 2021.
The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!).
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021.
 I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order now:
You will receive a personally signed paperback copy of my book when I publish.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other chapters from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover design.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process (guess how many editors this book has? how many rounds of revisions will it go through?)
You will receive invitations to Author Book Talks, Workshops and Launch Parties (there will be many parties, online and offline across the US and perhaps even abroad!)
And more!

While the physical book will be shipped after book is published, workshops and Book Talks will start before, so you don't have to wait!
About the Author

Jinny Uppal is a technology and business strategist with a 20+ year career growing and transforming businesses across telecom, ecommerce and retail, and working at Fortune 500 businesses. In her most recent role, she was Vice President of Strategy at a large North American RetailerShe is currently an author, speaker, business consultant, investor and Board member. Her long time twitter bio reads “Never be done: just keep learning.’” Apart from her professional interests, she likes signing up for projects that she’s never done before, but she will figure it out “as I go along”. This is what she did when she quit her job and went to Morocco to help artisans grow their business. Jinny hates downtimes when there isn’t enough structured and meaningful work to do. And yet, she noticed that after every downtime in her life she made a major move or pivoted in her life and/or career. This book idea was born out of a curiosity on what really drives progress. Is it the things we tangibly do and see evidence of or something else? What she found has changed the way she sees action, results and the relationship between the two; this book is a result of her inquiryJinny grew up in Mumbai and moved to the United States for a Masters in Computer Science at Florida International University. She completed the Harvard Business School Program for Leadership Development in 2010. She is a 13-year follower of Vedic and Buddhist meditation and breathwork practices. Her other interests include hiking, horseback riding and chilling out 'doing' nothing

Story of Incubating Impact 

Incubating Impact: How Non-governmental Organizations Can Change the World seeks to understand how non-governmental organizations (NGOs) can improve (and sometimes unintentionally hurt) the people they are trying to help. Using examples of human rights work and international aid, Incubating Impact reveals that human capital is the greatest asset of any NGO.

My name is Nicole Zehner and I am the author of Incubating Impact. I wrote this book because the world of international aid has always fascinated me. The desire to help others is one of the fundamental characteristics of humans, but the actual act of helping can be more complicated than what first meets the eye.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the complex role that NGOs play in human rights and international aid. I hope to instill in you the same passion and excitement that I have for human rights. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you navigate the complex world of international aid.

You will love this book if you are interested in world affairs, want to learn more about helping others, and/or want to learn something new!

Incubating Impact is a nonfiction book that speaks to students and potential donors who want to look at NGOs and aid in a new way.
 

Contents of Incubating Impact 

The book is written in three parts. Each part expands upon a different principle that is vital to understanding the successful distribution of aid.

Part 1: Public Opinion Matters
People often will go into helping others without first stopping to ask and learn what type of help is actually needed. This can lead to failed projects, frustration, and wasted money. Likewise, in the human rights field, long reports and research into the human rights conditions of a country can fall on deaf ears if the public isn’t engaged with the issue.

Part 2: Leverage Your Skills and Unique Resources
People will often engage in unskilled labor when they volunteer. While this can be tremendously helpful, it can sometimes also become inefficient, especially when people spend excessive money traveling to the locations in need of assistance. It is important for people to prioritize their unique skills, such as medical or building expertise, in order to do the most help.

Part 3: Use a Multi-Faceted Approach
There are many different ways to help people. Legal change, monetary aid, and medical support can all help the same people in different ways. While a single NGO will naturally need a specific focus, it must understand the different methods for executing its goals. Sometimes, an NGO will fail to provide sufficient aid because it does not realize that multiple approaches may be needed to achieve the goal.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in May, 2022.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About Nicole Zehner 

Nicole Zehner is currently a student at Johns Hopkins University, where she is pursuing a double major in International Studies and the Writing Seminars (a creative writing program), along with a minor in Economics. She is a pre-law student who also has a strong interest in writing and journalism.

It was her curiosity surrounding work in human rights and foreign aid that led her to her newest project Incubating Impact.

She also loves poetry and the way that it allows people to expand their understanding of the world.

For more information, you can connect with Nicole Zehner at https://nrzehner.wixsite.com/website and at @zehnerthewriter.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form https://forms.gle/gAuD3dGTyJpbUVUAA to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

story:
The Story of UNFORTUNATE

UNFORTUNATE is a young adult fantasy novel about bravery despite fear. Explore a world divided by Gifteds, those born for greatness, and by Unfortunates, those born for servitude. Follow Nora, an Unfortunate servant, as she breaks away from her fated life and becomes Galdor Academy's first Unfortunate student.

My name is Kailey Bright and I am the author of UNFORTUNATE. This book has been unfolding in my mind for four years—and I can finally spill my imagination onto paper! I wrote this book because I want to write stories my younger self would admire, and I want to navigate important social issues that deeply affect me.

You will love this book if you want to explore feminist and classist themes in a fantasy world not too far from our own; you enjoy fun and compelling characters with supernatural powers; or you love rooting for the underdog.

UNFORTUNATE speaks to rising teens and adults who are exploring who they are, breaking out of social expectations, and striving for a better future for themselves.

Ultimately, UNFORTUNATE ignites your soul—my book can inspire you to take charge of your destiny and take that first brave step forward.

I look forward to sharing more of my publishing process and beyond with you!

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
     

A secret surprise!

When you pre-order 1 Signed copy or more, you get a secret surprise! Tailor this perk to you by DMing me your favorite color from this list here:

  • Red

  • Green
  • Blue
  • Purple
  • Grey/Silver

Send a screenshot of your order receipt and message me your color choice through the social media outlets provided in the "About the Author" section.
 

About the Author

Kailey Bright is a Renaissance woman—she is a senior computer information systems major at Lander University, technical writing intern at New Relic, psycho organizer, and pink enthusiast.

Equipped with a wild imagination and a supportive librarian grandmother, Kailey started writing at a young age and flourish into the author she is now. She wants to write books that have a positive impact on her readers—those who resonate with personal struggles, challenge societal norms, and inspire inner growth.

Kailey enjoys beating her friends at mediocre bowling and loves drinking iced coffee year-round. She craves adventure, desires financial stability, and might be a 30 year old trapped in a 20 year old’s body.

For more information, you can connect with Kailey Bright at:

  • Gmail: kaileybright.author@gmail.com
  • Instagram, TikTok, and Twitter: @ambitiousinpink
  • LinkedIn: Kailey Bright

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it! If you donate any denomination (and not select a perk), you will get a personalized thank you note.
You can also share this campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues!
Here's how:
At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you.
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
