story:
Story of My Book

If is a young adult sci-fi novel about Ivy, a college freshman with missing memories. It takes place at Wollstone University, a fictional college in Washington DC, three years after the Covid-19 pandemic ends. It is told from the perspective of Ivy, a freshman at Wollstone who is trying to start the next chapter of her life, but discovers that she may not truly understand her past. She explores both her memories and the world around her with her ex-boyfriend, Chase, and her new crush, Henley, and begins to understand that things are not quite what they seem.


My name is Ingrid Pritchard Wilder and I am the author of If. The basic plot came to me in a dream, and from there I decided to shape the idea into a novel I would want to read: a YA-style book for an older college audience, with a queer heroine.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will get to experience a new perspective in a well-loved genre and have fun in the fantasy realm that includes Wollstone University. You will love this book if you still love the imaginative style of a young adult novel, but now you're in your 20s and feel as if you can't relate as well to high-school-aged protagonists.

If speaks to college students and book lovers who want to consider their identities and enjoy a couple hours! I hope that reading this helps readers see the possibility of LGBT main characters, consider their own life-shaping experiences, and feel a little bit better about their own future.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Ingrid Pritchard Wilder is a sophomore at Georgetown University. She is currently working as a front desk assistant at Georgetown's Center for German and European Studies, and is on the board of Georgetown University Pride and the Philodemic Society.

She wrote this book to share the imagination of a young adult story with an older audience, to bring to life a queer main character, and to share the joy she has had living on a college campus with her friends.

Ingrid grew up in Minnesota and hasn't been cold once since she moved to the DC area. She is on a first-name basis with almost all of the dogs that get walked on campus, and her freshman year of college she turned in a final paper with the thesis that her school is a recruiting ground for the Illuminati.

For more information, you can connect with Ingrid at ingpwilder@gmail.com, at @ingrid_pritchard_wilder on Instagram, and @ipw_author on Tiktok.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ifnovel and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! It means the world!

Much love,

Ingrid

story:
Visit www.kazalingo.com to order your copy now!

 

Project outline, full details below

Meet Zo & Noé. Zo speaks English. Noé parle français.

They're best friends, and they understand each other perfectly.

First of its kind, this board book is a bilingual children's book with a twist: teaching languages through stories. After reading this book, kids will learn how to count from 1 to 10 both in English AND in French, and learn new words and sentences in both languages.

The storyline is simple, focusing on the lesson behind it. At the end of the book, there is a glossary summarizing all the different words and sentences the kids learned. Additionally, to help you with the translation, you will find a link at the end of the book for the full story in both languages.

The project doesn't stop with this book! I explain our future plans and objectives below (in "What's next?").

Page previews: 

Like so many families, my husband and I come from multilingual backgrounds. We're both originally Lebanese and speak three languages fluently (and a fourth one strenuously).  We would like to pass that skill on to our two wonderful sons. After thorough research, we were not able to find interesting and engaging bilingual stories for our kids to enjoy. We started with the "word for word" books, but our three-year-old learned them quickly and needed more. So we tried the stories that have separate repeated paragraphs for each language. He lost interest in them, fast.

So if you can't find, create!

Initially, I wrote a simple story and printed my first "homemade" book. My Eureka moment came after seeing how fun it was for my eldest and how quickly he learned. He began repeating and translating what we were reading, and screamed with excitement "encore Zo et Noé!" After that, I shared my idea with a few close friends and it blossomed into this project. 

This book is perfect for children from zero to five years old. Infants, toddlers and preschoolers will enjoy it a lot and have fun with Zo & Noé. It will build up their confidence in languages and keep them interested in learning and challenging themselves.

Parents who want to expand their little ones' linguistic skills and expose them to English and French equally will truly appreciate the idea behind this project. It will create an ongoing conversation throughout the day, since the storyline is inspired by kids' everyday routines. 

OPOL method: One Parent, One Language. We used this approach to teach our children languages and it worked for us. This is one method that we actually use in our daily life, like so many bilingual families: 1 conversation, 2 languages. 

This book is only the beginning! I have already written additional stories to create a full series of 5 bilingual books with Zo & Noé, each focusing on a different subject.

We're also planning one big alphabet book in both English and French.

Eventually, if this is successful, we'd like to design new characters for other languages, and re-create the series in other bilingual pairs, like English and Spanish for example.

With the help of educational and linguistic professionals, we believe that we can take this even further and set up educational materials that would complement the bilingual series, like playing cards, activity booklets, music. Our possibilities are endless!

According to research and professionals, children from zero to six years old have the ability to distinguish different pronunciations, making them more receptive to learning more than one language. Moreover, kids who are multilingual are often at an advantage cognitively, academically, socially, and good at problem solving.

The method of teaching languages through stories has always been around. Storytelling is a very effective learning tool. It makes it fun and entertaining, and helps in memorizing words and sentences without even realizing. When you are engaged and enjoying the activity, it creates a positive emotional memory.

Stories also help put words in context, simultaneously teaching proper grammar and syntax, and providing full immersion. If you are interested in raising a young reader, check out this article by the NY Times. You can read more about this method of teaching here: https://bit.ly/3cNcSpG and https://bit.ly/3rJ9jFn

First of all, thank you very much for your support and for taking the time to check out this campaign!

To support this project and reserve your copy of the book, please select one of the following perks: 

The book donations will be sent to Assabil, a Lebanese NGO that promotes reading and free access to culture by creating public libraries and open spaces for cultural exchange for everyone all over Lebanon.

It would mean the world to us if you could PLEASE SHARE this project with families, friends and individuals who would be interested in supporting innovative children's books for multilingual kids. Every little bit counts!

Hi! My name is Faten, and I'm the creator and the writer of Zo & Noé. I'm an Interior Architect and a Product Designer by training. I have 2 beautiful sons: Zein and Neel. My husband and I are making sure they get the best education we can offer them- hence, this project. We are based in New York and absolutely love the city! Something charming about the city is the different languages you hear everywhere you walk. People always wonder where we're from when they hear us, which is part of the beautiful complexity of being from Lebanon!

Marhaba, I’m Hanane Kai. I’m an illustrator and designer based in the mountains of Lebanon. My team, my right hand Maya Akiki, and I made the images you’re seeing here. Like most Lebanese people I speak three languages, so je comprends Zo and Noé when they speak to me. Zo insisted that his color should be yellow, so I couldn’t say no. I’ve illustrated around 20 children’s books, but this one is my first for toddlers. I hope you love it as much as I do!

Self-publishing gives the ability for creatives such as ourselves to innovate and bring our ideas to reality, without compromise. However, it is not necessarily easy. It is risky for sure, and requires a lot of time and money to create, print, ship and market. 

Crowdfunding will not only help me fund this project and self-publish it, but it will also serve as market research. It is a good way to gauge interest and validate the demand for such a book. Furthermore, it will help reach parents who are interested in pushing the idea forward, and join us on this journey to bring Zo & Noé into the hands of the curious little ones.

We want to do this right. That's why we are working with an award-winning illustrator, and using a premium printer that requires a minimum of 750 books for any project. Ultimately, printing and delivery are the most expensive costs to complete this book. 

Printing the book and delivering it by sea takes time. Books will start shipping to backers in August 2021. The story is already written, and the book's design materials are ready (mood board, color palette, characters, etc.), along with all the pages and illustrations. We are now finalizing everything, to have the design file ready for print.

 

 

Thank you!!

 

(Français)

Un livre bilingue en français et en anglais pour les tout-petits

 

  •  De quoi parle ce livre ? 

Voici Zo & Noé. Zo parle anglais. Noé parle français. Ils sont meilleurs amis et se comprennent parfaitement.

Premier livre de ce genre, c’est une histoire bilingue pour les enfants avec une distinction : l'enseignement des langues à travers des histoires. En lisant ce livre, les enfants pourront compter de 1 à 10 en anglais ET en français, et apprendront de nouveaux mots et phrases dans les deux langues.

  • A quoi ressemblera le livre ?

​

Le contenu est simple, et se focalise sur la leçon de fond. À la fin du livre, il y a un glossaire résumant tous les différents mots et phrases que les enfants auront appris dans les deux langues. De plus, pour aider avec la lecture, vous trouverez un lien à la fin du livre pour l'histoire complète dans les deux langues.

Le projet ne s'arrête pas avec ce livre ! J'explique nos futurs plans et objectifs ci-dessous (« Et ensuite ? »).

 

  • Pourquoi avons-nous créé ce livre ?

​

Comme beaucoup de familles, mon mari et moi venons de milieux multilingues. Nous sommes tous les deux d’origine libanaise et parlons 3 langues couramment. Nous aimerions transmettre ces langues à nos 2 fils. Après avoir longuement cherché quelque chose de similaire, nous n'avons pas trouvé d’histoires bilingues intéressantes et engageantes pour enfants. Nous avons commencé avec des livres « mot à mot », mais notre fils de 3 ans les a vite appris et s’en est lassés. Nous avons ensuite essayé les histoires qui ont des paragraphes répétés par langue, et il s'est rapidement ennuyé.

Donc, si vous ne trouvez pas, créez !

Au début, j'ai écrit une histoire simple et j’ai imprimé mon premier livre « fait maison ». Mon moment Eureka est arrivé après avoir vu à quel point celui-ci était amusant pour mon aîné et la rapidité avec laquelle il l’a appris. Il a commencé à répéter et à traduire ce que nous lisions, et se mettait à crier avec enthousiasme « encore Zo & Noé ! ». J’ai ensuite partagé mon idée avec quelques amis, et c’est de là qu’on en est arrivés à ce projet.

  • Pour qui est ce livre ?

​

Ce livre est destiné aux enfants de 0 à 5 ans. Les nourrissons, les tout-petits et les enfants d'âge préscolaire l'apprécieront beaucoup et s'amuseront avec Zo & Noé. Cela renforcera leur confiance dans les langues et ils resteront donc intéressés.

Les parents qui souhaitent développer les compétences linguistiques de leurs tout-petits, et les exposer à l'anglais et au français en même temps, apprécieront tout particulièrement l'idée de ce projet. Cela créera une conversation à travers la journée, car le scénario est inspiré des routines quotidiennes des enfants.

Nous avons utilisé cette approche pour enseigner les langues à nos enfants et cela a marché pour nous. C'est une méthode que nous utilisons réellement dans notre vie quotidienne, comme beaucoup d’autres familles bilingues : 1 conversation, 2 langues.

  •  Et ensuite ? 

​

Ce livre n'est que le début ! J'ai déjà écrit des histoires supplémentaires pour créer une série complète de 5 livres bilingues avec Zo & Noé, chacun se focalisant sur un sujet différent : les couleurs, les parties du corps, etc. Nous prévoyons également un abécédaire en anglais et en français.

Et enfin, si tout se passe bien, nous aimerions développer de nouveaux personnages en intégrant d'autres langues, avec des livres bilingues en anglais et espagnol par exemple (avec plein d’autres possibilités).

Avec l'aide de professionnels de l'éducation et de la langue, nous pensons pouvoir aller encore plus loin et mettre en place du matériel pédagogique qui viendrait compléter la série bilingue, comme des cartes à jouer, des livrets d'activités, de la musique, etc. Le potentiel est illimité !

  • Pourquoi enseigner les langues à travers des histoires ?

Selon les professionnels, les enfants de 0 à 6 ans ont la capacité de distinguer différentes prononciations, ce qui les rend plus réceptifs à l'apprentissage de plusieurs langues. De plus, les enfants qui sont multilingues ont souvent un avantage cognitif, académique, et social.

La méthode d'enseignement des langues à travers des histoires a toujours existé. La narration est un outil d'apprentissage très efficace, tout en rendant ça divertissant. Elle aide à mémoriser des mots et des phrases sans même s'en rendre compte. Lorsque vous êtes engagé et que vous appréciez l'activité, cela crée un lien émotionnel positif.

Les histoires aident également à mettre les mots en contexte, à enseigner simultanément la grammaire et la syntaxe et à fournir une immersion totale pour l’enfant. Si vous souhaitez élever un jeune lecteur, nous vous recommandons cet article du NY Times. Si vous voulez en connaître plus sur cette méthode d'enseignement, cliquez ici: https://bit.ly/3cNcSpG et https://bit...

  • Quelles sont les récompenses ?

Tout d'abord, merci beaucoup pour votre soutien et pour avoir pris le temps d’en apprendre davantage sur ce projet !

Pour soutenir ce projet et réserver votre livre, veuillez sélectionner l'une des récompenses suivantes (plus de détails pour chacune dans la section « Rewards »).

Les dons de livres seront envoyés à Assabil, une ONG libanaise qui promeut la lecture et le libre accès à la culture en créant des bibliothèques publiques et des espaces ouverts d'échange culturel pour tous au Liban.

Nous vous serions tellement reconnaissants si vous pouviez PARTAGER ce projet avec vos familles, vos amis et toutes autres personnes qui pourraient être intéressés à soutenir des livres innovants pour enfants multilingues.

  • Qui sommes-nous ?

​

Hello ! Je m'appelle Faten et je suis la créatrice et l’auteure de Zo & Noé. A l’origine, je suis architecte d'intérieur et designer. J'ai 2 fils (très mignons !) : Zein et Neel. Mon mari et moi veillons à ce qu'ils reçoivent la meilleure éducation possible, d’où ce projet. Nous sommes basés à New York et nous aimons beaucoup cette ville ! Ce que j’aime particulièrement ici, c’est toutes les langues que l’on entend autour de nous – très cosmopolite. Les gens se demandent souvent d'où nous venons lorsqu'ils nous entendent parler plusieurs langues… c'est la beauté d'être libanais !

 

Marhaba ! Je m’appelle Hanane Kai. Je suis illustratrice et designer basée dans les montagnes du Liban. Avec ma collaboratrice Maya Akiki, nous avons réalisé les images que vous voyez ici. Comme la plupart des libanais, je parle trois langues, so I understand Zo et Noé quand ils me parlent. Zo a insisté pour que sa couleur soit jaune, donc je ne pouvais pas dire non ! J'ai déjà illustré une vingtaine de livres pour enfants, mais celui-ci est mon premier pour les tout-petits. J'espère que vous l'aimerez autant que moi !

  • Pourquoi lancer une campagne ?

L'autoédition permet à des personnes créatives, comme nous, d'innover et de concrétiser nos idées, sans compromis. Cependant, ce n'est pas forcément facile. C’est une aventure risquée et qui demande beaucoup de temps et d'argent pour créer, imprimer les livres, les expédier et les commercialiser.

La campagne m'aidera non seulement à financer ce projet et à le publier moi-même, mais servira également d'étude de marché. C'est un bon moyen d'évaluer l'intérêt pour ce type de projet et de valider la demande pour un tel livre. De plus, cela aidera à atteindre les parents intéressés afin de faire avancer l'idée et à nous rejoindre dans cette aventure, pour mettre nos livres entre les mains des tout-petits.

Nous voulons faire cela correctement ; c'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec une illustratrice professionnelle, et nous imprimerons avec une imprimerie de bon standing, qui nécessite un minimum de 750 livres pour tout projet. L'impression et la livraison représentent les coûts les plus chers pour réaliser ce livre.

  • Quand est-ce que je vais recevoir mon livre ?

L'impression du livre, ainsi que la livraison par voie maritime, prennent du temps. Les livres commenceront à être expédiés aux contributeurs en août 2021. L'histoire est déjà écrite et tous les éléments pour la conception du livre sont prêts (« mood board », palette de couleurs, personnages, etc.), ainsi que toutes les pages et les illustrations. En ce moment, nous finalisons le fichier de conception pour qu'il soit prêt à être imprimé.

 

Merci de partager avec tous ceux qui seraient intéressés à soutenir des livres innovants pour enfants multilingues. Merci !

We used this approach to teach our children languages and it worked for us. This is one method that we actually use in our daily life, like so many bilingual families: 1 conversation, 2 languages. This book is only the beginning! I have already written additional stories to create a full series of 5 bilingual books with Zo & Noé, each focusing on a different subject.We're also planning one big alphabet book in both English and French.Eventually, if this is successful, we'd like to design new characters for other languages, and re-create the series in other bilingual pairs, like English and Spanish for example.With the help of educational and linguistic professionals, we believe that we can take this even further and set up educational materials that would complement the bilingual series, like playing cards, activity booklets, music. Our possibilities are endless!According to research and professionals, children from zero to six years old have the ability to distinguish different pronunciations, making them more receptive to learning more than one language. Moreover, kids who are multilingual are often at an advantage cognitively, academically, socially, and good at problem solving.The method of teaching languages through stories has always been around. Storytelling is a very effective learning tool. It makes it fun and entertaining, and helps in memorizing words and sentences without even realizing. When you are engaged and enjoying the activity, it creates a positive emotional memory.Stories also help put words in context, simultaneously teaching proper grammar and syntax, and providing full immersion. If you are interested in raising a young reader, check out this article by the NY Times. You can read more about this method of teaching here: https://bit.ly/3cNcSpG and https://bit.ly/3rJ9jFnFirst of all, thank you very much for your support and for taking the time to check out this campaign!To support this project and reserve your copy of the book, please select one of the following perks: The book donations will be sent to Assabil, a Lebanese NGO that promotes reading and free access to culture by creating public libraries and open spaces for cultural exchange for everyone all over Lebanon.It would mean the world to us if you could PLEASE SHARE this project with families, friends and individuals who would be interested in supporting innovative children's books for multilingual kids. Every little bit counts!Hi! My name is Faten, and I'm the creator and the writer of Zo & Noé. I'm an Interior Architect and a Product Designer by training. I have 2 beautiful sons: Zein and Neel. My husband and I are making sure they get the best education we can offer them- hence, this project. We are based in New York and absolutely love the city! Something charming about the city is the different languages you hear everywhere you walk. People always wonder where we're from when they hear us, which is part of the beautiful complexity of being from Lebanon!Marhaba, I’m Hanane Kai. I’m an illustrator and designer based in the mountains of Lebanon. My team, my right hand Maya Akiki, and I made the images you’re seeing here. Like most Lebanese people I speak three languages, so je comprends Zo and Noé when they speak to me. Zo insisted that his color should be yellow, so I couldn’t say no. I’ve illustrated around 20 children’s books, but this one is my first for toddlers. I hope you love it as much as I do!Self-publishing gives the ability for creatives such as ourselves to innovate and bring our ideas to reality, without compromise. However, it is not necessarily easy. It is risky for sure, and requires a lot of time and money to create, print, ship and market. Crowdfunding will not only help me fund this project and self-publish it, but it will also serve as market research. It is a good way to gauge interest and validate the demand for such a book. Furthermore, it will help reach parents who are interested in pushing the idea forward, and join us on this journey to bring Zo & Noé into the hands of the curious little ones.We want to do this right. That's why we are working with an award-winning illustrator, and using a premium printer that requires a minimum of 750 books for any project. Ultimately, printing and delivery are the most expensive costs to complete this book. Printing the book and delivering it by sea takes time. Books will start shipping to backers in August 2021. The story is already written, and the book's design materials are ready (mood board, color palette, characters, etc.), along with all the pages and illustrations. We are now finalizing everything, to have the design file ready for print.  Thank you!! (Français)Un livre bilingue en français et en anglais pour les tout-petits  De quoi parle ce livre ? Voici Zo & Noé. Zo parle anglais. Noé parle français. Ils sont meilleurs amis et se comprennent parfaitement.Premier livre de ce genre, c’est une histoire bilingue pour les enfants avec une distinction : l'enseignement des langues à travers des histoires. En lisant ce livre, les enfants pourront compter de 1 à 10 en anglais ET en français, et apprendront de nouveaux mots et phrases dans les deux langues.A quoi ressemblera le livre ?​Le contenu est simple, et se focalise sur la leçon de fond. À la fin du livre, il y a un glossaire résumant tous les différents mots et phrases que les enfants auront appris dans les deux langues. De plus, pour aider avec la lecture, vous trouverez un lien à la fin du livre pour l'histoire complète dans les deux langues.Le projet ne s'arrête pas avec ce livre ! J'explique nos futurs plans et objectifs ci-dessous (« Et ensuite ? »). Pourquoi avons-nous créé ce livre ?​Comme beaucoup de familles, mon mari et moi venons de milieux multilingues. Nous sommes tous les deux d’origine libanaise et parlons 3 langues couramment. Nous aimerions transmettre ces langues à nos 2 fils. Après avoir longuement cherché quelque chose de similaire, nous n'avons pas trouvé d’histoires bilingues intéressantes et engageantes pour enfants. Nous avons commencé avec des livres « mot à mot », mais notre fils de 3 ans les a vite appris et s’en est lassés. Nous avons ensuite essayé les histoires qui ont des paragraphes répétés par langue, et il s'est rapidement ennuyé.Donc, si vous ne trouvez pas, créez !Au début, j'ai écrit une histoire simple et j’ai imprimé mon premier livre « fait maison ». Mon moment Eureka est arrivé après avoir vu à quel point celui-ci était amusant pour mon aîné et la rapidité avec laquelle il l’a appris. Il a commencé à répéter et à traduire ce que nous lisions, et se mettait à crier avec enthousiasme « encore Zo & Noé ! ». J’ai ensuite partagé mon idée avec quelques amis, et c’est de là qu’on en est arrivés à ce projet.Pour qui est ce livre ?​Ce livre est destiné aux enfants de 0 à 5 ans. Les nourrissons, les tout-petits et les enfants d'âge préscolaire l'apprécieront beaucoup et s'amuseront avec Zo & Noé. Cela renforcera leur confiance dans les langues et ils resteront donc intéressés.Les parents qui souhaitent développer les compétences linguistiques de leurs tout-petits, et les exposer à l'anglais et au français en même temps, apprécieront tout particulièrement l'idée de ce projet. Cela créera une conversation à travers la journée, car le scénario est inspiré des routines quotidiennes des enfants.Nous avons utilisé cette approche pour enseigner les langues à nos enfants et cela a marché pour nous. C'est une méthode que nous utilisons réellement dans notre vie quotidienne, comme beaucoup d’autres familles bilingues : 1 conversation, 2 langues. Et ensuite ? ​Ce livre n'est que le début ! J'ai déjà écrit des histoires supplémentaires pour créer une série complète de 5 livres bilingues avec Zo & Noé, chacun se focalisant sur un sujet différent : les couleurs, les parties du corps, etc. Nous prévoyons également un abécédaire en anglais et en français.Et enfin, si tout se passe bien, nous aimerions développer de nouveaux personnages en intégrant d'autres langues, avec des livres bilingues en anglais et espagnol par exemple (avec plein d’autres possibilités).Avec l'aide de professionnels de l'éducation et de la langue, nous pensons pouvoir aller encore plus loin et mettre en place du matériel pédagogique qui viendrait compléter la série bilingue, comme des cartes à jouer, des livrets d'activités, de la musique, etc. Le potentiel est illimité !Pourquoi enseigner les langues à travers des histoires ?Selon les professionnels, les enfants de 0 à 6 ans ont la capacité de distinguer différentes prononciations, ce qui les rend plus réceptifs à l'apprentissage de plusieurs langues. De plus, les enfants qui sont multilingues ont souvent un avantage cognitif, académique, et social.La méthode d'enseignement des langues à travers des histoires a toujours existé. La narration est un outil d'apprentissage très efficace, tout en rendant ça divertissant. Elle aide à mémoriser des mots et des phrases sans même s'en rendre compte. Lorsque vous êtes engagé et que vous appréciez l'activité, cela crée un lien émotionnel positif.Les histoires aident également à mettre les mots en contexte, à enseigner simultanément la grammaire et la syntaxe et à fournir une immersion totale pour l’enfant. Si vous souhaitez élever un jeune lecteur, nous vous recommandons cet article du NY Times. Si vous voulez en connaître plus sur cette méthode d'enseignement, cliquez ici: https://bit.ly/3cNcSpG et https://bit...Quelles sont les récompenses ?Tout d'abord, merci beaucoup pour votre soutien et pour avoir pris le temps d’en apprendre davantage sur ce projet !Pour soutenir ce projet et réserver votre livre, veuillez sélectionner l'une des récompenses suivantes (plus de détails pour chacune dans la section « Rewards »).Les dons de livres seront envoyés à Assabil, une ONG libanaise qui promeut la lecture et le libre accès à la culture en créant des bibliothèques publiques et des espaces ouverts d'échange culturel pour tous au Liban.Nous vous serions tellement reconnaissants si vous pouviez PARTAGER ce projet avec vos familles, vos amis et toutes autres personnes qui pourraient être intéressés à soutenir des livres innovants pour enfants multilingues.Qui sommes-nous ?​Hello ! Je m'appelle Faten et je suis la créatrice et l’auteure de Zo & Noé. A l’origine, je suis architecte d'intérieur et designer. J'ai 2 fils (très mignons !) : Zein et Neel. Mon mari et moi veillons à ce qu'ils reçoivent la meilleure éducation possible, d’où ce projet. Nous sommes basés à New York et nous aimons beaucoup cette ville ! Ce que j’aime particulièrement ici, c’est toutes les langues que l’on entend autour de nous – très cosmopolite. Les gens se demandent souvent d'où nous venons lorsqu'ils nous entendent parler plusieurs langues… c'est la beauté d'être libanais ! Marhaba ! Je m’appelle Hanane Kai. Je suis illustratrice et designer basée dans les montagnes du Liban. Avec ma collaboratrice Maya Akiki, nous avons réalisé les images que vous voyez ici. Comme la plupart des libanais, je parle trois langues, so I understand Zo et Noé quand ils me parlent. Zo a insisté pour que sa couleur soit jaune, donc je ne pouvais pas dire non ! J'ai déjà illustré une vingtaine de livres pour enfants, mais celui-ci est mon premier pour les tout-petits. J'espère que vous l'aimerez autant que moi !Pourquoi lancer une campagne ?L'autoédition permet à des personnes créatives, comme nous, d'innover et de concrétiser nos idées, sans compromis. Cependant, ce n'est pas forcément facile. C’est une aventure risquée et qui demande beaucoup de temps et d'argent pour créer, imprimer les livres, les expédier et les commercialiser.La campagne m'aidera non seulement à financer ce projet et à le publier moi-même, mais servira également d'étude de marché. C'est un bon moyen d'évaluer l'intérêt pour ce type de projet et de valider la demande pour un tel livre. De plus, cela aidera à atteindre les parents intéressés afin de faire avancer l'idée et à nous rejoindre dans cette aventure, pour mettre nos livres entre les mains des tout-petits.Nous voulons faire cela correctement ; c'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec une illustratrice professionnelle, et nous imprimerons avec une imprimerie de bon standing, qui nécessite un minimum de 750 livres pour tout projet. L'impression et la livraison représentent les coûts les plus chers pour réaliser ce livre.Quand est-ce que je vais recevoir mon livre ?L'impression du livre, ainsi que la livraison par voie maritime, prennent du temps. Les livres commenceront à être expédiés aux contributeurs en août 2021. L'histoire est déjà écrite et tous les éléments pour la conception du livre sont prêts (« mood board », palette de couleurs, personnages, etc.), ainsi que toutes les pages et les illustrations. En ce moment, nous finalisons le fichier de conception pour qu'il soit prêt à être imprimé. Merci de partager avec tous ceux qui seraient intéressés à soutenir des livres innovants pour enfants multilingues. Merci !

story:
Story of My Book

UnlockED is about how the right education can help each and every child unlock their full potential.

My name is David Pham and I am the author of UnlockED. I wrote this book because I graduated from a business school and I worked in several banks and corporations before I realised that education is actually what I care about the most. Therefore I started teaching and participating in education projects and startups. The reason why education personally interests me is because of my daughter. I started to think about her future and the future of her generation. I was thinking whether the current education system would be fine to maintain or if there is a way to provide her with the world class education suitable for the information age, no matter where we would be living. All of this pushed me to research and think more about the topic.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover stories and insights, for example from the Next School in India, The Big Picture School in Kenya, The Ørestad Gymnasium in Denmark, The Brightworks school in the U.S. or the Think Global School, where during the 3 years of high school study, students go to 10 countries, spread out between 5 continents. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for education and how it can unlock full potential for the generations to come. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you have a clearer picture on what is happening in education around the world and I hope that after reading this book, you can become an advocate, and ambassador to promote the best practices in education in your own country.

In this book, you'll learn about mastery learning and different forms of blended learning. You'll hear stories such as from Himani Bhala, a 7th grader who shared that her passion lays in fashion design. Thanks to an innovative approach of her school, apart from learning academics, she could spend time working on her own passion project throughout the school year. Although in secondary school, as part of the programme, students at her school have real internships, and so she had an opportunity to learn in a real boutique shop and helped the shop by designing real, sellable clothes.

You will love this book if you are not happy with the current state of education and you want to see education to improve.

UnlockED is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents, teachers or anyone involved or wanting to be involved in innovating education. If you are dissatisfied with the current system of education in the place where you live and you want to do something about it, then this book will be your companion.

 

The Book - UnlockED

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. In Part 1 of the book, you will read about different stakeholders in education, the ideal learning experience from K-12 to higher education and what challenges are we facing in current education systems. 

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6 which are all about the key skills we should pay attention to and help our children develop in order to succeed in life. It includes financial literacy, cultivating curiosity or self awareness. 

Part 3 contains chapters 7-10 and is entirely about new methods in education, such as mastery learning, blended learning or learning styles. There are featured schools such as KIPP LA, Navigator Schools or Summit Public Schools in this part of the book.  

Part 4 contains chapters 11-13. In this last part of the book, you will learn a bit about EdTech, read more stories from different students and educators or getting to know the basics of coaching which will help you to guide your child or your student towards success. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in summer this year.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

All of David's current activities are about education. Apart from working on this book, he is teaching and creating content for a coaching project.

He found the passion in education back in 2010 during a volunteer teaching internship in Brazil. He decided to write this book to share best practices that exist in education across the globe. He was always curious about how a child can fully discover and use its full potential, its uniqueness and he hopes to be able to inspire readers around the world to join the mission of helping the next generation to succeed in life, solving complex global challenges in the information age.

In his spare time, David likes to go to the top of high buildings and observe busy streets or go for a walk around the lake and reflect upon life. One of his funny hobbies is making posters and sticking them on the walls around his bedroom.

For more information, you can connect with David at david.pham1809@gmail.com or on social media. He has Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Medium or Youtube, however his main platforms are Facebook and LinkedIN. You can find him easily on all platforms using /unlockedbydp.

 

International Shipping

Please DM me for details about international shipping options.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

P.S.: I have set Vietnam as shipping location on Indiegogo, therefore instead of selecting a perk, if you are located in a different country:

on PC - simply just use the "BACK IT" button for the amount of the perk you want to "make a contribution" for (for example insert $39) and I'll make sure you get everything the perk includes . Don't select perks, that way it won't ask you to provide an address,

on phone - scroll all the way right through all the perks and then select "make a contribution", then insert for example $39

For backers in Vietnam with ATM cards only, please transfer funds to Techcombank, 19033221834018, Cung Thai Anh and we will put it to Indiegogo for you (Indiegogo for example converts $39 as 930K VND). In notes, please type your phone number.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #unlockedbydp and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
David Pham

story:
Story of My Book

Crisis Proof Leadership uncovers what the best leaders do during times of crisis. It would be easy to think that only the strongest, toughest, most cutthroat leaders would thrive in a crisis-filled environment, but that’s not the case. Highly empathetic, focused, values-driven leaders are better able to keep their teams engaged and thriving. Crisis doesn’t define leaders. Instead, the work they do before challenges and obstacles happen make them crisis-proof.

My name is Beth Rashleigh, and I am the author of Crisis Proof Leadership. I was inspired to write this book because in the last year, I’ve worked with so many leaders who were struggling to adjust their leadership style to all the chaos of the pandemic. It got me curious about the topic, and I wondered if there were proven techniques that would help leaders succeed in times of crisis. I found some really amazing ones.

My hope for this book is that it becomes a guidebook and tool kit for leaders. Leadership isn’t always glamorous, and it can be a lonely job. I hope this book helps leaders feel like they have someone in their corner cheering for their success.

In this book, you'll hear stories from successful leaders working in all types of industries, from healthcare to local and federal government to small businesses.

You will love this book if you are currently leading people, want to lead people in the future, or if you want to help and inspire others regardless of your role.

 

The Book - Crisis Proof Leadership

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1-3. These chapters set up the context for the book and dig into the background of leadership in times of crisis, what leadership is, why people should step into leadership roles, and why understanding how to lead well during crisis is especially critical right now.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. This section focuses on what you might need to examine about yourself to lead well. Each of these chapters includes exercises and reflection questions that will help you gain clarity about why you do what you do, what you value, how resilient you really are, and how to get the best results. Each chapter is jam packed with activities, self-assessments, and practical tools like discussion planners that you’ll be able to use on the job right away.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-11. This section shifts your focus to behaviors the best leaders demonstrate. Leading a team can be one of the most rewarding jobs in the world but to do it well, you need to come into the role with a service-oriented mindset. These chapters will help you build trust, demonstrate empathy. communicate clearly, and help others grow. Practical tips, tricks, and tools are given every step of the way.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication. If you know me well, you know this will be crucial!
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published.
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition.
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll publish an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Beth Rashleigh is the President and Founder of Rashleigh Consulting, a leadership coaching, training, and facilitation firm. She’s worked in Talent and Organizational Development for almost 20 years in healthcare (both for-profit and not-for-profit), in Corporate America, and for the Central Intelligence Agency. Beth has a Bachelor’s Degree in Organizational Communication from Ball State University, a Master’s Degree from Indiana University, and a Master’s Certificate in Organizational Learning from the University of Maryland. She is a Certified Professional Coach, a Master Practitioner in the Energy Leadership Index, and holds certifications in the DISC, MBTI, EQi, StrengthsFinder and SDI assessments, in addition to a variety of leadership development training programs.

Beth considers herself to be a giant nerd and is always looking to learn more about topics like leadership, self-awareness, emotional intelligence, and psychology. She loves to share what she learns with those around her.

Outside of work, she’s married to her husband, Matt, and has a son named Sam, who is the Mary Poppins of children...practically perfect in every way. She also wrangles her two co-writers and pups, Kirby and Lucy, each and every day.

For more information, you can connect with Beth at beth@rashleighconsulting.com or on Instagram or LinkedIn.


 

International Preorders

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs for your signed copies within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!  I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

Please use #crisisproofleadership and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

story:
Story of My Book

Engineering A.I. Ethically is about Artificial Intelligence and moral consequences. It explores the cross-section of technology, philosophy, and economy to come up with ethical guidelines for building A.I. responsibly.

My name is Alberto Maria Chierici and I am the author of Engineering A.I. Ethically. I wrote this book because I want to bring A.I. down to earth, explain it in an understandable way, and show the moral problems related to its development. As a data scientist (DS), I want to gather my experience and organize my thoughts around moral decisions in our everyday work for other DSs or engineers who don’t realize their job has plenty of moral decisions to make. It’s not just math and code. For business and policy leaders, I want to give different perspectives on the solutions to the AI ethical problem. Most work concludes that we need regulation and I believe we need to empower individuals to educate themselves and make better moral choices.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what A.I. really is, how its moral problems are no different from problems humanity already faces, and how to tackle them. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for building a better world with new technologies. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find your inner moral compass when developing, using, or sharing stories about tech with your community.

In this book, you'll learn about A.I. 101 and its power to influence behavior. You'll read about...
  • How the method by which machines learn, while inspired by how humans learn, has some material, spooky limits.
  • The influence of science fiction and movies on our perceptions of A.I.
  • A behavioral psychologist’s experience applying the science of influencing behavior commercially.

You will love this book if you are passionate about new tech and science-fiction, want to learn more about technology, are a policymaker figuring out what AI is and what you should do about it, and/or a CEO or engineer developing an A.I. application and desire to do it the right way.

Engineering A.I. Ethically is a nonfiction book that speaks to A.I. fans and detractors alike, and makers of A.I. who want to look at morality at work and its societal impact in a new way.

When I publish the book, I plan to donate part of the profits to the Center for Humane Technology.

The Book - Engineering A.I. Ethically

The book is written in 3 parts and won't take you too long to read (expected less than 50,000 words).

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. The reader will learn about a brief history of A.I. showing that progress isn't necessarily a straight line. I'll dedicate two chapters to A.I. and Machine Learning 101 in layman's terms, accessible to everyone. Stories from business applications and academics show that A.I. is an engineering artifact, rather than a godlike power to create human-like intelligence.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. The reader will learn through case studies and stories from professionals and scientists about the limitations of A.I. There are inherent limitations (limits A.I. will always have), and historical limitations (limits given by the current state of technology that will likely be overcome). Readers will also learn morally good, bad, and grey-areas of existing applications of A.I. that they already use on a daily basis or are likely to use in the near future.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. The reader will learn about how science fiction can be used to test society’s reaction to future or dystopian scenarios. From fiction to the real world, I’ll share stories about behavioral scientists and lay down the foundations of moral decision-making to help the readers find their inner moral compass.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it (this may vary according to location).
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Alberto M. Chierici is an entrepreneur, data scientist, and product manager. He started up and advises a number of innovative companies. At the time of writing, he is completing a Ph.D. in Computer Science and working with Tesla as “Sr. Revolutionary Actuary Data Scientist.” (Alberto wrote his first draft manuscript before joining Tesla, the views expressed in this writing are his own. They have not been reviewed or approved by Tesla.)

Alberto is passionate about data science, developing products that people love, and also improve their lives. He wants to help build a more compassionate and inclusive society by educating the public about the limits of science, technology, and data. He believes these tools are often divinized and presented as the only source of truth or “objectivity”.

Alberto loves traveling with his wife and kids and tries hard to be fit. Sometimes with a few successes (he won an F45 Studio Challenge in functional training and lost 30lbs), sometimes with miserable failure (hello, lockdowns!).

For more information, you can connect with Alberto at alberto.chierici@nyu.edu and at @AlbertoMChi on Twitter.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message, read the FAQs section (tab on top), or fill in this form https://forms.gle/Enr76i3Wdeo9Ja2k9.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #EngineeringAIEthically and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Alberto

story:
The Story of My Book

Poetic Potential: Using Poetry to Unlock Your Voice is the guide for women to find their voice in a society that often doesn’t listen or want to hear them. It explores the themes of healing, empowerment, and activism, showcasing how poetry is the key to women rediscovering their inherent value and power in the world.

My name is Amanda Karch and I am the author of Poetic Potential: Using Poetry to Unlock Your Voice. I wrote this book because, throughout this past year, I have realized how much poetry has impacted my life - increasing my confidence, boosting my public-speaking skills, helping me discover strengths and goals that I didn’t know existed. Through talking to other poets, I have learned that I am not alone in my journey. Countless other people have had similar experiences - with poetry becoming a lifeline, a mental outlet, a place of healing and discovery - and I want to show people the power and potential of poetry. The connection to female empowerment has to do with my own views as a woman on the external world because I believe women need to rediscover and utilize their voice and power to create true change in society.

Through reading this book, I want you to discover the potential and power that poetry has - that it is more than an elitist, inaccessible hobby that few people can do or make use of. But, more than the poetry, I want you to find your voice, confidence, and self-worth as a woman or understand that women have value in society too, if that isn’t how you identify. I hope that I am able to pass on my passion and knowledge of this topic to spread change throughout society, even beginning small with just one person. All it takes is one person to spark a movement and I want this book to be the tool that sparks the flame.

In this book, you'll learn about the power of poetry and how women can use it to regain their voice. You'll hear stories such as...

  • a professor who used poetry as a way to heal from the grief of losing her brother
  • a poet who uses poetry to help show that patients with Alzheimer’s deserve a high quality of life
  • a non-profit director who uses poetry to empower incarcerated women to find their voice and feel valued in society

You will love this book if you have a passion for poetry or writing, if you are an advocate for women’s rights, if you are a creative, and if you have an open mind.

Poetic Potential: Using Poetry to Unlock Your Voice is a nonfiction book that speaks to women of all ages and their allies - whether you are poets or not - who want to look at poetry and female empowerment in a new way.

Inside the Book - Poetic Potential

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. This section gives an overview of the inspiration behind writing this book, plus insights into the history of poetry and the current public perception around it.

Part 2 contains chapters 3-5. This section is centered around the healing powers of poetry. It explores mental health benefits, self-care, and the acceptance of your own identity to move forward. It includes stories from poets, professors, and non-profit directors across the country.

Part 3 contains chapters 6-9. This section is centered around the empowerment that poetry can provide. It explores themes of identity, truth-telling, and confidence. It includes stories from Instagram poets, non-profit directors, and well-known authors like Glennon Doyle and Elizabeth Gilbert.

Part 4 contains chapters 10-12. This section is centered around the idea of poetry as a force for activism and social change. It explores the ideas of breaking stigmas, the power of a woman’s voice, and the potential for poetry to change and save lives. It includes stories from spoken word artists, college writers, and even the 2021 inaugural poet, Amanda Gorman.

What I Need & What You'll Get

Campaign Goals

Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

For more information, you can connect with Amanda Karch via email at amanda@akkwriting.com and on Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Risks & Challenges

The Story of My Book
Poetic Potential: Using Poetry to Unlock Your Voice is the guide for women to find their voice in a society that often doesn’t listen or want to hear them. It explores the themes of healing, empowerment, and activism, showcasing how poetry is the key to women rediscovering their inherent value and power in the world.My name is Amanda Karch and I am the author of Poetic Potential: Using Poetry to Unlock Your Voice. I wrote this book because, throughout this past year, I have realized how much poetry has impacted my life - increasing my confidence, boosting my public-speaking skills, helping me discover strengths and goals that I didn’t know existed. Through talking to other poets, I have learned that I am not alone in my journey. Countless other people have had similar experiences - with poetry becoming a lifeline, a mental outlet, a place of healing and discovery - and I want to show people the power and potential of poetry. The connection to female empowerment has to do with my own views as a woman on the external world because I believe women need to rediscover and utilize their voice and power to create true change in society.Through reading this book, I want you to discover the potential and power that poetry has - that it is more than an elitist, inaccessible hobby that few people can do or make use of. But, more than the poetry, I want you to find your voice, confidence, and self-worth as a woman or understand that women have value in society too, if that isn’t how you identify. I hope that I am able to pass on my passion and knowledge of this topic to spread change throughout society, even beginning small with just one person. All it takes is one person to spark a movement and I want this book to be the tool that sparks the flame.In this book, you'll learn about the power of poetry and how women can use it to regain their voice. You'll hear stories such as...

a professor who used poetry as a way to heal from the grief of losing her brother
a poet who uses poetry to help show that patients with Alzheimer’s deserve a high quality of life
a non-profit director who uses poetry to empower incarcerated women to find their voice and feel valued in society

You will love this book if you have a passion for poetry or writing, if you are an advocate for women’s rights, if you are a creative, and if you have an open mind.Poetic Potential: Using Poetry to Unlock Your Voice is a nonfiction book that speaks to women of all ages and their allies - whether you are poets or not - who want to look at poetry and female empowerment in a new way.
Inside the Book - Poetic Potential

The book is written in 4 parts.
Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. This section gives an overview of the inspiration behind writing this book, plus insights into the history of poetry and the current public perception around it.
Part 2 contains chapters 3-5. This section is centered around the healing powers of poetry. It explores mental health benefits, self-care, and the acceptance of your own identity to move forward. It includes stories from poets, professors, and non-profit directors across the country.
Part 3 contains chapters 6-9. This section is centered around the empowerment that poetry can provide. It explores themes of identity, truth-telling, and confidence. It includes stories from Instagram poets, non-profit directors, and well-known authors like Glennon Doyle and Elizabeth Gilbert.
Part 4 contains chapters 10-12. This section is centered around the idea of poetry as a force for activism and social change. It explores the ideas of breaking stigmas, the power of a woman’s voice, and the potential for poetry to change and save lives. It includes stories from spoken word artists, college writers, and even the 2021 inaugural poet, Amanda Gorman.

story:
Welcome

This summer, The Blasted Tree is preparing to publish its first two full-length visual poetry books, Barcode Poetry by Kyle Flemmer and Without Form by Ben Robinson, the latter to be co-published with knife | fork | book. As with all Blasted Tree print publications, design and quality are of the utmost importance, and so we are holding this pre-sale and fundraiser to build excitement for the books, scale our print runs appropriately, and cover some of the production costs associated with making art books. Rather than follow a traditional publishing model, which involves a lot of overhead and third-party mediation, we feel bringing these titles directly to you—our friends, families, and poetry communities—will be the best way to get these books into print and out to those who want them. We have lots of fantastic perks and bundles on offer in addition to the books, so be sure to check out the one-of-a-kind art contributed in support of this venture, and if you do decide to order a perk, please make sure you understand our shipping terms and schedule, explained at the bottom of this page. Thanks for stopping by our pre-order and fundraiser campaign!

 

Barcode Poetry by Kyle Flemmer

The Blasted Tree will publish the first edition of Barcode Poetry by Kyle Flemmer in a square-format (7.5” x 7.5”) paperback. This book has 124 pages and will be printed in black and white at a local Calgary printer. I would like to make a minimum of 101 copies of Barcode Poetry, but pre-order commitments will give me a better idea of what I can realistically afford. Your help will go a long way in determining the reach of this book!

Book summary:

Riffing on company slogans, song lyrics, protest chants, and writing advice, Kyle Flemmer’s Barcode Poetry is a 101-part sequence of typewritten visual poems taking up the complicated relationship between art and commerce. Though made on a 1940 Remington Rand Deluxe Model 5 typewriter, a relic of the analogue past, these poems masquerade as the hallmark of digitized consumerism—barcodes—to playfully critique the paradox of creativity under capitalism. This debut collection includes an afterword by the author on composing typewriter art that positions Barcode Poetry against the commercialization of the culture industry.

About the author:

Kyle Flemmer is an author, editor, and publisher from Mohkinstsis in Treaty 7 territory. He founded The Blasted Tree Publishing Co. in 2014 and studies digital poetics at the University of Calgary.

 

Without Form by Ben Robinson

knife | fork | book and The Blasted Tree are teaming up to co-publish a limited edition of Without Form by Ben Robinson in a US Trade-format (6” x 9”) hardcover. This 766-page art book will be printed in black and white, bound in a linen-wrapped and foil stamped cover, then dust jacketed. We would like to print a limited edition of 50 numbered copies of Without Form (increased from 36, thanks to early support), and even with two publishers behind the project, the production costs will be considerable. Committing to your copy in advance will alleviate much of the risk of bringing this extraordinary book into print.

Book summary:

Since the mid-1500s, the text of the Holy Bible has been subdivided into chapters and verses. These markings are all we see in Ben Robinson’s Without Form, a meticulous erasure of the Bible sparing only its notation. The resultant text drifts like atomized numerical clouds across the mathematical superstructure of the divine, hinting at a supreme silence before the word. This ambitious project encompasses all sixty-six books of the Old and New Testaments combined—over seven hundred and fifty pages—co-published as a limited edition hardcover art book by The Blasted Tree and knife | fork | book.

About the author:

Ben Robinson is a poet, musician, and librarian. He has only ever lived in Hamilton, Ontario on the traditional territories of the Erie, Neutral, Huron-Wendat, Haudenosaunee, and Mississaugas. You can find him online at benrobinson.work.

 

About the Publishers

The Blasted Tree Publishing Co. is a small press based in Mohkinstsis promoting exceptional experimental writing by Canadian and international authors. I publish innovative poetry and visual poetry, short fiction, drama, graphic narrative, creative nonfiction, and multimedia art, with a special focus on the physical embodiment of unique practices and perspectives. Much of our content is available online, and I encourage you to browse the selection of print media in the online store. I even offer a subscription service if you like having chapbooks and leaflets appear in your mailbox. theblastedtree.com

With a passion for simple design and good work, Tkaronto-based knife | fork | book has been publishing poetry chapbooks since 2017. “Our aim,” says KFB’s publisher Kirby, “is to serve the book,” tending to the beauty of the book in hand. In 2019, KFB launched a second imprint, What Queer Reading [wQr], edited by Fan Wu, with a directive to publish queer/BIPOC poets. Also in 2019, KFB launched a NOT YOUR BEST series, the premiere issue edited by Eric Schmaltz. We have since branched out into broadsides, ephemera, and full-length collections. knifeforkbook.com

 

Fundraising Goals

Our initial plan was to release a limited edition of 36 hardcover copies of Without Form and a minimum of 101 paperback copies of the first edition of Barcode Poetry. Both books are print-ready, and I have secured printers suitable for each. I am set to proceed with print proofing this month and can move into production once we have finalized the number of copies to make. In order to meet our initial goal of 36 hardcover and 101 paperback books, the cost at the printer would be approximately $2,500 CAD. Thanks to strong early support for these titles, we have decided to increase our print runs to 50 hardcovers and 200 paperbacks, so costs are looking more like $4,000 CAD.

I set the fundraising goal at $2,000 CAD, somewhat lower than estimated production costs (even though this goal includes bonus items and shipping fees), because we are prepared to bring these books to print with even a fraction of the support needed to cover their full cost. These projects mean a great deal to the authors and publishers involved, and so we are committed to making them a reality. If you choose to invest in our fundraiser now, you can feel confident that you will be among the first to receive your copies in a matter of weeks.

Thank you so much to the early backers who helped us exceed our initial funding goal! All funds raised will be used to expand the reach of these publications, and now that have committed to an increase in copies, we could really use additional support to make it to our stretch goal. To that end, we are offering an assortment of unique perks and bundles showcasing the work of Canadian visual poets and typewriter artists closely related to our forthcoming titles. With gratitude to each of the contributing artists, here is an overview of our offerings…

 

Perks

 *** Please note that all shipped items will need the appropriate shipping fees applied manually at checkout. See below for details. ***

Barcode Poetry book – For $20, you can be among the first to receive a first edition paperback copy of Barcode Poetry by Kyle Flemmer.

Barcode Poetry book + poem – For $35, in addition to a copy of Barcode Poetry, receive the signed 8.5" x 8.5" typewritten original of a barcode poem of your choosing. Each typewritten poem is one of a kind, and every poem in the book is available. First choice goes to the earliest backers, who can select from an advance PDF copy of the book. 15 available.

Without Form book – For $60, you can be among the first to receive a limited edition hardcover copy of Without Form by Ben Robinson.

Without Form book + print – For $75, in addition to a copy of Without Form, receive a signed 8.5" x 11" artist print of the page from Without Form featuring the Bible verse of your choosing. 10 available.

Barcode Poetry & Without Form – For $75, receive both a first edition paperback copy of Barcode Poetry by Kyle Flemmer and a limited edition hardcover copy of Without Form by Ben Robinson. Save $5 when you order both!

KFB holy collab! bundle – For $100, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive a copy of three visual poetry publications treating the text of the Bible: Amanda Earl's Matthew chapbook (knife | fork | book, 2021), excerpted from her Vispo Bible series, Gary Barwin's Genesis leaflet (The Blasted Tree, 2021) responding to that series, and Ben Robinson's Without Form chapbook (The Blasted Tree, 2020). 2 available.

Robinson poetry bundle – For $100, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive three poetry chapbooks by Ben Robinson: Department of Continuous Improvement (above/ground, 2020), Talking Gibberish to Strangers (above/ground, 2019), and The Sims in Real Life (The Blasted Tree, 2019). 2 available.

CLAIMED *** Flemmer visual poetry bundle – For $100, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive three visual poetry chapbooks by Kyle Flemmer: Correctional Sonnets (Simulacrum, 2020), Coronagraphic (above/ground, 2018), and Astral Projection (above/ground, 2017). 2 available.

CLAIMED *** Spinosa visual poetry bundle – For $200, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive Semele, an original piece of typewriter art by Dani Spinosa. Semele is an 8.5" x 11" mixed media artwork processed through and layered with pornographic imagery. The poem has been ripped, collaged, and stitched back together, and comes framed. Please contact us for full process details. 1 available, shipping included.

CLAIMED *** Stebner visual poetry bundle – For $200, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive Vitreal, an original piece of typewriter art by Kevin Stebner. Vitreal is an 8.5" x 11" typewritten artwork experimenting with white-space used as positive space, and is part of Stebner's widely-published recent work that explores dimensionality through typography. Comes framed. 1 available, shipping included.

CLAIMED *** beaulieu visual poetry bundle – For $200, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive an original piece of typewriter art by derek beaulieu produced especially for this fundraiser. This 8.5" x 11" typewritten artwork and comes framed (more details coming soon). 1 available, shipping included.

 

Shipping & Schedule

IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR ALL PROSPECTIVE BACKERS — PLEASE READ!

Shipping:

In order to accommodate friends, family, and subscribers who normally get their Blasted Tree publications in person, shipping for all physical items has been set to $0 by default. Shipping books, particularly weighty hardcovers, is not exactly cheap, and so I would like to give those backers who have the ability to pick up their perks in person the opportunity to do so. However, if you do not already have a personal relationship with the press, you will most likely require shipping. The appropriate package size is automatically selected for your chosen perk, but you will need to manually add the proper flat-rate shipping option for your location. The chance to do so is offered as an add-on after you select your perk, but before you enter any further checkout details. Please note that any order placed without shipping will be held until we can arrange for pickup or transfer of the appropriate shipping fee, which can be accomplished outside Indiegogo, should the need arise. If you have any questions whatsoever, please do not hesitate to reach out using the 'Ask a question' function at the top of the page.

Schedule:

Because we are prepared to go to print once we have a clear idea of pre-sale numbers, you can expect to see us stick to the following production and release schedule.

  • Mid-July: pre-order and fundraiser campaign begins
  • Late July: both books go to print
  • Mid-August: pre-order closes
  • Late August: Barcode Poetry mailed out to backers
  • August 26: virtual launch of Barcode Poetry hosted by Shelf Life Books
  • Early September: Without Form mailed out to backers
  • October 1-5: knife | fork | book five year anniversary and launch of Without Form

 

We are ecstatic about these projects and hope you are too. You can help us build momentum for Barcode Poetry and Without Form by sharing our fundraising campaign with your networks, and by following our activities on social media: @barcode.poetry on Instagram, @theblastedtree on Instagram and Twitter, and @knifeforkbook on Instagram and Twitter. We hope you will consider supporting us, and thank you for getting to know our work.
