Save $5 when you order both!KFB holy collab! bundle – For $100, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive a copy of three visual poetry publications treating the text of the Bible: Amanda Earl's Matthew chapbook (knife | fork | book, 2021), excerpted from her Vispo Bible series, Gary Barwin's Genesis leaflet (The Blasted Tree, 2021) responding to that series, and Ben Robinson's Without Form chapbook (The Blasted Tree, 2020). 2 available.Robinson poetry bundle – For $100, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive three poetry chapbooks by Ben Robinson: Department of Continuous Improvement (above/ground, 2020), Talking Gibberish to Strangers (above/ground, 2019), and The Sims in Real Life (The Blasted Tree, 2019). 2 available.CLAIMED *** Flemmer visual poetry bundle – For $100, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive three visual poetry chapbooks by Kyle Flemmer: Correctional Sonnets (Simulacrum, 2020), Coronagraphic (above/ground, 2018), and Astral Projection (above/ground, 2017). 2 available.CLAIMED *** Spinosa visual poetry bundle – For $200, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive Semele, an original piece of typewriter art by Dani Spinosa. Semele is an 8.5" x 11" mixed media artwork processed through and layered with pornographic imagery. The poem has been ripped, collaged, and stitched back together, and comes framed. Please contact us for full process details. 1 available, shipping included.CLAIMED *** Stebner visual poetry bundle – For $200, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive Vitreal, an original piece of typewriter art by Kevin Stebner. Vitreal is an 8.5" x 11" typewritten artwork experimenting with white-space used as positive space, and is part of Stebner's widely-published recent work that explores dimensionality through typography. Comes framed. 1 available, shipping included.CLAIMED *** beaulieu visual poetry bundle – For $200, in addition to both Barcode Poetry and Without Form, receive an original piece of typewriter art by derek beaulieu produced especially for this fundraiser. This 8.5" x 11" typewritten artwork and comes framed (more details coming soon). 1 available, shipping included. Shipping & ScheduleIMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR ALL PROSPECTIVE BACKERS — PLEASE READ!Shipping:In order to accommodate friends, family, and subscribers who normally get their Blasted Tree publications in person, shipping for all physical items has been set to $0 by default. Shipping books, particularly weighty hardcovers, is not exactly cheap, and so I would like to give those backers who have the ability to pick up their perks in person the opportunity to do so. However, if you do not already have a personal relationship with the press, you will most likely require shipping. The appropriate package size is automatically selected for your chosen perk, but you will need to manually add the proper flat-rate shipping option for your location. The chance to do so is offered as an add-on after you select your perk, but before you enter any further checkout details. Please note that any order placed without shipping will be held until we can arrange for pickup or transfer of the appropriate shipping fee, which can be accomplished outside Indiegogo, should the need arise. If you have any questions whatsoever, please do not hesitate to reach out using the 'Ask a question' function at the top of the page.Schedule:Because we are prepared to go to print once we have a clear idea of pre-sale numbers, you can expect to see us stick to the following production and release schedule.
Mid-July: pre-order and fundraiser campaign begins
Late July: both books go to print
Mid-August: pre-order closes
Late August: Barcode Poetry mailed out to backers
August 26: virtual launch of Barcode Poetry hosted by Shelf Life Books
Early September: Without Form mailed out to backers
October 1-5: knife | fork | book five year anniversary and launch of Without Form

 We are ecstatic about these projects and hope you are too. You can help us build momentum for Barcode Poetry and Without Form by sharing our fundraising campaign with your networks, and by following our activities on social media: @barcode.poetry on Instagram, @theblastedtree on Instagram and Twitter, and @knifeforkbook on Instagram and Twitter. We hope you will consider supporting us, and thank you for getting to know our work.

story:
Story of My Book

Air Unplugged is set in a futuristic world where on the first day of Ary’s job as a flight nurse, the helicopter flight to an ordinary, everyday call crashes, and Ary finds herself in a world unplugged from the rest of society.

My name is Olga Akopiants and I am the author of Air Unplugged. I wrote this book because of a personal experience I share with the protagonist where I considered, “What’s the worst that could happen?” Through re-imagining the worst case scenario, the main protagonist learned about the beauty of resiliency.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover new life philosophies. But I also hope that you have fun in cheering on the main protagonist in her quest to survive.

On a grander scale, this book is an opportunity to escape our current world of technology and reconsider the benefits and the drawbacks of it all; however, there’s no straightforward answer to that question. Throughout the book, I had a fun time exploring how the future might look with technology available for everyday citizens. Air Unplugged is an exaggerated example of our current world.


THE NOVEL:
The novel begins with red lights, all-seeing phones and advertisements that are convincing on the sensory level. But in an unfortunate tide of events, Ary is thrown into a world that is far from algorithms. It is a world that is not subservient to mankind and demands constant action for one’s survival — that being, nature. Ary was not prepared to live in this world. All that she knows is there is an inferior subpopulation of mankind that lives there.

You will love this book if you are looking to speculate on what the future could look like and the sociological impacts of technology. You will enjoy this book if you are looking for action mixed with slow philosophical moments. Lastly, you might enjoy this book if you’ve been looking for a relatable read with a strong female presence.

Air Unplugged speaks to women or fresh graduates entering their respective careers who want to grapple with the idea of resiliency.

Ultimately, I hope that Air Unplugged inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

-What is a good life philosophy to keep for modern graduates?

-How does trauma change us? How can we move past trauma?

-How is technology affecting us?

-How does the business model of healthcare affect medical professionals?

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Olga Akopiants is an undergraduate at the University of Virginia who enjoys expressing herself creatively whether through music, fashion, or word. Since elementary school, she would write non-sensical fictional stories that only made sense to an eight-year-old mind; to this day, she continues this same level of passion. If Olga is not completing schoolwork or volunteering at a local rescue squad, she is either sleep deprived, staying up late in a fit of creative fun, or finding some terrible music to listen to and adding it to her poorly named Spotify playlists.

She was inspired to write this book while working as an EMT at the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic. On top of the rhetoric surrounding healthcare professionals and the demands for PPE, she was motivated to write this book due to the unsafe conditions that she was placed in while working. She felt the dangerous conditions could have been avoided with a shift in company values, in an innately precarious job. She hopes that this story can serve as a reminder for the importance of keeping everyone safe at work, so they can all make it home another night.

As an EMT, Olga encountered many personal stories and personalities that she’ll never forget. With this, along with her love for using storytelling as a tool, Olga enjoys writing with a medical theme because it shows humanity at its most vulnerable. In the near future, she aims to become a physician assistant and continue serving the humanity that inspires her the most.

You can connect with me at olgaakopiants@gmail.com or on instagram @olga_akop_author.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AirUnplugged and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
O.K.A

story:
Story of My Book

The Age Tech Revolution 

Have you ever thought about how your life might be when you're in your 70s, 80s or 90s? More specifically, about what technology will be available to you then, and what will it enable you to do?

My name is Keren Etkin, and I wrote this book because I think that the intersection of two trends-  aging of the population and the digital transformation our society is going through, is the most interesting place to be in at this point in time.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that older adults actually do use technology and that if you're an entrepreneur or investor, you'll be convinced that developing tech-enabled products and services for older adults should be your #1 priority.

In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for age tech. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you educate yourself on older adults and the challenges of aging, as well as on some of the technology that's available out there to tackle those challenges, and what is the potential for the years to come.

In this book, you'll learn about older adults and technology. You'll hear stories such as:

- How I became a gerontologist in tech

- A story about a social robotic companion for older adults

- A story about the entrepreneur that build a managed apartments startup with companionship built in

You will love this book if you are an entrepreneurs or an investor that's curious about the age tech space, if you're an elder care professional, a family caregiver or an older adult, and even if you are just a young adult interested in what life will be like for you when you're in your 70s, 80s or even 90s.

The Age Tech Revolution is a nonfiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs, investors, older adults and those who care for them, who want to look at aging and technology in a new way.
 

The Book

If you have no background in age tech whatsoever - there's no need to worry, this book makes no assumptions about previous knowledge readers might have and covers the basic concepts before diving into the age tech realm,

The book explains why age tech is here to stay, and covers the challenges of aging as well with some examples of the most interesting tech-enabled solutions that tackle these challenges from different angles. I'll share with you some real-life stories about real-life people who are affected by these challenges.

You'll read about my early experiences as a gerontologist working on the some of the most cutting-edge technology and making it work for older adults, as well as some stories from some of the most inspiring entrepreneurs and older adults I've met on this journey, and come to understand why it is critical that we make ALL technology age inclusive.

In the final chapters, we'll discuss what entrepreneurs have to know if they want to build tech-enabled products and services for older adults, what policymakers should be doing to promote tech for older adults (and what some of them are already doing), and how everyone - including older adults and those who care for them, can take part.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

The Cover Design of my book (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in the winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

About the Author

Keren is the Creator of TheGerontechnologist.com, a media platform that covers the global age tech ecosystem and offers online courses through the Age Tech Academy.

Keren was named one of the most influential people in aging by Next Avenue. She is a public speaker and an advisor for age tech startups, investors in the longevity economy, care providers and organizations who work on innovation in aging.

As the first employee at Intuition Robotics, the startup behind ElliQ, she helped build world’s first social robot that was designed with and for older adults. She also co-founded Sensi.Ai, a startup that developed the first and only AI solution for remote care monitoring.

She holds an M.A. in Gerontology B.Sc. in Life Sciences.

She wrote The Age Tech Revolution because she is passionate about age tech and believes that the intersection of tech and aging is the most important and interesting place for an entrepreneur to be in at this point in time.

In her spare time, she enjoys spending time with her partner and taking her dog to the dog beach. 

For more information, you can connect with Keren via email, LinkedIn or Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #AgeTechRevolution and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
@newdegreepress
LinkedIn - @KerenEtkin/ @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @KerenEtkin/ @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Keren Etkin

story:
Story of My Book

The American Crisis: The Secret Behind Student Loans is a book that looks at the student loan debt crisis in a new way. There are many sides to this crisis and, unfortunately, most of the people involved don’t know the full story.

My name is Meghana Boda and I am the author of The American Crisis. I wrote this book because I am interested in topics pertaining to finance, but also the legal aspect of many companies. The student loan debt crisis became an intense passion of mine after I watched a documentary episode on the issue late in the winter of 2020.

I hope that, in reading this book, you will discover certain aspects of the student loan debt crisis that people don’t necessarily want you to know about, and reveal certain paths we can take to better the impact of this crisis in the future. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the student loan debt crisis. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool that helps you take actions that change your life so you won’t be impacted, and/or encourage you to improve the symptoms of this crisis in those around you.

In this book, there are three main sections through which you'll learn about the causes of the crisis, things that are being done right now to fix the crisis, and what you can be doing right now to better the future. You'll hear stories like...

  • Students impacted by the bills passed for student loan forgiveness.
  • The potential corruption of student loan servicers.
  • Personal stories of political figures such as Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio Cortez.
  • You will love this book if you are genuinely interested in student loan debt, if you want to get out of the crisis, or if you want to bring about change in your communities.

The American Crisis: The Secret Behind Student Loans is a nonfiction book that speaks to high school/college students, parents of students, and people who were or are involved in the crisis who want to look at student loan forgiveness and student debt in a different way.

 

The Book - The American Crisis

The book is written in 3 parts:

  • Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. This section focuses on the past — what happened to lead up to the student loan debt crisis. For example, one specific factor is college endowments.

  • Part 2 contains chapters 3-8. This part of the book focuses on the present — what is going on right now in terms of this crisis. Among the main topics addressed in the book are the bills and policies that are being put into place right now and how they are affecting people.
  • Part 3 contains chapter 9. This last section is about the future — what can we be doing to better the future of this crisis. A large part of this section addresses what the public can do without the help of politicians. Some small actions are definitely worth note-taking.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Meghana Boda is the founder of two organizations, GenZ Girls and The Global Medium. GenZ Girls is an organization that she co-founded with three others in order to uplift girls in marginalized communities through the act of storytelling. Additionally, The Global Medium is an online magazine for high schoolers, by high schoolers.

After passion was sparked by a certain documentary episode, Meghana found herself immersed in the world of finance and student debt, eventually amassing so much information that she decided to create a work of art in her new book.

Meghana loves anything music-related — she is involved in the Columbus International Children’s Choir, but also goes back to her roots through performing an Indian Classical Dance form, and Indian Classical singing. She has also been involved in music from a very young age.

For more information, you can connect with Meghana Boda at meghana.connects@gmail.com and these social media platforms: LinkedIn, Instagram, and Tik Tok.

 


 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit?)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #supportmeghana and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Story:

Poetry and science have a long history of collaboration, and as we live through the urgency of climate collapse - this shared project of communication is paramount. I hope to carry a poetic lens into the Arctic landscape as I set sail with fellow artists and scientists around Svalbard in October.

I can’t say what I’ll witness, and I won’t be able to fathom the scale of the Arctic until I arrive. This is a terrain of deep time and accelerating ice loss.

I received an MFA in Creative Writing from the University of New Hampshire, where I was fortunate to study with Charles Simic. Wonder Tissue, my first full-length collection of poems, won the Airlie Press Prize and was short-listed for a Massachusetts Book Award. I’ve written poetry for NASA as part of a select group of artists who were invited to see the James Webb Space Telescope at Goddard Space Center. It has been my personal project to capture the human experience from ecological and cosmological perspectives. The pulse of this project has certainly increased as we witness the literal and figurative storms of climate collapse, with the Arctic Circle as an epicenter.

I'm so grateful for this opportunity to sail around Svalbard with artists and scientists, and I’d like to share the experience with you as best I can. 

What You Get:

All funding will go toward necessities, as sailing off-grid in the High Arctic will require a lot of preparation, especially for an October trip.

Funding will also go to the perks of choosing to back this project. I’d like to capture the sensory experience of the Arctic for you, be it through:

  • Instax pictures (subject to the elements, perishable, like ecosystems)
  • Sound clips (auditory snapshots of the Arctic terrain)
  • Video clips (attempts to capture Arctic scale and geological time)
  • Postcards (grounded in place and time)

My fundraising goal is more in the service of engaging with as many people as would like to contribute. If you think it would be cool to get a postcard or audio clip from Svalbard, then join in!

Eventually, I hope the Arctic Circle Residency experience evolves into whatever creative incarnation best fits. I am hopeful for poems. I am hopeful for Arctic dreams.

Risks & Challenges

Important Note: we will be receiving a final go/no-go decision around September 20th so I will be prepared to travel when word arrives. The residency will make a final decision based on travel guidelines and the health and safety of the residents. If the trip is deferred, I will gladly refund contributions and hopefully try again the following year.

Antigua Photo Credit: Sandra Kuehne

Illustration from The Arctic Grail

Story of My Book

The Bitcoin Investor is about standing at the intersection of finance and technology and evaluate and comprehend this exciting new asset class built on the top of blockchain technology.

My name is Amit Kaushik, and I am the author of The Bitcoin Investor. I wrote this book because, in my experience of building an Asset Management Company focusing on Cryptocurrencies, I found a significant lack of framework and tools that an investor needs to understand and evaluate this asset class.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that blockchain is a foundational technology like the Internet. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for studying about and investing in Cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, DeFi, and NFTs. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you navigate the complexity of Cryptocurrencies and the inherent risk of investing in this new and volatile asset class.

In this book, you'll learn about how blockchain can give rise to a new economy built around decentralization, similar to how the Internet gave rise to the information economy, and why this is important in understanding the enormous growth potential of this asset class. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Marc Andreessen, the visionary who built the Netscape browser kicking off the Internet in the 90s.
  • Mike Novogratz, the bull of Wall Street, bet big on Bitcoin and Ethereum way earlier than anyone else on Wall Street.
  • Cathy Wood, the innovation hunter, discovered and invested in Bitcoin in 2015 at about $250 per Bitcoin.

You will love this book if you want to learn about blockchain technology in an accessible manner, become familiar with the value drivers of Cryptocurrencies, and make an informed investing decision in this asset class.

The Bitcoin Investor is a nonfiction book that speaks to institutional and retail investors who want to look at the cryptocurrencies and investing in a new way.

The Book - The Bitcoin Investor

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-4. This section introduces Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies by drawing parallels between the growth of the early Internet and Bitcoin. In this section, you will learn how traditional financial valuation tools do not work with the early growth stages of foundational technologies like the Internet and blockchain.

Part 2 contains chapters 5-7. This section delves into the contrasting value drivers behind an old economy company like Blockbuster and a new economy company like Netflix. New economy companies' products often become more valuable as new customers sign up, a phenomenon known in the economics literature as the increasing marginal returns. This phenomenon can explain how new technology like Bitcoin can have unexpected and exponential growth.

Part 3 contains chapters 8-11. In this section, the reader learns that the seeds of modern decentralized money were sown in the early 80s by a group of Computer Scientists known as Cypherpunks. Satoshi Nakamoto’s Bitcoin design, presented in a white paper in 2008, was a culmination of a three-decade-long effort by theoreticians, programmers, and mathematicians. This section introduces the building blocks of Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other blockchain protocols. By the end of this section, the reader should understand the history and technology of these protocols.

Part 4 contains chapters 12-14. This section tackles Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies from an investing perspective. A risk-return analysis of the price history is presented. The readers get a front-seat view of how these assets have arrived at their present state. The exceptional returns have come with enormous volatility. The risks inherent in such returns make it important to understand how to include this asset class in a portfolio.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in September 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Amit Kaushik, CFA, is the founder and Chief Investment Officer of SciFeCap LLC, a Crypto Asset Management Firm based in the United States. In the past, Amit has worked at the leading hedge fund Millennium Management and Wall Street firms such as Barclays and Bank of America. He studied engineering and finance before joining Bank of America in 2007.

Amit wrote this book because he found that the traditional tools of financial analysis were difficult to apply to this asset class. He also saw that the professionals on the two sides, finance and technology, were often talking across each other. Building upon his expertise in both areas, he wrote this book to bring a coherent framework to understanding and investing in Cryptocurrencies.

For more information, you can connect with Amit Kaushik at thebitcoininvestorx@gmail.com.
https://www.linkedin.com/in/amit-kaushik-cfa-cqf/.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thebitcoininvestor and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Amit Kaushik, CFA

story:
The Big Picture

For about ten years, I've known I've wanted to write a sequel to Nikolai Gogol's hilarious satire "Dead Souls," and I've decided to include illustrations as well. It's going up serialized, and here's a link to some of it:

https://deadsoulsanamericanpoem.com/

And a little bit about me:

  • I love Russian literature. My favorite books include "The Master and Margarita" by Bulgakov, "A Hero of Our Time" by Lermontov, "Invitation to a Beheading" by Nabokov... and of course, "Dead Souls" by Gogol. What do all these works have in common? They're absolutely brilliant (though incredibly dark) satire. None of this dense, heavy Tolstoy garbage.
  • Who am I? I'm a fiction writer whose work has appeared in a few magazines. I've won the 35th "On the Premises" contest with a story about God and schizophrenia (it's actually satire as well): https://onthepremises.com/issues/issue-35/issue...
  • Who am I to write this? Probably a bit too big-headed for my own good, but I thought I'd add to Gogol's incredible political satire by 1. Translating it into modern American terms and 2. Not needing to do 30+ years of 1840s Russian political life. It'll work don't worry.
  • Why now? Because we have a major election coming up, and it seems good timing for a political satire. Better to laugh than to cry, right?

So enough about me, let's get into it!

What is "Dead Souls?" Who is Gogol, and why isn't his name spelled "Google?"

Dead Souls is a political satire about Pavel Ivanovitch Tchitchikov (Chichikov), a small-time bureaucrat running a big-time scam. He goes from mansion to mansion to buy up the names of dead peasants, and with these names, he plans to take out a loan from the Russian government with his ghostly collateral. It is the ultimate bank fraud scheme. I love it.

Gogol intended his "poem in prose" to be in three parts. We have the full first part. He wrote the second part and loved it so much, he decided to burn it and let himself be haunted by its imperfections.

A little more information about Gogol's original "Dead Souls": https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_Souls

(I don't know why Gogol is spelled that way, but the better question is "Why isn't Google spelled 'Gogol'?")

Iiiiinteresting, so what do you need for "Dead Souls: An American Poem?"

I'm looking for capital to print out 100 paperback copies. I want 20 for marketing, 10-15 for public relations and reviews, 8 for my illustrators' portfolios, and the rest to sell on my music blog, https://musicravings.com/ I'm printing it at Lightning Press in NJ because I hate hate HATE giving Amazon money. I've financed the book covers and the illustrations (oof) already.

Big Project; Where's the Rest of the Crazy?

I'm actually letting people read the novel FOR FREE. I'm serializing it on the web at https://deadsoulsanamericanpoem.com/ Even crazier, I'm offering the ebook for sale on a sliding scale on Smashwords: https://www.smashwords.com/books/view/1028161

That's the end of the crazy. The reality of it is that I've self-published two collections of short stories and received generally 4-star reviews. https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/24087690-the-keeper-of-dreams I'm pretty confident in what I'm doing.

Veeeeery interesting. What can I do, and what do I get?

My #1 concern is to get people to read the novel. It's free! If you like it, share and spread the joy, right? So make sure to use those share icons. That would be lovely.

Check out the tiers of awesome things you get - I'm offering both copies of The Keeper of Dreams as well as some fine signatures out for you lovely, lovely people. (And of course you get a deal on these books for supporting me!

Again, check out some of the book for free:

https://deadsoulsanamericanpoem.com/

If you want to donate to be on the site as a "Thank you," I've got you covered.

Thank you so much for checking this fundraiser out! Please please please share! And I would really love to hear what people think.

(PS - the story that won Honorable Mention in the "Writers of the Future Contest": https://musicravings.com/the-vote)

story:
The Story of Steel in the Blood

Erick is the Executor of the Geneline Ollson, protector of over nine billion of the Empress’s loyal subjects. He has ruled for three centuries and is preparing his daughter to take his place-but that may happen sooner than he hoped. Accused of treason and the target of a looming civil war, he must find the evidence to clear his family name. But in his search, he uncovers a dark secret that threatens the very place of the Empire of Humanity among the stars.

My name is N.T. Narbutovskih and I am the author of Steel in the Blood, the first book in the Reckoning Cycle. I wrote this book because I have always loved the power of science fiction, its ability to reveal truths about our lives and humanity. I wanted to explore a great story in a compelling universe with multifaceted characters, and I think the themes of this story are particularly relevant to our times.

In reading this book, I hope that you will discover what you believe about the nature of humanity and experience a sense of wonder. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with privilege and rights, escape from the struggle of these things in modern life, and learn alongside Erick about the importance of examining why, or even if, you believe what you do.

The Universe of Steel in the Blood

The Empire of Humanity has stood for two thousand years. All software source code is encrypted to a single human genome. From the diaspora near the end of the twenty-third century, the Empire spanned a thousand suns in only a thousand years. But then, the Mendicant Uprising made the Empress look inward, and in her wisdom, she decided that the machine intelligences were too dangerous. Despite her best efforts, Empress Titania I could not stop the machines as they genocided entire planets. Finally, she found a way to defeat them and brought stability and peace back to the Empire. For a thousand more years, the Executors built the trade schedules, kept the peace, and the Empire grew wealthy and prospered.

Erick of Ollson has ruled for nearly three hundred years. He has kept the schedules, the factories have run on time, and his people have been safe from the raids of the Others, despite their place on the periphery. He is normally cool-headed and calm, with iron self-control under external stress. He is an adept statesman, knows the rules of the game and where the power is to be found in the seams not filled by the Empress.

His daughter, Bryn, is learning quickly and is proving to be as ruthless in politics as she is in the dojo. She is fiercely loyal to the Ollson Geneline and values her advisors and staff as if they were family. She accompanies Erick to all official Geneline functions as a matter of course. Still, She would go regardless-she has more than a passing interest in Azita, the heir to the Exectorship of Osman.

There has been peace for a millennium, with the Empire running in perfect harmony. The periphery Genelines mine the giant stars. The materials are transformed into goods, luxuries, and necessities, the wealth flowing into the Throneworld-Earth, a planet kept for the Empress alone. But no peace lasts forever.

Erick and his daughter are accused of high treason, breaking the peace, destroying the Empress’s property, and attacking a rival Geneline. Erick has only a few years to prepare before his enemy’s ships appear and plunge him into all-out war. But he believes in the Empire-he knows he can find the proof that will clear his name and present it to the Empress. She will restore his status and his systems. Bryn loves her father but thinks him old and set in his ways. There will be a war, and she will be ready.
 

Who’s this for, anyway?

For fans of Dune, The Expanse, and Three-Body Problem, this book is for you! You will love this book if you like grand, sweeping tales, adventure, action, romance, and mystery. Intrigue and politics? Yep. Old and dark secrets? Check. And if you like characters with many dimensions, who discover new ones and face uncomfortable truths... Well, you’ll be right at home!

Steel in the Blood speaks to fans of military science fiction and space opera who want to grapple with the question of right and wrong across a wide range of situations-all through a fast-paced and riveting adventure.

Ultimately, I hope that Steel in the Blood inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What is the nature of loyalty?

Why do you think what you think you think?

Is it better to have stability or freedom?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!
 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling before publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback. Please help me write this book and make the story better!

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

Some tiers of support also include invitations to the Book Launch Party!

Last but not least, you can get a character written into the next book that is loosely based on you! There are a limited number of these slots, so sign up now!

Campaign Goal

Standard Tiers:
Tier 1: Hit $8,000, and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $9,000, and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $11,000, and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
Tier 2: Hit $11,500, and everyone gets character art!
Tier 3: Hit $13,000, and everyone gets a themed bookmark and 2-hour author Livestream after launch!

About the Author

Nicholas T. Narbutovskih is a military pilot with the United States Air Force. He has served for fourteen years and deployed nine times. He is an avid consumer of science fiction and read Larry Niven’s “Ringworld” at the arguably early age of nine. Ever since, he has been fascinated by the genre’s ability to reveal deep truths through story and metaphor and predict what is probable and possible.

He wrote this book for many reasons. It began as an idle thought experiment into what a stable interstellar empire might look like based on what we know now and how exactly that might come to pass. But the characters, the implications of AI and our use of it, indeed even the stability-instability of a have and have-not system, it all took on a life of its own.

Outside of writing and flying, he is an avid reader and goes through an average of three books a week. He is an involuntarily experienced home-improvement aficionado and randomly bounces between the hobbies of 3-d printing, woodworking, hiking, ultramarathon, triathlon, painting, and skiing (location dependent!).

For more information, you can connect with Nick at nick@narbutov.com and Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g., 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form  to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit!)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #SteelintheBlood and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instagram - @NNarbutovskih/ @newdegreepress
Facebook - @NNarbutovskih / @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @NNarbutovskih / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nick

story:
Story of My Book

The Bell Tolling is the epic story of a hero who combines political and military rule with spiritual leadership in his journey to defeat a most evil tyrant and save his world.

My name is Amena Jamali, and I am the author of The Bell Tolling. I wrote this book because of my passion for the characters and my wish to share their story with the world. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find the story as inspiring and uplifting as I do. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside the characters about the importance of freedom, wisdom, and gratitude amid difficult circumstances.

You will love this book if you enjoy fantasy, stories with a touch of spirituality, and a thoughtful depiction of political discourse.


The Bell Tolling

The Blood-soaked Sorcerer tyrannizes the land of Icilia with every form of cruelty imaginable, dying his armor red in the blood of innocents. Crushed to pieces under such savagery, the people of Icilia abandon hope and begin to forget the gifts of civilization that had once been their dearest blessings.

Amid this darkness comes light in the form of Lucian aj-Shehathar, the divinely appointed hero of Icilia, and Leader of the Quest of Freedom. Sheltered by love and educated in every ancient art, Lucian has the virtue, magic, and power necessary to cleanse evil from the land. But not alone, for Icilia is vast and the enemy’s claws have penetrated far beyond the surface.
Answering the call of his sacred destiny, Lucian gathers four companions: Malika, Elian, Arista, and Kyros. Each has been forced to drink at the Blood’s well of suffering:

Malika, once crown princess, has spent years in the tyrant’s prisons and years more fleeing from his grasp. Elian cowers, tormented and alone, amid the remains of the long-ago murder of his parents at the Blood’s hand. Arista fears exploitation of the worst sort as she watches the Blood and his governors prey upon her family, the once mighty warrior princesses of the desert. Kyros gives everything to protect his sister from the abuse of his village in the years after the Blood’s massacre of his family.

Tortured, alone, broken—they are hardly the stuff of heroes. But Lucian chooses them, trusting in divine choice and in his own ability to protect them and build their confidence. With his four companions at his side, Lucian embarks on his journey to free his world. He is determined to restore the forgotten laws, heal the tormented, and unite the land behind his banner. But his companions seem too shattered to save anyone, while his people might be too blind to see the light...
 

The Bell Tolling speaks to readers of epic fantasy and political intrigue who want to grapple with political leadership and ethics in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope The Bell Tolling inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What is the true meaning of freedom?
  • What does empowerment look like?
  • How is hope born amid desperate circumstances?
  • How does the ideal political leader act? How does he treat those who differ from him in appearance and beliefs?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing political leadership, empowerment, and spirituality will change us all for the better.

 

The Book Itself

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note, the Preface, the Promise, and Chapters 1-14. These chapters introduce the five heroes of the story and show the desperation of their circumstances, as well as how Lucian addresses each of his companions’ plights.

Part 2 contains chapters 15-26. These chapters describe the heroes’ journey to the first nation they intend to reconquer. Along the way, they confront the land’s troubles and their personal torments.

Part 3 contains chapters 27-42. These chapters cover the heroes’ development into rulers capable of conducting a nation-wide military and political campaign, as well as the first signs of their success.

Part 4 contains chapters 43-57. These chapters feature the heroes’ struggles to reap the fruits of their efforts and achieve victory in the first nation of their reconquest.

The Bell Tolling is the first book of a planned series of seven books.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.


When I pre-sell 180 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 210 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 250 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish. Please also fill out this form if you’d like an autograph from one of the five heroes of the story! (Note: The default quote will be from the hero, Lucian, unless I see a record of your selection. If you order multiple copies, I will use the same selection for all of your copies.)
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.

About the Author

Amena Jamali is a double-alumna of the University of Dallas with degrees in Politics and Cybersecurity. She is an active member of her religious community, her university circle, and professional groups that advance the talents of women cyber professionals. In accordance with her academic and professional interests, she is a thoughtful young woman who often thinks and talks like someone thrice her age.

Amena wrote this book as a way to discuss politics and spirituality freed from the bounds of our world. She is passionate about serious and respectful discussions in politics and hopes to inspire a different sort of thinking about community and political engagement. She is curious about human nature in every form.

Though often grave and wise, Amena has a quirky sense of humor - inherited from her father! - and can talk superheroes with the most committed DC and Marvel fans. She enjoys embroidery, fantasy books, action movies, and long walks with good friends.

For more information and engagement, you can connect with Amena Jamali at @Icilia_Archivist on Instagram and @IciliaArchivist on Twitter.

 

International Preorders

Because my publisher can ship only to addresses in the United States, if you live outside the US, please send me a private message. The ebook is available everywhere, but the paperback is not.

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

It would be the mean the world if you would help spread word of my campaign. Please share my pre-sale campaign on Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, and WhatsApp with your friends, family and network. If you use #TheBellTolling and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, we can help amplify your efforts. You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With Gratitude,
Amena Jamali

Story of My BookThe Bell Tolling is the epic story of a hero who combines political and military rule with spiritual leadership in his journey to defeat a most evil tyrant and save his world.My name is Amena Jamali, and I am the author of The Bell Tolling. I wrote this book because of my passion for the characters and my wish to share their story with the world. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find the story as inspiring and uplifting as I do. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside the characters about the importance of freedom, wisdom, and gratitude amid difficult circumstances.You will love this book if you enjoy fantasy, stories with a touch of spirituality, and a thoughtful depiction of political discourse.The Bell TollingThe Blood-soaked Sorcerer tyrannizes the land of Icilia with every form of cruelty imaginable, dying his armor red in the blood of innocents. Crushed to pieces under such savagery, the people of Icilia abandon hope and begin to forget the gifts of civilization that had once been their dearest blessings.Amid this darkness comes light in the form of Lucian aj-Shehathar, the divinely appointed hero of Icilia, and Leader of the Quest of Freedom. Sheltered by love and educated in every ancient art, Lucian has the virtue, magic, and power necessary to cleanse evil from the land. But not alone, for Icilia is vast and the enemy’s claws have penetrated far beyond the surface.Answering the call of his sacred destiny, Lucian gathers four companions: Malika, Elian, Arista, and Kyros. Each has been forced to drink at the Blood’s well of suffering:Malika, once crown princess, has spent years in the tyrant’s prisons and years more fleeing from his grasp. Elian cowers, tormented and alone, amid the remains of the long-ago murder of his parents at the Blood’s hand. Arista fears exploitation of the worst sort as she watches the Blood and his governors prey upon her family, the once mighty warrior princesses of the desert. Kyros gives everything to protect his sister from the abuse of his village in the years after the Blood’s massacre of his family.Tortured, alone, broken—they are hardly the stuff of heroes. But Lucian chooses them, trusting in divine choice and in his own ability to protect them and build their confidence. With his four companions at his side, Lucian embarks on his journey to free his world. He is determined to restore the forgotten laws, heal the tormented, and unite the land behind his banner. But his companions seem too shattered to save anyone, while his people might be too blind to see the light... The Bell Tolling speaks to readers of epic fantasy and political intrigue who want to grapple with political leadership and ethics in a new way.Ultimately, I hope The Bell Tolling inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
What is the true meaning of freedom?
What does empowerment look like?
How is hope born amid desperate circumstances?
How does the ideal political leader act? How does he treat those who differ from him in appearance and beliefs?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing political leadership, empowerment, and spirituality will change us all for the better. The Book ItselfThe book is written in 4 parts.Part 1 contains the author’s note, the Preface, the Promise, and Chapters 1-14. These chapters introduce the five heroes of the story and show the desperation of their circumstances, as well as how Lucian addresses each of his companions’ plights.Part 2 contains chapters 15-26. These chapters describe the heroes’ journey to the first nation they intend to reconquer. Along the way, they confront the land’s troubles and their personal torments.Part 3 contains chapters 27-42. These chapters cover the heroes’ development into rulers capable of conducting a nation-wide military and political campaign, as well as the first signs of their success.Part 4 contains chapters 43-57. These chapters feature the heroes’ struggles to reap the fruits of their efforts and achieve victory in the first nation of their reconquest.The Bell Tolling is the first book of a planned series of seven books. What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

story:
The Background

In 2011, after three long years, I completed a novel, 'The Unbearable Stupidity Of Being', and began searching for a publisher. With the characters very much alive in my head, I immediately threw myself into a second, 'Six Degrees Of Stupidity'. Eighteen months later it was finished – just in time for me to become massively distracted by the campaign for Scottish independence and the looming 2014 referendum.

My contribution to that campaign was to take all the absurdity, satire and fantasy I'd developed in those books and adapt it to political comic strip form in order to bring some much-needed humour and colour to the debate. I've created a weekly cartoon ever since.

And the books? Well, at the height of lockdown in 2020 I took another look and was delighted to find that not only were they as much fun as I remembered, they were also something I could be proud of. Six Degrees was slightly more polished and fresher in my mind than its predecessor, so I began the lengthy editing and rewriting process that's taken until now to complete.

The Story

Underemployed graphic designer Tony Boaks creates a coat of arms for Guy LeSnide, a QC (‘like a lawyer, but even more so’) with monumental delusions of grandeur. Before settling his bill however, LeSnide’s delusions turn to madness and he retreats to the fictional English region of Wester – a dense and murky area only accessible by canal.

Unwilling to let madness be an excuse for non-payment, Tony sets out on an epic quest to track him down, narrowboating into Wester’s heart of darkness and taking the spikey unrequited love of his life, LaFlamme, along for the ride.

Encounters with a psychotic ventriloquist dummy, a deviant gastrophile and a professional beard-reader are just some of the weirdnesses to expect in this delightfully quirky satire set in a fantastical comic universe.

The Funding

It's taken years to produce this book. As well as being the writer, I'm also the publisher, editor, typesetter and cover designer. But I'm not asking you to fund that time.

What I'm asking for is the cost of printing and the materials needed to create the additional perks, along with a modest wage to continue the weekly cartoon (which has been mostly without funding since I was released from The National at the start of lockdown) for a few more months. I still believe independence is just around the corner, and this is no time to quit making fun of politicians. (See gregmoodie.com)

The Perks

In return, you can expect a signed first edition copy of the 232-page paperback book (197mm x 132mm, approximately 8" x 5"), printed in Scotland by Bell & Bain Ltd. Additional perks include T-shirts, hand painted prints and full-size screenprinted acrylic painted canvases, all based on my front cover design. (See images above and click on the individual perks on the right for details.)

The Impact

According to the publisher of my 2018 book 'Cool Scots', satire is a rare breed in Scottish literature. It may be that some books never see the light of day or get the attention they deserve due to the ongoing difficulty artists face trying to fund their work. Your support is vital. Every contribution will help bring this odd little gem to life and show that Scotland can produce genuinely funny satirical fiction.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign widely. Satire and fantasy are both essential for the world's mental health, especially in these trying times. Thank you for your contribution.

story:
Story of My Book

Leading Blind without Vision: The Struggles of Visually Impaired and Blind Individuals that Lead to Their Success is a book about the struggles that people who are blind and visually impaired go through when trying to find and maintain employment. This book will educate the business community on the benefits and value of hiring this population.

My name is Welby Broaddus and I am the author of Leading Blind without Vision: The Struggles of Visually Impaired and Blind Individuals that Lead to Their Success. I wrote this book because I want to tell my story about the struggles and discrimination I faced as a visually impaired individual looking for employment. I also want to lead the charge to inspire a new outlook on hiring the visually impaired, and educate HR professionals, business executives, and business owners on the opportunities of employing those in this talented group of people.

My hope is that, in reading this book you will discover the value, skill set, and untapped talent that employers will gain by hiring people who are blind and visually impaired. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for recognizing talents and value within others. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the benefits of employing people who are blind and visually impaired.

In this book, you'll learn about the Americans with Disabilities Act's guidelines when employing individuals who are blind and visually impaired and how to accommodate this population in the workplace. You'll learn about...

  • The science behind visual impairment- how the brain rewires the senses of people who are blind and visually impaired
  • Examples of discrimination - such as how one professor was discriminated against during an interview.
  • Critical thinking skills - how people who are blind and visually impaired are natural problem solvers, as they need to problem solve every day to navigate through a sighted world.

You will love this book if you want to learn more about the benefits of employing people who are blind and visually impaired, if you are hoping to learn how to accommodate an employee who is blind and visually impaired, or if you want to learn how to include employees who are blind and visually impaired into the company’s diversity, equity, and inclusion programs.

Leading Blind without Vision: The Struggles of Visually Impaired and Blind Individuals that Lead to Success is a nonfiction book that speaks to business owners, executives, and HR professionals who want to explore the unique qualities and the benefits of hiring people who are blind and visually impaired in a new way.
 

The Book - Leading Blind without Vision: The Struggles of Visually Impaired and Blind Individuals that Lead to Success



The book is written into 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1, 2, and 3. This section of the book addresses the history of discrimination against people who are blind and visually impaired. You will hear about the unfortunate story of doctor Dr. Mona Minkara who goes to interview at a university, and is subjected to many inappropriate questions during their interview.
Readers will also learn about human senses. You will discover how the brain redirects the senses of a person who is blind and visually impaired to compensate for their vision loss. Lastly, this section covers accessibility technology, and some of the tools that allow this population to perform any job that they are in which they are qualified.

Part 2 contains chapters 4,5,6,7,8, and 9. This section talks about the skills that people who are blind and visually impaired use on a daily basis to move around a sighted world that employers want in their employees. Readers will hear a story about how a blind chef prepares his day to make sure that he is at work on time, and how he stays after to make sure his delivery is placed in its proper place that he will be able to locate it when he needs it.

Part 3 contains chapters 10, 11, 12, 13, and the appendix. This section identifies ways that business owners, executives, and HR professionals can further educate themselves to learn more about the positive asset that people who are blind and visually impaired can bring to their businesses. In this section, Meg O’Connell, Founder and CEO of Global Disability Inclusion, describes what a well-thought-out diversity, equity, and inclusion program looks like.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Welby Broaddus is the chief owner and operator of the business consulting firm, Broaddus Business Solutions. As a visually impaired businessman, he hopes to use his influence to help the less fortunate and those without a voice. Its been often said that Welby is able to hold a conversation with anyone, and he likes to say that he “never meets a stranger.”

Welby wrote Leading Blind without Vision: The Struggles of Visually Impaired and Blind Individuals that Lead to Their Success to educate business owners, executives, and HR professionals on the benefits of hiring individuals who are blind and visually impaired. He hopes to use this book to help educate the business community about the qualities and skillsets that the blind and visually impaired community can bring into the workplace.

Welby enjoys watching travel shows where he gets new ideas for his next adventure. He also enjoys bicycling, exercising, and music. Welby is an avid music lover, and particularly enjoys listening to live music.

For more information, you can connect with Welby Broaddus at broaddusbizsol@gmail.com, broaddusbizsol.com, Facebook: Broaddus Business Solutions, Linkedin: broaddusbizsol and Twitter: broaddusbizsol.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LeadingBlindwithoutVision and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Welby Broaddus
