story:
Story of My Book

The curse of democracy is that voting is the only agent of change. But figuring out what's happening in American politics in the midst of constant media exposure and disinformation is exhausting. Instead of succumbing to this disease of attrition, Ballot Boxing explores the trends that shape the political landscape we face today and proves that everyday Americans have the ultimate control over our democracy.

My name is Lucy Santora and I am the author of Ballot Boxing. I wrote this book because of my own roadblocks in voting in the 2020 election and frustration with the partisan coverage of voting rights in the media. I wanted to create something that took the political posturing and heady verbiage out of the equation and focus on reality.  

In reading this book, you will discover how heavily our current political landscape can be influenced by the everyday American--including you. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for American democracy. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take charge of your community and wield power through voting.

In this book, you'll learn about how we got to this point and what we can do now that we're here. You'll hear stories such as...
  • How Madison Cawthorn went from a college dropout to the youngest congressman and sweetheart of the Republican party;
  • Why “The Squad” is not some woke phenomenon but actually a domino effect of local groups getting out the vote; and
  • How your local political sphere is the laboratory for new legislation and new politicians, making local elections even more important for the future of our country 

You will love this book if you are proud to be American, want a non-partisan breakdown of our political landscape, or survived the 2020 election cycle and feel exhausted by the media.  

Ballot Boxing is a nonfiction book that speaks to everyday Americans regardless of political party who want to look at voting and democracy in a new way.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the softcover edition gets published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition

About the Author

Lucy Santora wears multiple consultant hats and is a member of the Pacific Council on International Policy, an organization that builds civic participation in global affairs through cross-sector partnerships and diplomacy. She holds a Master’s of Public Diplomacy and Bachelors of International Relations from the University of Southern California.  

Santora decided to write this book because of her palpable frustration and the disinformation surrounding the 2020 election. She wants to tell the unadulterated truth about the state of American politics, with the goal of helping her fellow citizens realize the power they intrinsically hold.  

When she’s not neck deep in current events she can be found ordering guac for the table at a local tex-mex joint or convincing her friends to go on an early morning hike.  

For more information, you can connect with Lucy Santora at lucy.santora@gmail.com and on Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form https://forms.gle/oXY39b4nzopGBKms7 to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #ballotboxing and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Facebook - @lucysantora / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter - @lucysantora / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lucy Santora

story:
My name is Shysel Granados and I am the author of cafecito. I wrote this book because I wanted to share my stories and experiences with my readers. As a child, I was very shy and quiet and rarely spoke up. Now through writing, I can articulate my thoughts and opinions clearly and freely. Writing cafecito has helped me in so many ways that I hope my readers will be inspired to write for themselves, not just for academic reasons.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how rewarding self-reflection and gratitude is. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to love and appreciate the special people in your life, to live in the small and mundane moments, and to explore writing in different genres.

You will love this book if you love short stories and essays; enjoy reading about other people’s lives; if you’re a fan of David Sedaris (my essays are more touchy-feely and not as snarky as Sedaris); or if you’re thinking about writing lyrical essays in your spare time.

cafecito speaks to Latinos and young adults who want to grapple with growing up and gaining independence from their families but still remaining close in heart.

Ultimately, I hope that cafecito inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can I learn to appreciate the small and “mundane” moments more often?
  • How would I adjust to living in a new city without being able to travel back and forth to visit my family?
  • Do I want to incorporate writing into my daily routine? Even if it is journaling and no one will see it?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 


Shysel Granados is an author, foodie, and educator. She has worked with kids, mentoring them and encouraging them to be their best selves while also growing in different ways.Her passions include cooking (and eating) good food, painting, running, and enjoying an iced latte with her friends and family. (Cafe con pan dulce is a must.)

She wrote cafecito as a way to express and organize her thoughts and inner reflections creatively. Writing cafecito has allowed her to look at her experiences and look at them from a new perspective and created this collection to share with her community.

This is the first of many projects Shysel Granados has embarked on and while she acknowledges there is a lot more to writing, she is willing to explore and try different genres and techniques to expand her skill set. She has a lot to learn but she hopes to have fun and share her stories with her readers and most importantly, her friends and family.

For more information, you can connect with Shysel Granados at shyselgranados@gmail.com and Instagram and LinkedIn.

 

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form  to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit )

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

story:
Story of My Book

Beyond Honey is a book about honey bees and their impact on our society, including stories about economic, entrepreneurial, and environmental impact. These stories show how these tiny creatures affect our lives for the good. I also share about the benefits and challenges of our interconnected world, specifically the relationship between humans and the environment. 

My name is Tierney Monahan and I am the author of Beyond Honey. I'm a beekeeper myself and I've read a lot of books that were manuals, how-tos, and books about bee biology. These books detailed honey bees themselves rather than how honey bees can and do play a role in revitalizing communities, offering alternative income possibilities, and providing hive products that can be used for medicinal purposes.

We have a certain idea about bees, right? They’re either scary and to be feared, or simply the producer of honey, a product that we consume. Of course, honey is amazing and we should appreciate it, but, even beyond that, we miss the core lesson and core truth: we need honey bees for our survival as humans, primarily due to their pollination services which pollinate about one-third of our food source. 

I wanted to share inspiring stories about people who are making incredible differences in the lives of diverse populations through beekeeping opportunities. These populations include the incarcerated, formerly incarcerated, former miners, veterans, first responders, urban dwellers, and rural farmers. They are benefiting from training opportunities with honey bees to revitalize their economies, explore new methods of financial stability, or to simply reconnect with nature.

My hope for this book is that I can debunk the myth that honey bees are dangerous and really show that not only are they not as aggressive as people imagine them to be, but also that the impact goes beyond the commercial product of honey that we buy. I aim to prove there is value in working with your hands, working with nature, and working with community. A lot of personal growth and personal reflection happens during beekeeping due to the methodical nature of it. It's very meditative and therapeutic. I hope that this book can highlight stories of people who have collaborated with bees to impact their lives for the better.

In this book, you'll learn about the economic, entrepreneurial, and environmental impacts of honey bees. Learn from a number of amazing individuals and organizations on why honey bees are important, what they can teach us, and what lessons we can learn from them. Here are just three stories (of many!) that are shared in the book:

  • Mission Beelieve (MD): An organization that provides beekeeping training to veterans and first responders. They created the foundation with hands-on workshops and seminars, to help veterans begin to feel some peace, learn a new trade, and connect with the community while embracing the therapeutic and vocational aspects of beekeeping.
  • Sustainability in Prisons Project (WA): An organization that partners with the Washington State Department of Corrections to empower sustainable change by bringing nature, science, and environmental education into prisons.
  • Under the Mango Tree Society (India): An organization that works with smallholder farmers in tribal communities on beekeeping with indigenous bees. This leads to conservation of the keystone species of local honey bees, and increases yields and incomes for farming communities through better pollination and diversifying livelihoods.

 

All three of these projects train diverse populations in the art and science of beekeeping. It opens a pathway for them, to work on their personal growth and connection with others, and for some, improve their economic situation through alternative income sources. It allows people to focus on something positive and productive, and perhaps even find a deeper meaning to their lives.

You'll love this book if you are interested in: the environment, understanding where your food comes from, the connection between animals and humans, and exploring the need we have for connection.
 

The Book - Beyond Honey

The book is written in four parts, with an introduction and conclusion.

Part 1 contains chapters 1-2 about how human survival is linked to bee survival and how bees can be our teachers. I touch on the need for connection and a framework for rethinking our relationship with bees.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6 about economic impact. In this section, there are stories about incarcerated students who are contributing to science and cultivating positive self-image through beekeeping. I also share about overcoming trauma and the need for community in healing, especially as it relates to veterans and first responders.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9 about entrepreneurial impact. In this section, there are stories about revitalizing communities through beekeeping efforts, as well as a discussion on the medicinal qualities of hive products.

Part 4 contains chapters 10-11 about environmental impact. In this section, the focus is on how human involvement affects bees, climate change, and pollination services.
 

What I Need & What You'll Receive

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. The mockups you see on this page are currently placeholders.
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy and e-book formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in August 2021.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and e-book. I will donate 10% of the funds raised above the goal amount to Mission Beelieve.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • You will receive early access to the introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and provide early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my author community and receive behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • and more!
 

About the Author

Tierney Monahan is a writer, beekeeper, and MBA candidate at the McDonough School of Business at Georgetown University. Prior to business school, Tierney spent many years as an educator, community outreach specialist, and development professional at non-profits in Canada, Ecuador, Italy, and Washington, DC. She received her B.A. from McGill University and still misses the summers in Montreal. In her free time, she enjoys beekeeping, gardening, hiking, reading, and creating art. 

For more information, you can connect with Tierney Monahan at tierneymonahan.com, and at:
  • LinkedIn
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

 

International Preorders

For international preorders (especially my Canadian, Ecuadorian, and Italian friends - Merci! Gracias! Grazie!), please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that this is an uncertain time and financial concerns are very real. I would love for you to help my campaign in other ways:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter with your friends, family, and network. Please use #BeyondHoneyBook and tag me (@tierneymonahan) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress), so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book via your blog, by email, by text, by carrier pigeon, etc. with anyone who you think would enjoy it.

 

I couldn’t be(e) more thankful for your support!

With gratitude,

Tierney

I aim to prove there is value in working with your hands, working with nature, and working with community. A lot of personal growth and personal reflection happens during beekeeping due to the methodical nature of it. It's very meditative and therapeutic. I hope that this book can highlight stories of people who have collaborated with bees to impact their lives for the better.In this book, you'll learn about the economic, entrepreneurial, and environmental impacts of honey bees. Learn from a number of amazing individuals and organizations on why honey bees are important, what they can teach us, and what lessons we can learn from them. Here are just three stories (of many!) that are shared in the book:


Mission Beelieve (MD): An organization that provides beekeeping training to veterans and first responders. They created the foundation with hands-on workshops and seminars, to help veterans begin to feel some peace, learn a new trade, and connect with the community while embracing the therapeutic and vocational aspects of beekeeping.

Sustainability in Prisons Project (WA): An organization that partners with the Washington State Department of Corrections to empower sustainable change by bringing nature, science, and environmental education into prisons.

Under the Mango Tree Society (India): An organization that works with smallholder farmers in tribal communities on beekeeping with indigenous bees. This leads to conservation of the keystone species of local honey bees, and increases yields and incomes for farming communities through better pollination and diversifying livelihoods.

 
All three of these projects train diverse populations in the art and science of beekeeping. It opens a pathway for them, to work on their personal growth and connection with others, and for some, improve their economic situation through alternative income sources. It allows people to focus on something positive and productive, and perhaps even find a deeper meaning to their lives.You'll love this book if you are interested in: the environment, understanding where your food comes from, the connection between animals and humans, and exploring the need we have for connection. 
The Book - Beyond HoneyThe book is written in four parts, with an introduction and conclusion.Part 1 contains chapters 1-2 about how human survival is linked to bee survival and how bees can be our teachers. I touch on the need for connection and a framework for rethinking our relationship with bees.Part 2 contains chapters 4-6 about economic impact. In this section, there are stories about incarcerated students who are contributing to science and cultivating positive self-image through beekeeping. I also share about overcoming trauma and the need for community in healing, especially as it relates to veterans and first responders.Part 3 contains chapters 7-9 about entrepreneurial impact. In this section, there are stories about revitalizing communities through beekeeping efforts, as well as a discussion on the medicinal qualities of hive products.Part 4 contains chapters 10-11 about environmental impact. In this section, the focus is on how human involvement affects bees, climate change, and pollination services. What I Need & What You'll Receive
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
The cover design of my book. The mockups you see on this page are currently placeholders.
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy and e-book formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch and promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in August 2021.

 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and e-book. I will donate 10% of the funds raised above the goal amount to Mission Beelieve.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
You will receive early access to the introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and provide early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my author community and receive behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
and more!
 About the Author Tierney Monahan is a writer, beekeeper, and MBA candidate at the McDonough School of Business at Georgetown University. Prior to business school, Tierney spent many years as an educator, community outreach specialist, and development professional at non-profits in Canada, Ecuador, Italy, and Washington, DC. She received her B.A. from McGill University and still misses the summers in Montreal. In her free time, she enjoys beekeeping, gardening, hiking, reading, and creating art. For more information, you can connect with Tierney Monahan at tierneymonahan.com, and at:
LinkedIn
Instagram
Twitter

 
International Preorders For international preorders (especially my Canadian, Ecuadorian, and Italian friends - Merci! Gracias! Grazie!), please send me a private message. Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help I understand that this is an uncertain time and financial concerns are very real. I would love for you to help my campaign in other ways:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter with your friends, family, and network. Please use #BeyondHoneyBook and tag me (@tierneymonahan) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress), so that we can help amplify your efforts.
Please share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book via your blog, by email, by text, by carrier pigeon, etc. with anyone who you think would enjoy it.

 
I couldn’t be(e) more thankful for your support!With gratitude,Tierney

story:
Who I Am

I was appointed as Lake County, CA's eleventh Poet Laureate in March of this year and will serve two years in this role. I was elated when I found out I was chosen as the next poet laureate of my home county, an accomplishment I am most proud of and an honor I wholeheartedly respect. I had been a finalist for the 2018-2020 term and spent two years since building momentum in the literary community of Lake County via events, readings, and networking. Only days later after the great news that I was selected as our new poet laureate, the COVID-19 pandemic began to impact our community as officials began closing businesses and ordering our current shelter in place. Now at the end of November 2020 there is no sight of the end of this pandemic just yet. 

Despite the pandemic, after announcing my laureateship on social media I received such loving and encouraging messages from friends, family, and writers expressing their faith in my leadership in an uncertain time. Yes, we need to stay physically distant from one another to protect our most vulnerable fellow humans and ourselves but that’s not to say we can’t remain close and connected through our creativity. So I took action right away in my new role, creating virtual readings, open mics, workshops, and promoting my literary community on social media.  

So far, I've created a poetry column in collaboration with the Lake County Bloom, a bi-weekly writers circle with the Lake County Arts Council, a farmers’ market poetry contest with Lake County Farmers’ Finest, a radio show with KPFZ 88.1 FM, and organized and hosted a number of readings and workshop including a reading for the LGBTQ+ community, a reading to raise awareness of  immigrants in detention centers, a rain-themed reading to manifest rain after wildfires; workshops on the topics of writing and self-doubt or reframing trauma, and much more. Since all events are virtual during this time, I am also able to invite guests from other counties, even other states, which brings awareness to others of our rural county and offers a wide array of creative exposure to our locals who may otherwise not be able to experience. 

Lake County is fortunate to have a rich, diverse literary community of writers from all backgrounds and experience, genres and styles; from poetry to fiction, non-fiction to memoir and I aim to continue the momentum of cultivating a literary community of inclusivity and diversity by offering and sharing a variety of virtual writing events during COVID-19. Poetry brings us together in the human experience, even in isolation, even in loneliness. There is a sense of resilience and continuity that can be found as a writer if you keep at it and keep working the muscles of memory, of expression, of sharing in supportive spaces. 

 

Why I am Asking for Funding

Which brings me to this ask: the Poet Laureate program in Lake County is entirely volunteer based and is not financially supported by any entities or organizations and is not financially supported by the county.  I am in the process of applying for various grants but in the meantime, I continue to do all of my planning and events on an unpaid basis and occasionally, I may pay out of pocket to fund contests, writers, etc. So I am opening this up to my local community and communities beyond to contribute any dollar amount to provide funds that will support my work and my ability to pay local writers to co-facilitate workshops or be featured readers at special events! This funding would especially support local writers in this community during the pandemic. Any amount will make a difference. 

 

What Your Monetary Contribution Will Do

My goal is to raise $1000 and to be completely transparent about how that amount is raised and how it is used. My vision is to be able to support writers in their interests of facilitating writing workshops by being able to pay them for their time, when hosting special readings, I'd love to be able to pay each reader for their time and work, and I'd love to pay a local resident who crafts poetry boxes to be able to put up more in different towns around the lake. As writers, we don't often get paid for what we do and we do it because we absolutely love it but it is nice to be recognized in such a way. Any dollar amount you donate will be used to fund all of the above. Even if my goal of $1000 is not met, I will still use the entire amount I do raise for precisely all of this. 

 

And there are some fun perks if you donate!

  • Donate $5.00 and receive a personalized thank you email from me

  • Donate $10.00 and receive a thank you postcard from me via snail mail

  • Donate $20 and receive a thank you postcard plus special mentions on my social media pages

  • Donate 50.00 and receive a postcard, social media mentions, plus a special mention on my personal website 

  • Donate $100 or more and receive a thank you postcard, social media and website mentions, plus a customized poem written for you

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign
  • Share on Facebook, Instagram, and/or Twitter
  • Share with your network via email or on your website

story:
WHAT'S ALL THIS, THEN?

UNKNOWN ARMIES is a horror or urban fantasy game about damaged people, desperate to repair the world. If you like tabletop roleplaying games, you may be familiar with it. It's also been a basis for some of my well-regarded novels -- Godwalker, YOU: A Fiction and (to a lesser extent) Switchflipped. 

If you don't know my work, first off, let me say that's great. I'm always happy to reach new readers. There is a lot of it online you can read for free, because it has been subsidized by previous readers (who are also great). This is the process I want to repeat with this project. 

I'd recommend going to my online fiction library and checking out the variety of weird stuff, crime fiction and little drips of realism on display. For this project, the closest in tone are probably the following.

I Am A Psychic Assassin For The US Army. This recent work is about people trying to deal rationally with transrational phenomena like psychic abilities. One of the stories in this project deals with the question of psychic assassination from a more explicitly UNKNOWN ARMIES position. 

Ghosts: The Straight Dope. An actual UNKNOWN ARMIES tale, in which a filthy old writer talks about the afterlife.

ENZYMES. A weird, elegiac, mythic setting, incompletely conveyed by confused individuals trapped in it and just trying to get by. Also a splendid podcast.

The Turning Of The Time. A story about a woman, again, trying to get by with regular life stuff despite the intrusion of illogical power beyond human knowing.

If you liked those, odds are good you will also enjoy the three new stories I've got ready to go.

THE NEW STORIES!

All three of these stories share one character: Former rock drummer, current affable layabout Mick Peltier. If you had the opportunity to exchange all your common sense for money, charm, confidence, some cool tattoos and unreliable psychic visions, would you do it? Because if you did, you'd end up very much like Mick.

Mick and Amanda and Reesa and Craig. Our boy Mick is a minor character in this one, which is narrated by an aging guy with a checkered past. He gets roped in to help out with some malignant paranormal phenomena, despite neither believing in them or having any experience with them. We get a lot of his backstory, which turns out to be unexpectedly relevant. The working title when I started this was just "violence story," so know that going in. If I get $1000, it goes up on my web site for everyone. It's a little over 8,000 words long. 

Mick and the Spoon Bender. The first story I wrote with Mick introduces him as he leverages the tatters of musical fame to try and get a podcast going. He wants to hear about life as a CIA psychic from someone who wants to hear about life as a rock and roll idol. This one's 4,700 words, and gets released if we reach $1500.

Mick and the Fit. The most orthodox UNKNOWN ARMIES of these tales is about what, if you squint, looks like something the game fans would call a "variant epideromancer" and, to other people, "someone whose life has been absolutely destroyed." Mick meets her just at the point where she's starting to turn the lemons of personal trauma into the lemonade of reality-breaking occult power. Mick and the Fit is 6,200 words, but I'll put it out there if we hit $2000.

MORE REWARDS!

The main course here is getting new short fiction out under a CC: license, but just for fun, I've got some rewards to encourage generosity, and because people enjoy them.

The first is this spiffy patch for Schröedinger's Cat Press, the publisher that may or may not be alive depending on how many people look at it. Pledge at the right level and I mail one to your house. Easy.

T

They don't have anything to do with the stories, but I make linocut art prints and people seem to like them. Pledge at the level that gets one and I mail it to your house. There are a lot of them, all the same pattern but with a lot of variety in ink effects. You get one at random. It's like gambling, only there's no way I wind up taking your house!

Finally if you like long-form fiction, you can pledge to get electronic copies of Godwalker, and YOU: A Fiction, my two UNKNOWN ARMIES novels. Click the links in the very first paragraph if you're curious, there's lots to learn.

IN CONCLUSION

All these stories are written, edited, and largely ready to go. If it looks like there's demand and y'all are steamrolling the stretch goals, I have more gas in the tank, too--completed stories about gross crimes, cosmic horror and hilarious bureaucracy, so even if you've pledged, check in now and again.

Thanks!

-G.

story:
Hello! 

My name is Christina Scott and I've written a children's picture book–Miss Perilla Magilla and her Marvellous Desk. 

I'm raising funds to put Perilla Magilla into print. Mostly, it's to cover illustration costs. 

The illustrator I'm working with is Laura McKenzie Atkins (Weebird20art). Here's a mock-up she made:

Blurb

Perilla Magilla is a fantastic inventor, who spends most of her time creating weird and wonderful things. But, as is often the case, finding a place to keep everything has become a bit of a hassle. Fortunately, she’s managed to come up with a rather marvellous solution...

Sample

Have you heard of a place called Implestiltzland?
A place where fantastical things are at hand?
With gadgets and doo-dads and goblins as well,
Pixies and beasties and stories to tell.
Come with me now, and we'll take a peek down,
And see what's going on in Implestiltztown.

The Implestiltz people are pixies of sorts,
Gentle and slight and all rather short.
Nimble and quick with their thin hands and feet,
The most precise creatures you ever could meet.
They do delicate work with their delicate hands,
Clockwork and woodwork and pictures with sand.
But if you want something special, you must pay a call,
On Miss Perilla Magilla, the cleverest of all.

For Perilla Magilla has inventions galore,
Not a day goes by where she doesn't make more.
Things for cooking and cleaning and fixing the car,
Even a machine for counting the stars!
But however much colour they brought to the place
They were certainly taking up far too much space.

She called on her cousin, Lobelia Blue,
To come help her think about what she could do.
Lobelia arrived at about twenty to ten,
“Perilla, you can't be inventing again!”
“I was patching the crack the windowsill,”
Perilla explained as she put down her drill.
“Besides, I've already thought of a plan,
I just need you here to lend me a hand.
I have an invention I'm willing to bet,
Will be considered my greatest one yet.”

story:
Short Summary

You are sitting in a director’s chair. Or you are in the middle of a scene. Or you are editing footage. But how did you get there? How do you get into the entertainment industry especially if you have no connections? How do up and coming people of color find opportunities in entertainment? All these questions are answered in a book.

My name is Mallika Chennupaty and I am the author of Greenlight: Breaking into Entertainment. I wrote this book because I am deeply interested in joining the entertainment industry, but I don’t know anyone in the industry and I don’t know what I want to do. Furthermore, as a woman of color, there are unique challenges that the industry presents. 


My hope for writing this book is two-fold. First, I hope to find the confidence to pursue a career in the entertainment industry. Second, I hope that you unearth the information and self-belief to pursue different paths in entertainment. I am part of the audience that I am writing for: people of color interested in entertainment. I hope this book will be a personal guide to breaking into the entertainment industry as much for you as it has been for me. 

I want you to see this book as an opportunity to overcome the fear of stepping outside of your comfort zone, and as a collection of stories/memories/advice for creatives of color from all walks of the industry, including acting, writing, directing and even entertainment reporting. 


Greenlight speaks to people interested in pursuing a career in the entertainment industry and anyone who loves hearing stories of others who want to grapple with joining a network-based industry with no connections and being a creative of color in a white-dominated industry in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Greenlight inspires reflection and drives change, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can you use your self-belief to overcome challenges and follow an unconventional path?
  • How can you tap into your creativity to tell meaningful stories?
  • How has the recent shift towards diversity of all sorts in Hollywood reflected in the careers of creatives of color? 
  • How can we uplift and energize creatives of color in an industry where connections pave the way?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with all of you, my peers and community!

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals


Standard Tiers:
Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)

Short Summary
You are sitting in a director’s chair. Or you are in the middle of a scene. Or you are editing footage. But how did you get there? How do you get into the entertainment industry especially if you have no connections? How do up and coming people of color find opportunities in entertainment? All these questions are answered in a book.My name is Mallika Chennupaty and I am the author of Greenlight: Breaking into Entertainment. I wrote this book because I am deeply interested in joining the entertainment industry, but I don’t know anyone in the industry and I don’t know what I want to do. Furthermore, as a woman of color, there are unique challenges that the industry presents. My hope for writing this book is two-fold. First, I hope to find the confidence to pursue a career in the entertainment industry. Second, I hope that you unearth the information and self-belief to pursue different paths in entertainment. I am part of the audience that I am writing for: people of color interested in entertainment. I hope this book will be a personal guide to breaking into the entertainment industry as much for you as it has been for me. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to overcome the fear of stepping outside of your comfort zone, and as a collection of stories/memories/advice for creatives of color from all walks of the industry, including acting, writing, directing and even entertainment reporting. Greenlight speaks to people interested in pursuing a career in the entertainment industry and anyone who loves hearing stories of others who want to grapple with joining a network-based industry with no connections and being a creative of color in a white-dominated industry in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that Greenlight inspires reflection and drives change, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can you use your self-belief to overcome challenges and follow an unconventional path?
How can you tap into your creativity to tell meaningful stories?
How has the recent shift towards diversity of all sorts in Hollywood reflected in the careers of creatives of color? 
How can we uplift and energize creatives of color in an industry where connections pave the way?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with all of you, my peers and community!

story:
Meet The Doctor

What pushes your inner darkness?
Do we all have an alter ego who will defend us against the evil in this world?
How far will we go to defend those we love?

My name is Sally Barrilla and I am the author of The Doctor. I wrote this book at first as a personal reflection on myself since, as a victim of bullying, I have always wondered if there was an alter ego of myself who knew how to defend herself from the start. Someone who looked exactly like me but was a total and absolute badass.

As a proud daughter and granddaughter of Spanish-speaking Ecuadorian immigrants, my dream was to bring forth creativity and imagination once my teachers presented me with essays, novels, short stories, and much more. There is so much potential that is brought forth by words.

The Doctor is the epic story of a fearless private detective who utilizes passion and determination in her journey to seek revenge against a ruthless doctor and regain some form of peace.

This novel is a psychological thriller full of suspense, mystery, and guaranteed to give you goosebumps. The setting takes place in suburban North Carolina, a town full of sunshine with barely any rain. Our protagonist is Sasha, a bisexual woman who suffered harsh tragedies and was forced to undergo the worst disaster of her life. Her companions are Naomi and Max, two individuals who share similar goals as Sasha: to seek the ultimate revenge. The antagonist is Dr. Jonathan Morgan whose desire to harm innocent children immediately makes him Sasha’s target.

You will love this book if you love thrillers taken up a notch, intense suspense and drama, and mystery that shakes you to your core.

The Doctor speaks to young adults and thriller and horror fanatics who want to grapple with embracing one’s inner darkness and choosing between one’s heart, sadness, or anger to discover if vengeance is worth it or not.

Ultimately, I hope that The Doctor inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Do our alter egos have a good or bad side? Do we ourselves have those? Which one is more powerful, weaker than the other, or are they equally the same?
  • During our most vulnerable moments, which emotion is stronger: revenge or moving on? If revenge has the potential to push out our inner darkness then does moving on have the power to keep it inside?
  • Does every human being have an alter ego? Do we simply have the versions we know, born and raised?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it, along with a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

 

About the Author

Sally Barrilla is a murder mystery blogger and media associate. She believes in the power of words, writing, and says that if you can’t write at the moment, stop before trying again. Her passions are reading thriller books, listening to murder mystery podcasts, blogging, learning to cook, and spending time with loved ones.

Sally wrote this book because she was always fascinated with the creativity and imagination of words. She was also interested in pursuing a deeper understanding as to whether or not there are actually alter egos of everyone in the world, nestled inside one’s heart and just waiting to come out.

From 2009 to 2012, Sally first encountered traumatic experiences with bullying and she often found herself thinking of another version of herself who knew how to defend her from those who tried to put her down or make her feel small or less than. Throughout the years, and with the help of amazing counselors, Sally finally realized that while she can’t change the past, the future can always change with the grace of God. She found a lot of healing in journaling and writing stories and these ultimately became her passion. Especially thanks to her most trusted friend and who she considers her person like Meredith and Cristina are to one another in Grey’s Anatomy. Michael, who constantly encouraged her to write and blog, she couldn’t be more even grateful for his push for her success and she always hopes for the best for him as well.

Sally is a self proclaimed bookworm, murder mystery junkie, and proud English honors major from CUNY Lehman College. Her favorite subject is always creative writing because of the potential it can bring.

For more information, you can connect with Sally Barrilla at sallybarrilla98@gmail.com and on Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and TikTok.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  1. Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks.
  2. Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page).
  3. Message me at sallybarrilla98@gmail.com to share your mailing address so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #TheDoctor and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Thanks again,

story:
The Story of The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team

When encountering a six-hundred pound Silverback Gorilla in the rainforest, you must remember rule number one: Don't RUN!!

 

My name is Lisa M. Randolph, the author of the children's book, The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team: Saving Endangered Mountain Gorillas. The idea of this book came from a decades' long journey from my work with some of the most marginalized, at-risk members of American society, Black Girls.  I could not have foreseen the importance and impact this book would have at this pivotal moment in our country. The timing, impeccable. 

I've written this book for several reasons:

LACK OF DIVERSITY. Representation matters.  Children of color, African-American girls specifically, from inner-city neighborhoods, cannot readily find themselves represented on the pages of most children's book. My characters, all African-American, are as never seen before, traveling the seven continents of the world, bringing attention to the plight of critically endangered species and conservation efforts to save them.

FACT: A book about an animal is eight times more likely to be written than a book about a child of color as the main character. (African, Asian, Hispanic, Indigenous, Pacific Islander)

STEM/STEAM. The importance of minorities entering into the realm of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math, cannot be understated. In the near future, the fastest growing segment of the workforce in the  21st century are STEAM related jobs. The future begins now!

FACT: Only 2.9% of Black Women earn degrees across STEM/STEAM fields. 

In my children's book, each member of The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team possesses an element of STEAM.  I feel it necessary and of great importance for Black Girls to see themselves in emotionally healthy, positive roles, in the great outdoors, saving the planet. Preparing, motivating and directing girls to train for high-demand jobs in STEAM fields by example, in the hopes it provides them the freedom to open doors of new opportunities and  careers choices in non-traditional.   By educating a young girl of color, it will uplift her out of poverty and future generations of her family.

 

 

Mountain Gorillas in the Wild

The Importance of Wildlife Conservation and Endangered Species

Mountain Gorillas, Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, Uganda

According to the IUCN (International Union for Conservation of Nature)  Red List of the top 10 most endangered animals on the planet, Mountain Gorillas rank number three on the list.  These majestic beasts, sharing 95-99% DNA with their closest relatives (humans)  live in only three African nations, Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda and Uganda. There are a total of 1004 mountain gorilla left on the entire planet.   Conservation efforts have been stepped up by organizations such as The Gorillas Doctors, The Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund and most recently, The Ellen Fund.

One of many purposes for The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team children's book (series), is to bring attention to the plight of critically endangered animals, sparking an interest and curiosity in the minds and imagination children from inner-city neighborhoods, unaware of such issues taking place in the world.  My hope is by reading this book and future books in the series, it may spark an interest in non-traditional career choices, such as Conversation, Ecology, Wildlife Sciences, and Zoology, just to name a few. 

In addition to STEAM and Wildlife Conservation, the book also includes facts about the country in which they visit, and explores culture, food, music and language, in an excitement filled adventure, with lots of laughs and humor. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I am raising the publishing funds myself to own the book's creative rights and to invite readers on my journey, and I have set up various pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for final publication. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Tier 1: Hit $6,500, I will publish. (This is the minimum needed)

Tier 2: Hit $7.500, I will also publish a hardcover edition. (Everyone receives character art)

Tier 3: Hit $9,500+, I will publish an audiobook! (Everyone receives surprises gifts)

 

INTERNATIONAL ORDERS 

For international preorders, please do the following:

* Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

* Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

* Use this Google Form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSePto3_VFlf2eX33hR9-fIZ3A7sBV_Ch87qn91HGULH18dkLA/viewform?usp=sf_link to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

 

About The Author

Lisa M. Randolph, worked twenty-five years in the telecommunications industry, before retiring and continued working an additional ten years for a non-profit after school program for at-risk girls, located in San Francisco, California. This work is inspiration behind her children’s book series, The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team: Saving the Endangered Mountain Gorilla.

Currently she is a participant in the Georgetown Creator Institute, located in Washington D.C., and will soon work on book two of the series. She has also published a short story, “Raju the Crying Elephant” in the Northern California Publisher and Authors Anthology, 2019 “More Birds of a Feather; An NCPA Anthology.”

Lisa resides in Northern California with her with two small rescue dogs, Rose (a terrier-mix) and Petal (a teacup chihuahua) and admits to being their emotional support animal.

For more information, you can connect with Lisa M. Randolph at email address, wildlifedivas@gmail.com, Follow on Instagram  https://www.instagram.com/lisamrandolph_author/ and via snail mail at:

PO. Box 581386
Elk Grove, CA 95758-9997

 

The Impact

 

Your support will help young girls living in marginalized communities the opportunity to see themselves portrayed as heroines in a book about girls just like them. 

  • A girl reading this book could be the next great, Primatologist, Ecologist, Conservationist. 
  • Increased interest in STEM/STEAM
  • Awareness surrounding conservation efforts in saving Critically Endangered Species

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge with publishing this book has been the death of my husband three weeks ago.  Living in a dual state of emotions, both joy and grief has not been easy. The excitement of my first major publishing accomplishment and delivering the finished book to my backers, has kept me focused. Delivering your books is of the greatest importance to me.

story_txt:
The Story of The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team
When encountering a six-hundred pound Silverback Gorilla in the rainforest, you must remember rule number one: Don't RUN!!

 
My name is Lisa M. Randolph, the author of the children's book, The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team: Saving Endangered Mountain Gorillas. The idea of this book came from a decades' long journey from my work with some of the most marginalized, at-risk members of American society, Black Girls.  I could not have foreseen the importance and impact this book would have at this pivotal moment in our country. The timing, impeccable. 
I've written this book for several reasons:
LACK OF DIVERSITY. Representation matters.  Children of color, African-American girls specifically, from inner-city neighborhoods, cannot readily find themselves represented on the pages of most children's book. My characters, all African-American, are as never seen before, traveling the seven continents of the world, bringing attention to the plight of critically endangered species and conservation efforts to save them.
FACT: A book about an animal is eight times more likely to be written than a book about a child of color as the main character. (African, Asian, Hispanic, Indigenous, Pacific Islander)
STEM/STEAM. The importance of minorities entering into the realm of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math, cannot be understated. In the near future, the fastest growing segment of the workforce in the  21st century are STEAM related jobs. The future begins now!
FACT: Only 2.9% of Black Women earn degrees across STEM/STEAM fields. 
In my children's book, each member of The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team possesses an element of STEAM.  I feel it necessary and of great importance for Black Girls to see themselves in emotionally healthy, positive roles, in the great outdoors, saving the planet. Preparing, motivating and directing girls to train for high-demand jobs in STEAM fields by example, in the hopes it provides them the freedom to open doors of new opportunities and  careers choices in non-traditional.   By educating a young girl of color, it will uplift her out of poverty and future generations of her family.
 
 
Mountain Gorillas in the Wild
The Importance of Wildlife Conservation and Endangered Species

Mountain Gorillas, Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, Uganda
According to the IUCN (International Union for Conservation of Nature)  Red List of the top 10 most endangered animals on the planet, Mountain Gorillas rank number three on the list.  These majestic beasts, sharing 95-99% DNA with their closest relatives (humans)  live in only three African nations, Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda and Uganda. There are a total of 1004 mountain gorilla left on the entire planet.   Conservation efforts have been stepped up by organizations such as The Gorillas Doctors, The Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund and most recently, The Ellen Fund.
One of many purposes for The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team children's book (series), is to bring attention to the plight of critically endangered animals, sparking an interest and curiosity in the minds and imagination children from inner-city neighborhoods, unaware of such issues taking place in the world.  My hope is by reading this book and future books in the series, it may spark an interest in non-traditional career choices, such as Conversation, Ecology, Wildlife Sciences, and Zoology, just to name a few. 
In addition to STEAM and Wildlife Conservation, the book also includes facts about the country in which they visit, and explores culture, food, music and language, in an excitement filled adventure, with lots of laughs and humor. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I am raising the publishing funds myself to own the book's creative rights and to invite readers on my journey, and I have set up various pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for final publication. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Tier 2: Hit $7.500, I will also publish a hardcover edition. (Everyone receives character art)
Tier 3: Hit $9,500+, I will publish an audiobook! (Everyone receives surprises gifts)

Lisa M. Randolph, worked twenty-five years in the telecommunications industry, before retiring and continued working an additional ten years for a non-profit after school program for at-risk girls, located in San Francisco, California. This work is inspiration behind her children’s book series, The Wildlife Divas Adventure Team: Saving the Endangered Mountain Gorilla.Currently she is a participant in the Georgetown Creator Institute, located in Washington D.C., and will soon work on book two of the series. She has also published a short story, “Raju the Crying Elephant” in the Northern California Publisher and Authors Anthology, 2019 “More Birds of a Feather; An NCPA Anthology.”
Lisa resides in Northern California with her with two small rescue dogs, Rose (a terrier-mix) and Petal (a teacup chihuahua) and admits to being their emotional support animal.

A girl reading this book could be the next great, Primatologist, Ecologist, Conservationist.

story:
Daddy, Tell Me a Story is a book about purpose, legacy, leadership and community. In it I share some of the pivotal moments of my father's life and career while sharing insightful life lessons.  After publishing costs, the proceeds from this campaign will be used to support the educational pursuits of students attending Savannah State University (SSU) and Southern University Law Center (SULC) through our family's foundation, JMN C.A.R.E.S.

Hi! I am Attorney Nefertara Clark, the author of Daddy, Tell Me a Story.  I am an alumnae of Savannah State University and Southern University Law Center, and so is my father. Fun fact, my mother also attended SSU. That's where she met my father. But, more about that in the book. :-) That's how we arrived at supporting scholars of these illustrious institutions. I wrote this book as a means to share my father's life and legacy while also continuing my parents' legacy of supporting scholars. 

The journey of writing the first draft of my manuscript was much more daunting than I expected. You see, I write 40,000 word appellate briefs for clients I've only known for a few months. So, I figured it would be extremely easy to write a 40,000 word book about a man I've known and adored my entire life. That wasn't the case. But, by the grace of God, I have completed my manuscript. 

You will laugh, cry and think deeply about the stories you’ll read. You will love this book if you like an interesting story about those who have had unique life experiences. In this book, you should expect to read stories about:

  • My father's decision to stop consuming alcohol,
  • The threat on his life as a result of courtroom victories for people of color seeking elected office and city jobs, and 
  • His lifelong belief in God and his ability to see the bigger picture. 

I  believe in God, purpose, community and legacy. In reading this book, it is my prayer that this book will encourage and edify others as they intentionally pursue their purpose. 

Please watch my promotional video above and choose your level of support (perk). 

Because of academic scholarships, I was fortunate enough to leave not only undergrad, but also  law school without any student loans to interrupt my post graduation financial endeavors. At the time, I didn't realize how fortunate I was; now, I certainly do. As a result, it is my desire to offer financial assistance to  students attending our alma maters - SSU and SULC.

 

Nefertara Clark is an attorney by profession and an encourager by calling. She lives in Atlanta and serves as lead attorney at the Atlanta location of Clark & Clark Law Group, LLC, the private law practice she runs with her father. Her passion projects are those dealing with estate planning and generational asset protection. In addition to graduating from two (2) phenomenal HBCUs, she is a 2011 graduate of The University of Connecticut School of Law. In her limited free time, she enjoys traveling to new destinations - domestic and abroad, cooking, crafting, listening to good music and reading a great book, all while being accompanied by her shadow, her dog Giada, affectionately known as GiGi. 

For more information, you can connect with Nefertara at Nefertara@clarkandclarklawgroup.com and on Facebook, Instagram, Linked-In and Twitter.

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I have eliminated the risk by including the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies and social justice swag in the campaign support packages. The first $8,500.00 raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to ensure my book is polished prior to publication.
  • When I pre-sell 220 copies of my book (or the equivalent), I will publish a paperback, ebook and hardback!

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • Early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • Social justice swag, including a lapel pin, quote cards, metal book mark, magnet and other physical perks when the book ships. 
  • An opportunity to be involved in helping me select my book cover and sub-title.
  • An invitation to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process. 
  • Shipping. 
  • And so much more!

And for those who purchase in the first 3 days of our launch, you'll receive a surprise item! 

All proceeds exceeding publishing costs will be donated to scholars at SSU and SULC. 

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)

Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition

Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and the book is eligible to have an audio version. 

BONUS: Everything over $,8500 goes directly into the hands of students. 

 

For international preorders, please do the following:
  1. Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  2. Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  3. Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies and social justice swag.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship to me for signing and when they are expected to ship out to you.

We get it! Some people are unable to contribute financially. Thankfully, there are still other ways you can help. 

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Linked-In and Twitter. You may also share it via text and email. 
  • I will provide 3* referral rewards (1 each) to:
    • (1) the person who shares their referral link the greatest number of times;  
    • (2) the person who refers the highest number (quantity) of backers; and 
    • (3) the person who refers the most financial support. 

* 1 reward per person and per household. 

Here's how to participate:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will  create an account with your name and email. You will then navigate to the top of this campaign page and look for the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: Don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit!!)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover or supporter of great causes.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 
  • Please use #daddytellmeastory and tag me, as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
    Our Social Media Tags: 
    Instragram - @clarkandclarklawgroup / @newdegreepress
    Facebook - @NefertaraClark/ @NewDegreePress 
    Twitter - @JdAKAProf / @NewDegreePress

And that's all there is to it.

Together we stand, 

Nefertara Clark
